loans.name: Phy

texts.en: Mrs. Phy U. is a villager in Trapeang Phlu village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sam Khon, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Phy U. has five children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while two others drive motorbikes with a cart to transport passengers and goods for an income. The youngest one is attending the local school. Although they try to work hard, they do not earn enough income to support the family, and they do not have any money to buy a new cart for their children's business. The cart is too old. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Phy U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new cart for her children's transportation business. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new cart for her children's transportation business.

loans.name: Narayan Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Narayan Devi M., 33, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, Nepal. Thecho is one of the beautiful, underdeveloped villages of Nepal. Most of the people of this region are poor and depend on agriculture to make a living. 

Mrs. M. has two children, a daughter and a son. Both her children are studying in grade 7.

Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop four years ago. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulses (legumes), biscuits and noodles in her shop. Her children also help her in her work. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in her area, so she is requesting a loan of NPR 30,000 to buy grocery items to meet the demand.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Fairness #3 Group

texts.en:
Tarnue S. S. is the leader of a group of borrowers called Fairness #3. He is 32 years old and is married with a 7-year-old child, who is in 4th grade. Tarnue is a university student.

He and his family live in the Buzzie Quarter community and work on Margeret Street in Voinjama city, the capital of Lofa county in northern Liberia. His business is the sale of petroleum. He buys gas and fuel from wholesalers and sells retail to drivers in Voinjama.

Tarnue has been running this business for two years and is hoping to improve his business to a petroleum station in the near future. He offers good service to his customers in order to encourage customers to continue buying from him.

Tarnue needs this loan to purchase more gas and fuel to improve business. He has been facing financial constraints over the years with his business. Tarnue dreams of being a help to his kid and the rest of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more gas and fuel to improve business

loans.name: Abd Al Azez

texts.en:
Growing grape vines!

Abd Al Azez M. is a young Palestinian man aged 29 years old. He is married with three young children aged 4, 3 and 1 year old.

Abd al Azez is an employee of the Palestinian National Authority. In addition to this job he owns land where he grows grape vines and sell his grapes in the market or to juice factories. Qabatia where Abdl Azez and his family live is famous for its delicious grapes and fertile soil.

As Mr. M. enjoys taking care of grapes, he would like to buy an additional piece of land and buy new seedlings. So he requested a loan of 2,500 USD from FATEN to expand his project as it’s successful and the expansion would positively impact his family’s income

Abd Al-Azez appears in the photo next to his lovely grape vines.

loans.use: To buy an additional piece of land on which to grow more grape vines

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Ngọc's Group

texts.en: B. Nguyễn Thị Ngọc (10107030005) is a 26-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà nội. B. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vạn Lộc (1). B. is married and has two infant children. She operates a specialized retail store selling electronic products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month. In 2006, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,142,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. B. is now requesting a new loan of 5,014,000 VND which will again be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Nguyễn Thị H. (10107030002) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. 2. Nguyễn Thị D. (10107030003) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 3. Lê Thị Mỵ (10107030004) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Trần Thị N. (10107030007) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** B. Nguyễn Thị Ngọc (10107030005) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. B. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vạn Lộc (1). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm điện tử trong cộng đồng địa phương. B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 4,000,000 VND. Vào 2006, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. B. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,142,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị H. (10107030002) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 2. Nguyễn Thị D. (10107030003) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 3. Lê Thị Mỵ (10107030004) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Trần Thị N. (10107030007) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Taman Hamidullah Group

texts.en:
This is the Taman Hamidullah group consisting of four female members. Bebe Hawa who is the group leader is a tailor. She would like to take a loan for her business to progress and to go on with this business in a better way.
The second member is Tamana. She wants to take a loan for her husband who sells apples from a cart. With the loan, he wants to purchase more kinds of apples. 
The third member is Fahima. She would like to take a loan for her husband’s retail shop. He wants to complete his stocks. 
The last member is Zeba Gul who wants to receive a loan for her son’s tailoring business.  He would like to purchase a new sewing machine and to expand his business.
They all have requested a group loan of 28,000 Afghani.

loans.use: To expand and progress her business

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Née en 1957 à Djougou au Nord du Bénin, K. Pauline vit depuis 12 ans à Aglangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à ADOUWEKONOU Christophe un pêcheur, Pauline est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. C'est avec ses enfants et son mari que Pauline vit. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pauline n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Pauline mène comme activité la vente de maïs à son domicile. Pauline s'approvisionne  à Abattoir, non loin de son quartier. Pauline mène cette activité depuis 13 ans et a déjà bénéficié de 6 crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Pauline voudrait accroître le stock de ses produits et mieux satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle. C'est donc pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et augmenter son stock de produits, que Pauline sollicite un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Pauline K. was born in 1957 in Djougou in northern Benin. She has lived for 12 years in the neighborhood of Aglangandan in the Beninese town of Sèmè-Podji. She is married to Christophe Adouwekonou, a fisherman, and is the mother of three children, a few of whom attend school. She lives with her children and her husband. Both parents provide for their family. Pauline did not attend school. To pay for her expenses, Pauline sells corn from her home based store. She gets her supplies in Abattoir, not far away from her neighborhood. She has been in this trade for 13 years and was granted already six loans by Alidé, which she repaid on schedule. She wants to increase her inventory to better meet her customers' ever-growing demand. This is why Pauline wants to increase her working capital and inventory, and therefore she came to Alidé and applied for her seventh loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of 100 kilograms of corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina P. is 25 and married with 2 children (ages -month and 1).  She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Sosefina has 2 years of experience in this business.  Sosefina needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2007, Sosefina joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Sosefina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sosefina P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores C. es otra  socia activa del Banco Comunal Tierra Fértil, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 12 y 11 años estudiantes de secundaria y primaria  respectivamente  en establecimientos de la localidad, su esposo trabaja  como chofer de una camioneta de alquiler,   y ella es comerciante de todo tipo de  ropa, lleva dos años en ésta actividad de jueves a domingo no solo en su localidad sino también en pueblos vecinos donde recorre dejando a credito su mercadería,   su mayor orgullo es tener su casa propia aunque aún está en construcción, su meta es terminar de construir su casa y ampliar mucho más su negocio.

María Dolores tiene 39 años es socia del banco comunal hace tres ciclos invitada por su cuñada, ahora mantiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras  y socios del bankito con los  que comparten grandes momentos. Con el dinero del crédito solicitado va a comprar edredones, sábanas, pantalones, casacas, blusas, camisas, etc. para abastecer su negocio y ofrecer a su distinguida clientela variedad de prendas de vestir y para el hogar.
 
El Banco Comunal Tierra Fértil está ubicado en la comunidad Cochapamba  en la parroquia El Valle, se caracteriza por su gente cálida y muy amable que  en su mayor parte se dedican a la agricultura y  cría de animales de corral,  también cuentan con atractivos turísticos como la colina de Tasqui que nos permiten tener una impresionante vista de la parroquia y de le ciudad de Cuenca.
texts.en:
María Dolores C. is another active member of "Banco Comunal Tierra Fértil". She lives with her significant other and their two children, 12 and 11 years old, middle and elementary students at local schools. Her husband works as a driver of a van for rent and she has been selling all kinds of clothes for two years, from Thursday through Sunday, not only in her neighborhood but also at the neigboring villages. She sells on credit. It is her greatest pride to own her house even if it is still being built and it is her goal to finish building her house and improve her business. María Dolores is 39 years old, has been a member of the "banco comunal" for three cycles, invited by her sister-in-law and she has become friend with all the partners of the bank having a good time together. With the loan requested she will buy comforters, sheets, trousers, jackets, blouses, shirts, etc to improve business and be able to offer her distinguished customers a variety of clothes and items for their homes. "Banco Comunal Tierra Fértil" is located in the community of Cochapamba in the parish of El Valle. Its main feature is the warm and very kind people who mostly are dedicated to agriculture and raising of corral animals. It also has tourist attractions such as the hill of Tasqui which offers an impressive view of the parish and the town of Cuenca.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase comforters, sheets, trousers, shirts, blouses, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita S., is from the village of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Rosita owns and operates a grocery store. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional grocery stock. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional grocery stock. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian L. is from the village of Mitazan. She is 59 years old, married, and has 6 grown children. To make a living, Lilian owns & operates a snack & viand vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2005, Lilian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid 11 previous loans from PMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lilian plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: 

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with two children and both of them are in school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Veronica has been in her used-clothing business for two years. She wants to use this loan of 200,000/= to buy more secondhand clothes, which she buys from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She sells her clothes at the market and her customers are local people. She works six days a week.

Veronica depends on her job to make a living. Her main challenge is seasonality and her greatest monthly expenses are medication, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Petty Traders Group

texts.en:
James K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Petty Traders." He is 58 years old, married, and has six children whose ages range from 24 to 38 years old. He was only able to attend school through fourth grade due to poverty. He cares for four siblings.

For 40 years, he has been selling door locks, nails, and hinges at Rally Town Market in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more door locks, nails, and hinges. He describes himself as a business-minded person. His goal is to improve his business and to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Elijah is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more door locks, nails, and hinges.

loans.name: Sothy's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Sothy B. is a 24 year old married man and he is the group leader of this loan, having been selected by its four members located in Koh Krabei village, Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes.
 
Mr. Sothy B. and his wife, Mrs. Channy Chany, are flower sellers who are able to earn a small profit to support their family's living expenses. With this business, Mr. Sothy B. will use the loan that he has requested from AMK to buy more flowers to expand his business activities. Aside from flower sellers, they are also laborers. They receive a small salary to add their savings to improve the family's standard of living. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more flowers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia Y. is from the village of Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 61 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Virginia runs a food production and sales business. Virginia has been engaged in her business for 29 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. In 2008, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase raw materials to cook. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
       
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
       
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to cook

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. is twenty five years old. She is a single mother of a five year old child. Esther owns a cereals retail shop in Mshomoroni, Mombasa, Kenya.

Esther  has been in the cereals business for one year and her business is doing well. This is her first loan from KADET. Esther would like to use the funds to purchase more stock of cereals and to carry out the  renovation of her shop. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cereals and to renovate her shop

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Mrs. Ester C. is from the barangay of Cotta, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old and is married to Manuel C., a former member of the Armed Forces of the Philippines and now a pensioner. They are blessed with 1 child who is now an adult and already married. To make a living, she is presently engaged in making and selling earrings, bracelets, anklets and other body accessories. She’s been engaged in this kind business for 4 years already and earns approximately Php6,000 a month from this business activity. 

In May 2007, Ester joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program and has successfully repaid a loan of Php30,000. She is now requesting a loan of Php20,000 as her 7th loan, which will be used as capital for her jewelry sales business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, possible product innovations, and business expansion.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital for her existing jewelry business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua Y. is a widow. She produces 'kenkey' (a staple made of fermented corn dough) to sell at Elmina. Efua wants the loan to enable her to produce in larger quantities so she can distribute to her increasing customer base. She has been in this trade for forty years. Efua uses her income to take care of herself. She will use the loan to purchase more maize to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more maize to cook for sale

loans.name: Susana María

texts.es: La Sra. Susana María B. C. ella es Trabajadora de la Empresa Enacal desempeñándose como cajera tiene  nueve años de trabajar para esta empresa, es casada actualmente tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Susana María B. C. works for the company Enacal as a cashier. She has worked there for nine years. She is married and has a school age son. He has received seven loans with CEPRODEL and has invested all of them in the purchase of construction materials to improve her house. The CEPRODEL loans have greatly benefited her because they have enabled her to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Cement, sand, stones...

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia C. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Patricia is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Patricia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of fruits like mangoes and apples in the local community. Patricia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Patricia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fruits to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Patricia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Suhgerel

texts.en:
Suhgerel M. is a 39-year-old, hardworking man who lives with his wife and 4 children in Hovd province, Western Mongolia. His 3 older children attend a local secondary school, while the youngest stays at home. 

Suhgerel started a taxi service in 2002. He sold his own herds for cash to buy a car that he could use as a taxi. His wife also runs a clothing business at the local market to help him to provide for the family. Their plan is to build a nice, big house to improve their quality of life and, also, to get a shipping container at the market which his wife can use as a workplace. The couple will work very hard to achieve their goals in the coming two years. 

Suhgerel is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for his car and more goods for the clothing business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Ka

texts.en:
Ka N., age 35, is a married woman who lives in Phnom Penh City. She has given birth to four children, and all of them are single and living under her roof. To make a living, she sells fish that she buys in bulk, and she normally earns $6 per day. She always wakes up early in the morning to go where there are many fishermen working.  She buys fish and then brings them to sell at retail prices at the market. 

Ka N. is married to Rim Rouly, age 36, who shares the responsibility for his family by driving a motor taxi. He runs his business very well because he has skills in communication. Unluckily, his existing motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Ka N. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva to exchange the broken motorcycle for her husband.

loans.use: To exchange the broken motorcycle for her husband's transport business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 34 years old and is married with 2 children who are 1 and 6.  He is a self-employed businessman selling a variety of electronic goods. Emmanuel has been in this business for about ten years and is usually open from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his store by adding more hard electronic items to his shop.  With these additional goods, he hopes that he will attract more customers and his sales will increase as well as his profits.  With the extra profits, Emmanuel will keep reinvesting in his business for the purpose of becoming financially stable and he will also start saving for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic items to sell

loans.name: İslam

texts.en: Islam D. is a 43 year-old man who is married and lives in the city of Saatli in Southern Azerbaijan. Islam is the head of a big family. He has two daughters and one son. He sells meat and dairy produced in his cattle-breeding business at the Saatli bazaar. Before Islam started his business in 2005, his family lacked the means to cover all of their expenses.  Since then the business has been the only source of income for Islam's family. His brother helps him in his business. This is Islam’s first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva. Islam used the 1000 AZN loan to buy two cows. Now Islam has three cows. After repaying this loan Islam plans to take out another loan to buy five more cows.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun S., 39, weaves traditional silk, earning an income of USD 2 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 55 on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase raw silk to produce silk produts. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes que compose le groupe BENKADI sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs  époux et enfants. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce, et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce des chaussures, des pagnes et des condiments tel  COUMBA D..
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt COUMBA D., compte acheter, 5 sacs de 25kg de sel, 20 boites de 2kg de tomate concentré, 40 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi.
 Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, dans le marché de Torakabougou et à son domicile.
Avec ce prêt COUMBA D. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée dans son entreprise et l’autre partie pour appuyer son époux à surmonter les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Benkadi are all married and have an average age of 34. They each have 4 children. They live in conjugal families with their husband and children. These women live in the quarter of Torakabougou in the village of Bougouni (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They are known through business relationships and as neighbors.

With the goal of satisfying their clients to make their business grow they have decided to join the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). They sell shoes, cloth saris, and condiments as is the case of Coumba D.. They are on their fourth group loan with the previous loans having been successfully repaid. 

Coumba D. plans on the purchase of five 25Kg sacks of salt, twenty 2Kg boxes of tomato paste, and forty boxes of 100 pieces each of Maggi cubes.

She makes her purchases from the wholesalers in the Bamako market. She sells in retail and in wholesale, completing the sales in both cash and credit in the Torakabougou market and from her home. 

With the help of her loan, Coumba D. expects to earn a monthly income of 40.000FCFA. A part of her income will be invested in her business, and another part will be used to contribute with her husband to meet their family's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase condiments.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 30 years old, married, and blessed with a four-year-old child.  He does dairy farming for a living.  He was previously doing crop farming.  He is able to do his farming well because the climate for Kiambu is favorable for farming.  He aspires to be a prominent farmer in the future.  He has requested 50,000 kes to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a rice distribution business and a pig fattening business.  Her husband Ricardo B., who is 47 years old, works as an engineer to earn his living.  He also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 15 to 26 years old. 

Marieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15th loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marieta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 60,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 16th cycle loan, Marieta s borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy stocks of rice and feeds to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Marieta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her rice business

loans.name: Serah Wavinya

texts.en:
Serah runs a green grocery store where she sells assorted vegetables to her daily customers at Kikomba open air market in the town of Kangundo.  She has been in this business for seven years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. She is 42 years old, married to Peter and a mother of three children. 

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she is applying for her first loan after being introduced to Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, by a friend who is already a client of KADET LTD. She intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more vegetables to sell. She intends to use the additional income to buy food and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business, and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a stock of assorted vegetables for sale

loans.name: Verediana

texts.en: Verediana is 49 years old, and she has six children who are between the ages of 8 and 26 years old. She sells bread and she has done this business for eight years while her husband sells other foodstuffs. Verediana is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her bread business and plans to expand her house with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: reinvest in her bread business

loans.name: Katty Maricela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Katty, ella tiene  23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una niña de 6 años que estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja entregando materiales de construcción.

Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes en una empresa en la ciudad de Manta, pero también se dedica a la venta productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que además de trabajar en la fábrica de lunes a viernes también los sabados y domingos lo hace en las ventas de sus productos, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada semana, nos cuenta que lleva seis meses que se dedica a este negocio, el cual empezó con un crédito del banquito y que le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The San Juan Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the San Juan neighborhood in the city of Manta.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited a lot by national and foreign tourists in all seasons of the year.  The majority of the residents here work in the fishing industry.

This is where we meet Katty.  She is 23 years old and married.  She has a six year old daughter, who goes to school.  Her husband works delivering construction materials.

She works from Monday to Friday for a business in the city of Manta.  But, she also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She works every day because besides working in the factory from Monday through Friday, she also sells her products on Saturday and Sunday.  She leaves the merchandise on credit, and she collects payment every week.

She has had this business for six months.  She started it with a loan in her communal bank, and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and underwear.  It is her second cycle in the communal bank, and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to have her own house because she lives in her parents-in-law’s house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and underwear

loans.name: Zendere

texts.en: Zendere K. H. is a 55 year old lady. She is married to K., and they have three children together. Zendere has been a dairy farmer for the last five years. This marks her second loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the money to purchase another dairy cow for her business.  The anticipated profits will be directed into the purchase of medicine and animal feed. Her dream is to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria, es casada; la socia tiene 50 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos los cuales son ya independientes, la socia se dedica a la elaboración de gallardetes ella borda a mano todo tipo de pedidos que le hagan la socia realiza estantes, estandartes, capas para los santos y las vírgenes con hilo de oro, estandartes, insignias, banderas y disfraces para bailes típicos con atuendos llamativos y bordados a mano y a todo color. La socia es muy conocida en el pueblo y su fama a trascendido la región, ella desea ahora el crédito para poder abastecer su taller de bordado y comprar hilos, gemas y todos los materiales para elaborar sus pedidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus bordados a pedido.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Virgen Estrella de Oropesa" community bank which is located in the town of Oropesa, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Maria is 50 years old, married, and has three children who are grown up and live independently.  Maria makes pennants.  People place orders with her for different products and she embroiders them by hand.  She makes banners, capes with gold thread for celebrating saints and virgins, standards, flags and costumes for traditional dances, striking outfits which are embroidered by hand and made in all different colors.

Maria is very well known in her village and her fame has spread beyond her region.  She would like this loan so that she can stock her embroidery workshop and buy threads, gems and all the materials she needs to fill her orders.

Maria is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials for making her embroidered products to order.  She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for making her embroidered products to order

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three pigs

loans.name: Seu

texts.en:
Seu is 49 years old and married.  She resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She produces hand-made brooms, earning an income of $2 per day that helps cover her family's expenses.  Her children also contribute financially, earning $3 each per day.  Since Seu and her children started their businesses, the family's standard of living has improved. 

Seu requests a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her second loan from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Angel Armando

texts.es:
Angel Armando tiene 29 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Angel se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta hacer deporte en especial el Bolly.
texts.en:
Angel Armando is 29.  He's married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province.  

The members of the Señor de Salud village bank, located in Soloma in the Echeandia canton, are in agriculture, planting short-cycle crops like rice and corn.  

Angel earns his living in agriculture, planting corn and rice, which he buys in Ventanas and sells daily, particularly Sundays, at the fairs.

He's seeking a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  The loan would help him out financially to get what he needs.  He faces challenges like pests, diseases, and changes in weather.  His dream is to buy a car.

He likes sports, especially volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Galtulga’s wife is hairdresser and works in a beauty salon. 

Since 2009, Gantulga has been running a taxi business using his family car, and in January this year, he got the job as a driving instructor at a local driving school. Instructors can use their own car as a driving school car and obtain a small rental price. So Gantulga does this and it helps his family to earn some extra income on top of his salary. 

Currently, his car needs some proper service. The loan Gantulga is taking will be used to buy necessary spare parts and to do some repair and service to his car, which he uses as a driving school car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and to service and repair his car, which he uses as a driving school car.

loans.name: Elberto

texts.es: El joven Elberto, es soltero vive con sus padres, hermanos que esta en edad escolar,elberto tiene una pequeña bodega la cual funciona en la casa de sus padres ademas de ello, trabaja en los fundos cercanos de la zona por donde vive,siendo así que en las mañanas atiende el negocio su hermana menor y por las tardes  atiende el, ya que  elberto trabaja desde la 6 am a las 2 de la tarde en el fundo. su principal negocio de elberto  es su bodega que a podido surtir con mucho esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus padres, y también ayuda en los ingresos familiares por  mas de 1 año, el dinero que esta solicitando es para compra productos de primera necesidad para su bodega tales como arroz azúcar aceite fideos leche entre otras cosa para brindar un mejor servicio a sus cliente,el sueño que tiene elberto es ser comerciante mayorista para que con ello le genere mejores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida elberto esta muy contento con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en: Young Elberto is single, lives with his parents and brothers, and is school-age. Elberto has a small bodega [grocery store] that he runs out of his parents' house. He also works at nearby farms. Since Elberto works at the farms from 6:00 a.m. to 2 in the afternoon, his younger sister tends the store in the morning and he does so in the afternoon. His main business is the bodega, which he has been able to keep stocked through great effort. For over a year, he has done this in order to be able to help his parents and to help with the family's income. The money he is requesting will be used to buy staple products for his bodega, such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, milk, and other items, in order to offer better service to his customers. Elberto's dream is to be a wholesale merchant because this would generate more income and thereby improve his quality of life. Elberto is very happy about the trust placed in him by granting this loan.

loans.use: to buy staple products for his grocery store, such as rich, sugar, milk, and noodles

loans.name: Mobina

texts.en:
Mobina, 46, is married with two children, aged 13 and 10. She is a farmer and has been growing rice and vegetables for 13 years. She sells her harvest at her town's market. Aside from farming, Mobina also sells barbecue to the people in her community.

Mobina requested this loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is hoping for a stable business for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, se dedica a la venta de refrescos y cosméticos, es una persona de familia, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, con este negocio lleva 10 años, lo aprendió de sus familiares que son comerciantes, de las ganancias a logrado hasta hoy mantener el hogar.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como sodas, jugos y productos de belleza como maquillaje, labiales y prendedores para el cabello.
El préstamo le ayudara para aumentar su negocio, surtiéndolo de mercadería, con ello lograra mantenerse y ofrecer a los clientes nuevos productos que le permitan tener un aumento en las ventas y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis sells soft-drinks and cosmetics.  He is a family man living with his wife and two children.  He’s been in this business for 10 years having learned it from family members who are merchants.  To date, profits have made it possible for him to support his household.

He is asking for a loan to buy products like soft-drinks and beauty products like make-up, lipstick and hair clips.

The loan will help him increase business stocking it with merchandise.  He is able to stay in business that way and offer his customers new products that will lead to increased sales and improved living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy beverages and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Jose Francisco, tiene la edad 26 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con su conyugue e hija. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de alimento para el engorde de cerdos. El cuenta con cerdos a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El quiere lograr  que sus animales alcancen un peso ideal para su venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jose Francisco, who is 26 years old, lives with his common-law wife and their daughter. With this loan, he intends to buy concentrated feed to fatten up his pigs. He owns a herd of pigs and plans to feed them concentrated feed so that they fatten up faster. He wants his animals to reach the ideal weight for their subsequent sale in the local market or in neighboring communities. Jose Francisco wants to generate the maximum profit for his well-being and that of his family, and also to help expand his pig-raising project.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Previously, he did not have any other loans from state banks. However, FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan under better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for pigs.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 36 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 15 years old.

Mary Grace is a farmer. She grows rice crops and sells her harvest at the market. Aside from farming, Mary Grace also runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like canned goods, sugar and vinegar.

Mary Grace has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes that through her businesses, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, Él posee un taller de estructuras metálicas y lo atiende desde las 5:00am hasta las 6:00 de la tarde desde hace 6 años, también presta servicio con un molino de nixtamal.
Él está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, hoy para la compra de repuestos para el molino y una pequeña parte la invertirá en abono, porque está sembrando maíz y quiere fortalecer la plantación. Este préstamo le será útil para realizar los cambios al molino y prestar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Las aspiraciones de Manuel son continuar con el taller y en el molino, que sus ingresos aumenten para el sostenimiento de su familia y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife and two children aged 7 and 3.  He has a metalworking workshop, where he works from 5 a.m. till 6 p.m.  He has been doing this for the last 6 years, and he also provides a corn milling service.

He is requesting a new loan for the purchase of spare parts for his grinder, and he will invest a small part of the loan in manure as he is growing corn and wants to improve his plantation.  This loan will be useful to him in making repairs to the grinder, and providing a better service for his customers.

Manuel's aspirations are to continue with his workshop and grinder, so that his income grows for the upkeep of his family and his children's education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his corn grinder.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia, 57, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow with one child who is now studying in college.  She, together with her child, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Leticia operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the Pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan de Sal or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students and workers. Aside from this, she sells a variety of basic products in her store. Leticia’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 48,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar, and butter, which she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leticia hopes her business will grow and she dreams of being able to give her child a good future and a high quality education through all her hard work 1n her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for bread production

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, necesita un nuevo préstamo para mejorar su capital de trabajo, tener lo necesario de materia prima; hilos de seda de diferentes colores,ella esta muy contenta porque los prestamos le han ayudado para mejorar su negocio y mantener materia prima para la produccion.
texts.en: Martha needs a new loan to increase her working capital. She needs raw materials and silk thread in different colors. She is very happy because the loans have helped her improve her business and have raw materials for making products.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hammocks, such as silk thread, wood canes, and cuffs.

loans.name: Nereida Del Rosario

texts.es: Nereyda Del Rosario tiene 35 años, su actividad es la venta de helados. Tiene más de 8 años en este negocio el sacrificio que realiza diariamente ella es una persona muy emprendedora se siente muy feliz con este crédito pues es la primera vez que lo realiza. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de dulces, gomas, bolsas, conos de galletas, helados, entre otros.
texts.en:
Nereida Del Rosario is 35, and sells ice cream. She has been in this business for more than eight years. 

She makes daily sacrifices for her business, and is a very enterprising person. She feels very happy about the loan, since it is the first time that she has had one. The purpose of the loan is to buy candy, gum, bags, waffle cones, ice cream and other things.

loans.use: To buy candy, gum, bags, waffle cones, ice cream, and other things.

loans.name: Nelly Ambogo

texts.en: Nelly is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a cereals sales business where she sells cereals and also ice cream. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenges to be inflation and a poor road transport network. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to add a stock of maize. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will open another cereals shop.

loans.use: To add a stock of maize.

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, esto se debe a comprar más mercadería para satisfacer a los clientes, ella comprara arroz, frijol, aceite, golosinas, todo para mejorar el servicio a los clientes y que las ventas mejoren.
En el préstamo anterior Rosa logro surtir el negocio, esto le dio una mejoría en sus ingresos, ya que los clientes al encontrar todo lo necesario en su negocio, les hacia aun más darle preferencia.
texts.en: Rosa is again asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to meet customer demand.  She will buy rice, beans, oil and snacks to improve customer service and sales.  With the previous loan Rosa managed to better stock the store which improved her income because when customers were able to find everything they needed, they preferred her even more.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil and snacks for the store.

loans.name: Martha Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora Martha es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos y se caracteriza por ser gente amable y carismática.

Doña Martha tiene 30 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 4 hijos de 13, 11, 8 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y dos de sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es artesano dedicándose a la joyería, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Martha trabaja con su esposo en la fabricación de joyas como aretes, anillos, cadenas, etc. en plata, acero y oro. Lleva 5 años en el negocio y trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde ya que también le dedica tiempo a su hogar. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace dos años y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de plata, oro y acero  para la fabricación de sus joyas.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Martha is a member of the Medio Ejido Community Bank. She lives in the centre of the city of Cuenca, the third most important city in the country. The people there still continue the culture and traditions of their villages and are known for their friendliness and charm.

Martha is 30 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has four children aged 13, 11, 8, and 4. Her oldest daughter attends high school, and two of her other children attend primary school. Her husband is a craftsman and makes jewelry. They don’t own a house so live in a rented one.

Martha works with her husband making jewelry such as earrings, rings, chains etc, in silver, stainless steel, and gold. She’s worked in the business for five years and works from Monday to Saturday from 10 am to 6 pm. She also spends time on household duties. Martha has been a member of the community bank for two years. She plans to use her new loan to buy silver, gold, and stainless steel to make more jewelry.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy silver, gold, and stainless steel

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwenda has operated a retail shop for the past twenty years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of insecurity. She dreams of operating a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase more stocks of soft drinks, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans for her shop. She decided to join Yehu because they offer quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drinks, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans for her shop.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo cuenta con apenas dos años con esta actividad que es le elaboración del carbón, también de dedica al oficio de albañil y su esposos para ayudarlo en la economía y gastos escolares de sus dos hijos, se dedica a la elaboración y reparación de ropa (Costura). 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar la materia prima que es leña para la elaboración del carbón, en esta temporada de invierno es cuando tiene mas pedidos y desea invertir, para obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Guillermo has been making charcoal for just two years.  He also works as a builder and his wife, in order to help with their finances and their children's education expenses, works making and repairing clothes (sewing). 

Guillermo is requesting this loan to invest in buying raw materials (firewood) for making charcoal.  This winter season is when he has most orders and he would like to invest in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his charcoal business

loans.name: Las Responsables Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group Las Responsables 1, 3 & 6 (The Responsible). She makes her home here in a simple structure with three of her six children and their father. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying attending church and doing business.

Maribel is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for seven years, starting with her own loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing rice, beans, flour, sugar, canned food, and other goods. She is running a Colmado, a small grocery store. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. 

This group is located in one of the Bateyes from La Romana.  All these members are mainly Haitians. Bateyes are rural area surrounded by sugarcane fields.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, flour, sugar, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.ru: Мамуржон занимается торговлей семян и сухофруктов. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 21 год. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Мамуржон берет кредит для закупа приправы и семян овощей.
texts.en: Mamujon sells seeds and dry fruits. He has been in this business for twenty one years. He is 52 years old, he is married and has two children. Mamurjon is taking out the loan to buy spices and vegetable seeds.

loans.use: to purchase spices and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Virgen De Los Angeles De Huayllacocha Group

texts.es:
La señora Julia nació en la ciudad de Lucre de la provincia del Quispicanchis departamento del Cusco pero vive en la  comunidad de Huayllacocha. Ya son 13 años que vive en la comunidad pues le gusta el paisaje y se lleva muy bien con sus vecinos. (En la fotografía la señora Julia está levantando la mano). Julia tiene 39 años edad, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos (Elizabeth de 11 años, Sayda de 10 años y Edson de 7 años). Julia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y aparte de ser ama de casa también se dedica a la agricultura. En esta oportunidad Julia requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, abono, fertilizantes y maíz. Ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales como chanchos, cuyes, ovejas entonces una parte del crédito lo utilizara para mejor su ganadería.       

La mayoría de los socias viven en la ciudad de Huayllacocha donde realza todo tipo de actividades como el comercio, agricultura, ganadería y otras actividades. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Huayllacocha de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Desde la ciudad del Cusco a nuestro destino hay una distancia de 45 Km. (aproximado dos horas de viaje) hasta llegar a la localidad de Huayllacocha. Durante el viaje cruzaremos parte de la cordillera andina Peruana, observaremos hermosos paisajes  interandinos y comunidades indígenas andinas quechuas.
texts.en:
Julia was born in the city of Lucre in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco, but she lives in the Huayllacocha community.  She has lived there for the last 13 years, as she likes the countryside and gets on well with her neighbors.  (In the photo, Julia is the one with her hand raised.) Julia is 39 years old, married, and has three children (Elizabeth, 11, Sayda, 10, and Edson, 7).  She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who, in addition to being a housewife, also works on the farm.  At the moment, Julia needs a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and corn.  She also raises animals, such as pigs, guinea pigs, and sheep; a part of the loan will be used to improve her livestock.

Most of the members of the Virgen de Los Angeles de Huayllacocha group live in Huayllacocha, where they engage in all kinds of activities, such as trading, farming, and ranching, among other things.  The members of the communal bank meet every 30 days in the Huayllacocha community, which is in the Anta province of the department of Cusco.  It is 45 km from Cusco to Huayllacocha (a trip of about two hours). On the way, you cross part of the Peruvian Andean mountain ridge, with its beautiful landscape and communities of Quechua people.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and corn.

loans.name: Djigui Sembe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité djigui sembé a été créé le 31/05/2007.IL est composé de 13 membres qui sont issus du meme village.Elles ont pour activité le petit commerce.
 

Madame Mariama qui se trouve à l’extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras gauche,est la responsable du groupe.Elle est mariée,âgée de 39 ans et mére de 03 enfants,en plus elle a un autre enfant en sa charge.

Elle est propriétaire d'une boutique au niveau du village et exerce cette activité de commerçante depuis plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra d'approvisionner sa boutique pour satisfaire sa clientéle qui ne cesse d'augmenter.

Son objectif est d'accroitre son épargne afin d'obtenir un financement plus élevé au prochain cycle.

loans.use: acheter de la marchandise pour sa boutique

loans.name: Las Super Mamis Group

texts.en:
The group "Las Super Mamis" is a hard working group of 8 members from the city of Nicolas Romero in Mexico. In the community they are know for their energy and entrepreneurial spirit. One of her members is Silvia who operates a beauty salon.

Mrs. Silvia is a 31 years old married woman with two children who has always shown an interest in hair styling; styling her friends' and family member's hair as a teenager. Because of this fascination, when she was 19 years old she decided to attend beauty school and try her hand out in this field. 

When she finally began to work as a stylist she started in a front room in her house with a chair, a small mirror, and a handful of tools, while advertising her service at a low cost to help her gain clients. As she began building her clientele with the full support of her family, she was able to expand the number of chairs, mirrors, and tools, as well as specializing and perfecting her craft. Today she has come a long way from that tiny first room to having her own locale next to her house, on one of the busiest avenues in the center of her city, Villa Nicolas Romero. 

She currently makes around $MX 4000 pesos a month and continues working hard, opening daily from 10am to 5pm while attending to all her other responsibilities as a wife and mother. Because Silvia wants to continue growing her business, over a year ago she started a group with several of her neighbors, who also are striving to grow their businesses, to ask for a loan. She has renovated three times and continues using the loan to get new products for her clients, as well as growing and modernizing the space and tools of her business.

loans.use: Modernize her

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 2 and 8 years, 1 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 5 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha lives in Yombo area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with four children.Asha runs a vegetables and fruits stall in Tandika market.She buys these items directly from farmers.She has been in this business for more than four years.Recently she had secured another stall within the same maket but on the other side.She is planning to open it soon after getting additional funding.Her sister will be incharge for this new stall.To facilitate the opening of this new stall Asha needs  USD 550.

loans.use: BUSINESS EXPANSION

loans.name: Despina

texts.en:
Despina lives in the Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children; two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Despina keeps chickens -- both broilers and layers. She supplies chicken meat and eggs to different private secondary schools in the Temeke district of Dar es Salaam. She has been in this business seven years. 

Despina cannot meet the demand from her customers. She wants to increase her flock from 400 birds to 600 birds. The huts also need expansion and her stock of medications needs to be increased. The additional capital of USD 550 will help her do this. The expansion strategy will help her  increase her income, which will facilitate paying school fees. Next year her third-born will join secondary school.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Teo

texts.en: Teo and his wife have 5,500m2 land to live on and have put 300 pillars in to grow green dragon & peanut trees. Teo's wife works hard as a farmer, she plants peanut trees and raises ducks. They hope their children continue their school. They want to borrow $75 to invest in their farm to buy more green dragon to get more income. They will pay it back within 10 months.

loans.use: Teo wants to invest more in his green dragon and peanut tree farm so he can send his children to school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of bicycle parts

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en:
Mr.Fikret is a low income vulnerable person. He is 50, married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.
Fikret and his brother sell milk in the local market and cows they have are the  reliable source of income for their family. But to be sufficient for both families, this business needs a constant investment. And Fikret applied to Normicro Saatli branch for $500 loan, which is enough to buy one cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Afi  Finè

texts.fr:
Mrs Afi Finè A. was born on December 31st, 1966 in Lomé, in the prefecture of Golfe. Illiterate, because her parents didn't understand the importance of education, she today has a small business selling condiments and fish. Married and mother of five (5) children, the responsiblities of the household are too heavy for her meager revenue. Life is difficult. Her husband can't contribute enough to the household, and she finds herself crushed by her responsibilities and doesn't know where to turn. Despite her courage and will, her household is prey to daily difficulties. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to expand her business and insure her children get to go to school.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Afi Finè A. est née le 31 décembre 1966 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe. Analphabète, car ses parents n’ayant pas vite compris la nécessité de la scolarisation de la jeune fille, elle mène aujourd’hui comme activité le petit commerce de vente de condiments et des poissons. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, les charges du ménage deviennent de plus en plus lourdes que le maigre revenu de Madame Afi Finè A., la misère s’est installée dans la famille. Son mari ne contribue pas efficacement aux charges du ménage, elle se trouve écrasée par les charges et ne sait plus à quel saint se vouer. Malgré son courage et sa volonté, son ménage est en proie à des difficultés quotidiennes. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour élargir son champ d’activité commerciales et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: buying and selling fish

loans.name: Theam

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Theam, 31, and her husband, Srun Sangva, have been married since 1990 and have five children, one son and four daughters. Theam sells vegetables in her village by bicycle. Her husband is a farmer, and he grows rice and fishes. When he has free time from his farming, he also does construction work.

Theam is requesting a second loan from MAXIMA, in the amount of $100. She will use this loan to purchase rice seed for her husband to grow rice. Both husband and wife hope that this loan will provide them with a better life.

loans.use: Buy rice seed for growing rice

loans.name: Reimundo

texts.es:
Reimundo offers copy services in his community with the help of a small copy machine that he acquired three years ago. He set aside a small area in his home to provide his services and satisfy his customer’s needs. This business is his beloved family’s main source of income, so he would like to buy a new copy machine in order to increase his revenue. After the passing of his wife, his household has endured great hardships. The purchase of a copy machine, along with a substantial source of income, would be the best ways in which to give shelter to his daughter, with the aim of showing her how to value the hard work that she will carry out in her father’s company. This work tool will bring tranquility and well-being to their home. Let’s make his request possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Reimundo, se dedica a brindar servicios de fotocopias en su comunidad con la ayuda de una pequeña máquina que adquirió hace tres años, para este fin instaló en su domicilio un espacio y adecuó el mismo para satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes. Este negocio es la fuente principal de ingresos de su querida familia y desea comprar una fotocopiadora moderna para incrementar sus ingresos; debido a que a partir de la muerte de su esposa atravesaron grandes declives en el interior de su hogar. La compra de una fotocopiadota además de una sustancial fuente de ingreso sería la forma de mantener a sus hija a buen recaudo con el objetivo de enseñarle a valorar el trabajo que irá desempeñando en su compañía. Esta herramienta de trabajo le otorgará tranquilidad y bienestar a su hogar. Posibilitemos su petición.

loans.use: Purchase of additional copy machine

loans.name: Maria Ligia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Ligia is a single mother with three school aged children. She expends a lot of effort in the maintenance and support that they deserve.

Twenty years ago, with the amount of C$1,000 she started a general store and as the months progressed she has grown her product assortment. This lady is a great role model; even though she does not have a husband at her side to help her, she was able to improve her life and that of her children on her own.

She has acquired loans from Ceprodel since about a year ago, that being one of the reasons Mrs. Maria V. has been able to progress. She confesses that one of her dreams is some day seeing her children pursuing a university education.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Ligia es una madre soltera y con tres hijos en la edad escolar que con muchísimo sacrificio se esfuerza para mantenerlos y brindarles todo su apoyo en lo que amerita.
