Con un monto de C$ 1,000 desde hace 20 años inició su negocio de pulpería de los cuales a través de los meses ha venido surtiendo de mas productos. Esta dama es un gran ejemplo que a pesar de que no tiene a su esposo a su lado ha logrado superar su vida y la de sus hijos.

Ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel desde hace un año, esta es la razón por la que la señora Maria V. ha podido salir adelante. Confiesa que su sueño es ver algún día a sus hijos coronando una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase of general store inventory

loans.name: Imma

texts.en: Imma is 42 years old and married with 3 children.  She sells food items in the market of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Before she had access to loans from SMT, Imma used to run her business within their homestead on a very small scale.  With the loans, she has acquired a stall in the market and increased her stock.  She is now requesting a loan of US$ 350 to continue to expand her small business.

loans.use: increase the amount of food items she has for sale

loans.name: Emomshoh

texts.ru:
Emomshoh Shoimurodovich H. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is married and has four children. He has a college education and is zootechnician by profession. He is 41 and has a business of selling groceries. There no available jobs in his field at this time and this is why he went into retail. He has more than 18 years experience in this field. He is the only one who works in his family. To increase commodity circulation and sales he needs money and decided to apply for a loan. By increasing the variety of produce in his store Emomshoh will be able to make more money to support his family. This will also allow the local residents to buy the necessary goods without leaving the town. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Хакимов Эмомшох Шоимуродович проживает в районе Файзабад.Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее . По специальности зоотехник. Возраст 41 год. Занимается куплей продажей продуктов питания. Так как по специальности работы в данное время нет,клиент занимается торговлей.Имеет опыт в торговли более 18 лет. В его семье работает только он один. Для увеличения товарооборота клиенту нужны были деньги и он решил взять кредит . Увеличив ассортимент магазина клиент сможет заработать больше денег на содержание своей семьи. Так же жители смогут покупать у него товары первой необходимости,не выезжая за покупками в город. .Клиент планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase commodity turnover

loans.name: Betty Isabirye's Group

texts.en:
Betty is the leader of a group with 5 members. She is 43 and married with 4 children. All of them are of school-going age. The community she lives and works in is semi-urban.

She currently runs a maize mill after shifting from selling milk and bread a year ago. Her business depends on the clients who take their cereals to her for grinding.

The main challenges she is facing include lack of power, unstable prices of diesel, seasonality of cereals, dependence on clients for cereals, and high rent charges for the room in which she operates. She boasts of a better standard of living and the ability to contribute to the running of the home and to pay school dues as benefits from taking loans.

Her plans are to start buying maize for grinding, packing, and selling flour to the nearby army barracks. She also plans to extend electricity to her place of work so that she stops using diesel for running the mill.

Betty has paid back more than 7 loans.

loans.use: Her plans are to start buying maize for grinding, packing, and selling flour .

loans.name: Zendia C 2017-4 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Susan K.. She sells milk in her shop and is requesting a loan to expand the shop. Susan is 50 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 5 children ranging from 12 to 20 years old, and her children go to school. Each week, Susan makes approximately 80 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the shop.

Susan is joined in her small group by Alice S., Mary S., Rose S., and Veronica Amose. Alice S. sells charcoal and wants to buy a bicycle. Mary S. sells vegetables and wants a loan to expand her business. Rose S. sells charcoal and wants to buy tools for digging, such as hoes. Veronica Amose sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy chairs to sell.

loans.use: To expand her shop

loans.name: Koumba

texts.fr:
Mrs. Koumba Boité is the mother of four children (two girls and two boys), is 43 years old and lives with her husband, her co-wife, and their children in a polygamous family in Darsalam I neighborhood of Koutiala prefecture (near Sikasso). Selling food seasonings has been Koumba’s specialty for the last 15 years. She started this business very early in her life like most of the women of her generation, who didn’t have the opportunity to study. She has been making sales in the Darsalam I neighborhood where there isn’t a market and thus competitors are fewer. Sales are made from home, where products are spread out on a big table in the middle of the family compound. Her customers are mostly women who make purchases every day. She has had a relationship with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution for the last four years and has borrowed six loans (four group loans and two individual loans) that she has successfully repaid. The current loan will be used to purchase seasonings and vegetables in bulk (baskets of tomatoes, chilies, peppers, a case of spaghetti, two bags of salt, etc.). She anticipates making an average profit of 60,000 Francs CFA per month that she will use toward her family’s needs, to pay interest to Soro Yiriwaso, and to increase her capital. She plans to open a shop to sell seasonings in her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Koumba Boité est mère de 4 enfants (2 filles et 2 garçons), âgée de 43 ans et vit avec son mari , sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans une famille polygame au quartier Darsalam I de la Préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). La vente de condiments alimentaires est la spécialité de Koumba depuis 15 ans. Elle a commencé cette activité très tôt comme la plupart des femmes de sa génération n’ayant pas eu la chance de faire des études. Elle exerce cette activité dans le quartier Darsalam I ou il n’existe pas de marché par conséquent moins de concurrents. La vente se fait à domicile ou les produits sont étalés sur une grande table au milieu de la concession familiale. Sa clientèle est essentiellement composée de femmes qui effectuent les achats toute la journée. Elle est en relation avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis quatre ans et a obtenu 6 prêts (4 prêts de groupe et 2 prêts individuel) qui ont été correctement remboursés. Le prêt actuel servira à acquérir des condiments alimentaires et des légumes en quantité (des paniers de tomates, du piment, des poivres, un carton de vermicelles, 2 sacs de sels etc.…). Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour les besoins familiaux, pour payer les intérêts de SORO YIWASO et augmenter son capital. Elle envisage d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de condiments dans son quartier.

loans.use: Purchase seasonings and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Riziki's Tunajaribu Group

texts.en:
Riziki is 28 years old and a widow with 3 children ages 12, 9, and 4. She has owned a small bakery since 2002. Every day, she works from 4am to 1:30pm at her business.

Riziki now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling fish, charcoal, and firewood.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Kalamnisso

texts.ru: Азизова Каламниссо жительница города Куляб.Возраст 62 года, замужем  , имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее. Каламниссо занимается куплей продажей ткани для пошива женской одежды. Она покупает оптом товар  на оптовом рынке и реализует его в розницу. Этот вид деятельности  является  основным источником дохода  ее большой семьи.Так как муж клиентки временно не работает. В даный момент Каламниссо  хочет закупить  ткань для чего ей нужны деньги . Посоветовавшись с близкими она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Kalamnisso A. lives in the city of Kulyab. She is 62 years old, married, and has four children. She has a secondary education. Kalamnisso sells fabrics for making women's clothing. She buys goods wholesale at the wholesale market and sells them retail. This activity is her large family's primary source of income because her husband is temporarily unemployed. Now Kalamnisso wants to stock up on fabric, which will require money. After talking with those close to her, she decided to apply for a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es: La señora Gertrudis G. V. tiene 53 años de edad, actualmente, vive en la calle Océano Pacifico, de la Zona El Tejar, se dedica a la producción y comercio de alimentos (queso, chuño, papa, carne de cordero, caya y otros) los cuales compra en provincia y los trae a la ciudad para comercializarlos, la señora Gertrudis demuestra ser una persona con iniciativa y muy emprendedora, que siempre busca generar ingresos propios para el bien de su familia, ella trabaja con EMPRENDER hace 4 años, primero siendo parte de un grupo solidario y actualmente con crédito individual, los créditos de la institución le han permitido incrementar gradualmente su capital de trabajo y por tanto sus ingresos, por eso continua y continuará trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gertrudis G. V. is 53 years old and currently lives on Pacific Ocean Street in the El Tejar zone. She dedicates herself to food production and sales (cheese, chuño, potato, lamb meat, caya and others), which she buys in the province and brings to the city to sell. Mrs. Gertrudis demonstrates herself to be an enterprising woman with a great deal of initiative, who is always looking for ways to increase her income to benefit her family. She has worked with EMPRENDER for four years, first as part of a solidarity group, and currently with an individual credit. The loans from the institution have allowed her to gradually increase her working capital and, concurrently, her income -- which is why she works with them and plans to continue doing so.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of raw materials.

loans.name: Pm

texts.en:
Pm S. T. is 38 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their four children. She is a housewife managing the family and the household. Her husband Khork Say is 49 years old and works at CIMAX organization and earns on average $8 per day. Two of her children go to school, one is too young for school, and her oldest son works as a tuk-tuk driver where he earns about $5 per day (a tuk-tuk is a seated cart pulled by motorbike that is used as transportation/taxi by people in Cambodia). Her household expenses are about $160 per month.

Pm S. T. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike that would help her husband commute to work. This would cut down on commute time, and save money since they would not have to pay a moto-taxi for his daily commute. Also, Pm S. T. would like to open a grocery stand in the future.

Pm S. T. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate. Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan. To learn more about CREDIT-MFI please visit their Kiva Field Partner page or their website at:

http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=9

http://www.credit.com.kh/

loans.use: Pm Sokun Thear is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike helping her husband commute to work daily. This would cut down on commute time, and save money since they would not have to pay a moto-taxi for his daily commute. In the future, Pm Sokun Thear would like to open a grocery stand.

loans.name: Ángela Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Ángela Lorena es una dama que se dedica a laborar arduamente en el municipio de Telica en León para llevar a cabo su sueño de brindarle un techo digno a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar. Ha iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación y lo ha llevado a cabo poco a poco hasta acabar con esta obra que ha iniciado. 

Ceprodel ha sido un apoyo fundamental en su construcción por la razón de que le ha apoyado con créditos que los ha utilizado para la compra de los materiales de construcción. Hoy en día una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de bloque, cemento, arena, zinc y hierro para continuar con esta construcción y así brindarle las condiciones necesarias a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms Ángela Lorena is a woman who works arduously in the municipality of Telica in León so that she can make her dream of giving her young school-aged son a worthy home come true. She has begun rebuilding her home and is making improvements slowly but surely to finish this project. Ceprodel has been of great support in the renovation as she has been able to use previous loans to buy construction materials. Now,once again, she is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy cement blocks, cement, sand, zinc and iron to continue with the construction and thus improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for home improvement

loans.name: Odette Djigbodi Ama

texts.fr: Célibataire avec un enfant, madame Odette Djigbodi Ama K. est née à Alokoègbé dans la préfecture de Zio le 08 juin 1968. Après ses études secondaires prématurément arrêtées, elle entra en apprentissage de la couture, métier qu’elle n’arrive pas à exercer parce qu’elle ne dispose pas de moyens financiers pour ouvrir un atelier. A force de courage et de détermination, elle entreprit un petit commerce de pagnes. Elle va de villages en villages, les jours de marché pour vendre les pagnes qu’elle achète à crédit auprès de ses fournisseurs. Pour renforcer son activité commerciale et assurer son autonomie financière, elle sollicite un financement sous forme de prêt. C’est une femme dynamique et digne de confiance.
texts.en:
Ms. Odette Djigbodi Ama K. is unmarried and has one child. She was on June 8, 1968 in Alokoègbé, Zio Prefecture. Following her secondary schooling, prematurely halted, she entered into a sewing apprenticeship, work that she has not been able to practice because she lacks the financial means to open a workshop. Backed by courage and determination, she undertook small-scale commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She goes from village to village on market days to sell pagnes that she buys on credit from her suppliers. To bolster her commercial activities and to ensure her financial independence, she is requesting financing in the form of a loan. This is an energetic woman who is worthy of trust.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in "pagnes"

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Savoeun R. is 47 years old and lives on an island in the Mekong River not far from Phnom Penh.  She also lives her two daughters, two sons, as well as her husband, who she married almost thirty years ago.  Savoeun has been selling groceries for several years, which she buys from the market in Phnom Penh and resells near her home.  Her husband raises pigs and produces rice wine, while one of their daughters works as a silk weaver.  In order to purchase a greater inventory of groceries, Savoeun is requesting a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
La señora Rene L. está muy agradecida por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior crédito con el cual pudo comprar  las mesas y sillas para el negocio.  
 Ella solicita su cooperación para este otro préstamo, que es para la comprar de mercancía y acondicionar el negocio, ya que viene la temporada de calor y quiere que sus clientes estén más cómodos al consumir sus alimentos. Desea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Rene L. is very thankful for the great amount of support she received when she got her last loan. She was able to buy tables and chairs for her business. She is asking for your cooperation so that she will be able to get her next loan. With this next loan she will purchase merchandise and an air conditioning unit for her business. The warm season is coming and she wants her customers to be more comfortable while they are eating their meals. She plans to pay back the loan with the income she receives from her business.

(Translated by Jian of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise and Air Conditioniner

loans.name: Zamzam

texts.en:
Zamzam has been a vegetable and fruit seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 3 years. She belongs to Tupendane Group (group code 2061). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 335. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fruit and vegetables for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Zamzam is 32 years old, married, and has four children: ages between 16 and 12.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia A. is a restaurant operator whose business is located alongside the jeep terminal of her village, and has had many years of operation.  However, to date, she is the only one sustaining this project; other restaurants closed due to financial reasons. Most of her customers are drivers, neighbors and passersby. She received a loan from HSPFI amounting to PHP 14000, just enough to purchase soft drinks, meat, and ingredients for food processing. She is planning to purchase additional kitchen utensils with the next funds.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, meat, and ingredients

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 37-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Samir has been selling fruits and vegetables since 1994. Samir requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Samir has requested a loan. 
Samir is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Samir decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation as well as have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Ахмадова Ситора проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 26 лет. Замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Кроме ее семьи с ними живут родители мужа . Семья большая , обеспечивает семью только один муж. Поэтому Ситора решила  купить корову , которая будет давать молоко. Получаемое молоко сможет продавать соседям. Кроме этого она сможет обеспечить семью свежим молоком. Но для этого ей необходимо получить кредит , поэтому она и обратилась к нам.
texts.en:
Sitora A. lives in Rudaky. She is 26, married, and has one child. Sitora's family lives together with her in-laws. The family is large, but only Sitora's husband is currently able to support it. This loan Sitora will use to buy a milk cow, so she can provide fresh milk to her family and sell the rest to her neighbors.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Guérisseurs 2 Group

texts.fr: Nous avons déjà soldé notre prêt. Nous voudrions qu’on nous le renouvelle pour continuer à exercer notre activité en  achetant des produits (plantes médicinales)qui permettront de préparer des recettes à base des médicaments utilisables lesquels seront mis à la disposition de la population locale à des prix accessibles. Grâce à cette pharmacopée, nous avons pu alléger la souffrance de populations face aux besoins familiaux à savoir la préoccupation des mères pour leurs enfants dans le cadre de la santé et la malnutrition.
texts.en:
We have already settled our loan. We would like it to be renewed in order to continue to do our work by buying merchandise (medicinal plants), which will allow us to employ recipes for making usable medicines, which will be made available to the local people at accessible prices. Thanks to these pharmacological raw materials, we've been able to alleviate the people's suffering in addressing family needs, that is, the concern that mothers have for their children regarding health and malnutrition.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pharmacopeia

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 27 years old and a resident of Barangay Cabaruan in Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Jomar who is 28 years old and a farmer in their village. They were blessed with two children. Their eldest, Josephine, is 7 years old and their youngest, John Paul, is 4 years old. Josephine is already studying in their primary school. Ester is hoping that her two children will someday able to finish their studies through college. 

Ester manages a general store in their village.  She has run the business for two years already . Because she wants the business to grow, Ester is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000. She is working hard at her business for the future education of her children and also to support her father-in-law who is presently suffering from an illness. She hopes that her business will be given the chance to grow someday.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary E. is 37 years old and is married with four children. She has a store where she sells foodstuffs and fruit. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and fruit to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and fruit to sell

loans.name: Zareena Muhammad Mubarak Group

texts.en:
Zareena baji is a wife of M. M. and they have both been citizens of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.

At her age, Zareena baji wants to set a good example for her grandchildren and for her family. In spite of her age, she keeps working on her sewing machine, sewing clothes. In this photo she is playing with her grandson and laughing. Her husband is also a very mature person and is a driver by profession. Zareena baji is requesting for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor-vehicle) because her husband is currently driving a rented one and pays half of his income to the owner. 

This group loan consists of three additional people: 

Zuhran baji wants a loan to buy a lathe.

Fozia baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw.

Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor workshop.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Judith Atieno

texts.en:
Judith O. is a widow aged 24 years who has seven children. Three are her biological children, while the other four are from her late husband’s previous marriage. Six are in primary school while one is too young to start schooling.

Judith is a business lady, operating a tailoring shop at Kariobangi Market. She also sells fabric to other tailors in the same market. The business was founded by her late husband in 1990. The monthly income for her business is 30,000 Kenyan shillings ($375 U.S.)

With this loan Judith wants to open another fabric shop and hopes that the profit generated will enable her to comfortably feed and educate her children.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To increase the stock of fabrics in her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria F., 58, is a mother of five and owns a small rice field in Banga, South Cotabato, Mindanao. She is a rice farmer and she has been helping her husband till the farm since the date of their marriage.

She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to pay for laborers, who help prepare the farm before planting, and for fertilizers to improve the quality of the rice.

She joined CEVI in 2008. She still likes the services and wants to take out more loans in the future.

loans.use: Laborers and fertilizer

loans.name: Efe

texts.en: Efe sells baby products, such as baby clothes and creams. She is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She is requesting a loan of N100000 to purchase baby-care products to sell. She thanks all of her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby-care products to sell

loans.name: Marry

texts.en: Marry L. Mollel is an entrepreneur Tanzanian business married woman. She runs a business Designing, making and selling Traditional clothes (BATICK) and its product to customers. Also she runs a tailoring Mart as also a Teacher with three students. She has four sewing machines. Also she sells Tailoring business goods. She purchases the business materials from the shops in Kariakoo business center and selling to her customers. She needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to boost up the business

loans.use: To boost up the business by buying more business goods

loans.name: Felecita

texts.en: Felecita C. is from the village of Matco. She is 58 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Felecita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2002, Felecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Felecita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 13th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda P. is 6 years older than her husband, Marticiano P., at the age of 55 years old. Most of their children now have their own families, so their family started to get big. Rosenda wants to help all her children in raising their children, especially financially; that is why Rosenda and her husband are striving hard to provide for their big family. The main source of their income is through their fishing business that is personally managed by her husband because he is a fisherman, but aside from that they also run a fish and gasoline business. All of this business contributes to their daily income, but the fishing business is the one that contributes the most, so they focus on it.

Since she became a member of Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), every loan that Rosenda receives is used in improving this business; that is why her business will continue to run and grow. Her fourth loan will be used again in buying necessary things needed by her business like fishnets, accessories for the fishnets, and much more. And some part of the loan will be used in buying what is needed for their secondary business, which is the buy and sell. She is hoping that after buying all of these things their business will improve more.

Rosenda's dream is that someday they will own a boat and fish cage. Now they will work hard to make this dream possible. And after this dream becomes a reality of course the result will be that their income will increase and they will help their children in providing for their children; and they will be able to release their family from the shadow of poverty.

loans.use: To finance their fishing business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn T. is now 34 years old and she has four children. She is married to Larry T. and they live peacefully in the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Having great ambition to their children makes them to work hard to earn a living and finance the schooling of their children.

The major source of their living is through farming.They till their land twice a year, planting rice and vegetables. Furthermore, Marilyn engages in buying and selling vegetables and fruits in their village. She sells her products at Solano Public Market during market days and also to their village through house-to-house delivery. She uses her income to meet their daily needs and to finance the tuition fees of their children. She wants to acquire and sell more fruits and vegetables but she cannot purchase more due to lack of capital. Therefore, she wants to borrow PHP 6,000 to be added in her capital to acquire more products to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more  fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime tills his 1-hectare rice field with diligence. At 52, he is still strong enough to manage his farm. He is married and has four kids. His oldest child is now 27 years old.

Jaime shared that his farm needs financing, which is something he cannot provide right now. He sought the help of CEVI, an MFI (micro-finance institution) in the Philippines and also a KIVA field partner. He asked for a loan of 14,000 PHP. With this loan, Jaime will be able to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies he needs.

loans.use: Fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Benta

texts.en: Benta A. runs two businesses. The first is a small green grocery kiosk and the second is the Mvulimivu Hair Salon, where she offers plaiting, weaving, applying treatment and retouching. Her business challenges are managing water shortages and the ups and downs in customer demands. She is using the loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to restock her green grocery kiosk. Benta is married to a day laborer and the couple has two daughters and one son. She describes herself as a well-rounded lady who is polite and cooperative. She dreams of seeing her children complete university education, owning a home and meeting her family's needs without much hassle.

loans.use: To restock her green grocery kiosk

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is engaged in a joint business with her husband: the molding and selling of cement blocks, a business they started way back in 1990. She is 45 years old, and the mother of five children. She is a member of the Kiva field partner, LAPO.

With the profit made from the business, her children’s school fees are taken care of, and they are provided with the basic necessities of life as enjoyed by other children.

Florence is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cement and sand for the molding of blocks.

loans.use: To purchase more cement and sand

loans.name: Saraí Del Carmen

texts.es:
Saraí Martinez se ha destacado por haber iniciado desde hace siete años su negocio y de venta de ropa ofreciendo pequeñas cantidades de ropa pero hoy en día ha logrado mejorar grandemente las condiciones por lo que ahora tiene más surtido el negocio.

Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. También comprará zapatos para la venta y así continuar mejorando las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Seven years ago, Saraí Martinez started a business selling clothes. She began offering her products in small quantities but today she has been able to greatly improve the conditions of her business. Now her establishment is well-stocked.

The loan she requested will be used to buy clothing for women, men, and children. She will also buy shoes to sell so that she can continue to improve the condition of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en: Mrs. Bonifacia H. is from the village of Upper Sto. Nino, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old and married with two children. As of now both are already working. Bonifacia owns a rice field of almost three hectares (7.5 acres) and, aside from that, has animals. Both she and her husband are farmers and there are times that her husband drives a motorcycle to support their daily needs. Bonifacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial support. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. The purpose of that loan was to buy fertilizer for her rice field. As of now, Bonifacia has a new loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC and it’s her 4th loan from the cooperative. She obtained this loan to purchase a new set of chemicals for her next crop. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, por lo que tiene más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que tiene que mantener a sus 2 hijos que son menores de edad. Por lo que desde muy temprano ella se levanta a organizar los productos que tiene que mostrar a cada uno de sus clientes, por lo que cada uno tiene diferentes gustos y además los encargos son diferentes. Pues ella es una persona muy responsable. Ella necesita este financiamiento para la compra de lápiz labial, maquillaje, cremas, colonias y shampoo. Su deseo es establecer una tienda en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Anita has sold cosmetics for over 3 years. She is in this line of work because she has two, minor children to support. Because of this, she rises very early in the morning to organize the products that she must show each of her customers because each one of them has her own particular taste and the orders placed are all different. She is a very responsible person. She needs the financing to buy lipsticks, make-up, creams, colognes and shampoo. Her wish is to set up a store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila G. is from the village of Dapacan Alto Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Teofila is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teofila owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Teofila has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teofila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Teofila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Teofila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: LA SEÑORA  BEATRIZ ESTA CASADA VIVE EN CASA DE LA PRIMA DE SU ESPOSO CON EL Y SUS 2 HIJITOS LOS CUALES ESTUDIAN EN UN COLEGIO FISCAL LA SEÑORA, COMPRA Y VENDE CORTADORAS PARA PLASTOFORMO YA LLEVA CON ESTE NEGOCIO 5 AÑOS DONDE ELLA Y SU ESPOSO LLEVAN ESTOS A LOS COLEGIOS COMO TAMBIEN VIAJAN PARA PROMOCIONAR LAS CORTADORAS,LA SEÑORA SACO EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR MATERIAL Y ASI PODER FABRICARLOS YA QUE ELLA Y SU ESPOSO TOMARON UNAS PEQUEÑAS CLASES PARA APRENDER A FABRICARLOS AHORA ELLOS LO FABRICARAN Y VENDERAN COMO LO HACEN VIAJANDO LLEVANDO A LOS COLEGIOS A PROMOCIONAR ESTOS. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MATERIAL PARA LA ELABORACION DE PLASTOFORMOS,  LA SEÑORA Y SU FAMILIA ESTAN FELICES POR LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE LES DIERON YA QUE LA TASA PREFERNCIAL LE VAJO LA CUOTA QUE IBA A CANCELAR Y EL SOBRANTE LE SERVIRA PARA COMPRAR UN POCO MAS DE MATERIAL.
texts.en:
Beatriz is married. She lives in her husband's cousin's house with her husband and their two little children who are students at the public school. She buys and sells styrofoam cutters. She's had this business for five years where she and her husband take these items to schools. They also travel to promote the cutters. Beatriz took out the loan to buy material to make them since she and her husband took some small classes to learn how. Now they will make and sell them as usual by traveling and taking them to schools to promote them. With the money from the loan, she will buy material to make styrofoam. Beatriz and her family are happy for the opportunity given to them since the preferential rate lowers the fee that they were going to pay and the rest will serve to buy a little more material.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia P. is from the village of Sta. Maria Tangub City. She is 46 years-old and married with three school-aged children.   Ofelia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ofelia joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell in the future. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ofelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional garment-making materials

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa R., 42 years old, is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog Bukidnon. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living Elsa sells vegetables in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Elsa joined HSPFI in 2009 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting her third loan, for 11,000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to support her children’s education.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. Pech P. is an older woman and the widowed mother of four children. Three are now married and already have their own homes, while the remaining one is single. Pech P. has a financial earner in her daughter who is shown in the photo above, and who helps contribute to the family’s daily income by selling a few groceries in front of their home.

To pursue a daily income, Pech P. buys rice in bulk to resell to raise money. She also books the farmland where the rice is grown. She will harvest and sell the rice when it matures.

Pech P. is taking out her first loan to construct a hedge around her house in order to protect her property. She proposes to use any remaining money from the loan to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To construct a hedge around her house in order to protect her property

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunita M. has a son who is in pre-school. She lives in a single family accommodation. Mrs. M. and her husband Niroj M. make traditional idols. Idol-making work is their traditional job.

They make idols on order. In Nepal the demand for traditional idols is constantly increasing. They do not have enough money to invest in their work to meet the demand. Therefore, they are seeking a loan of NPR 10,000 to buy raw materials such as silver, gold, and wax to use to make idols.

loans.use: To buys raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Lun N., 50, is widowed and resides with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She produces cow ties for an income of USD 2.40 per day. Her child is a blacksmith, earning an income of USD 4 per day. N. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more nylons to produce more cow ties. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. N. appears in the photograph with her child.

loans.use: To buy more nylons to produce more cow ties.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice P., from the village of Tigbao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, is 24 years old, married and does not yet have children. To make a living, Janice raises chickens and works as a private teacher. Engaged in her business for two years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Janice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce P. is currently in the business of selling various items in a retail shop, such as boxes of tobacco, soap, etc. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and salt to sell.  

Joyce is 31 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and provide them with necessary scholastic materials.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema D. is from the town of Sindangan. She is 53 years old. Rema is married and has 3 children: two are already married, while the youngest is still studying. To make a living, Rema owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Rema has been engaged in her business for over 23 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rema joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rema is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rema from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Nana Efua

texts.en: Nana Efua A. sells corn dough at Elmina. Nana has been through senior high school. She is divorced and has three children. She is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy a bag of maize to prepare corn dough for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: buy a bag of maize to prepare corn dough for sale

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: La  Sra. Jenny G. C.  ella  se dedica al negocio de venta de fritanga y tortilla, ella tiene ocho  años de dedicarse a esta actividad es casada actualmente, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  doce créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno  los ha realizado para la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así ampliarlo,  los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su negocio y su   condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jenny G. C. sells fried snacks and tortillas.  She has been in this business for 8 years.  She is married and has a school aged son.

She has had 12 CEPRODEL loans which have all been used to buy merchandise for her business in order to enlarge it.  

Ceprodel loans have been of great use to her because they have improved her business and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her snack shop.

loans.name: Kom

texts.en:
Mrs. Kom Y. is a 45-year-old resident of a local village in Kompong Tom Province. She is a mother of five children, four of whom are single. Her husband Krin is a fisherman, while Kom owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, and her crops are growing well.

Kom presently earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind her house, selling their eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house. She is now applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional ducks to produce eggs for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional ducks to produce eggs to sell.

loans.name: Davagsumberel

texts.en: Davagsumberel T. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home, in Mongolia's Arhangai province. His oldest child is a university student, and his youngest child attends a local secondary school. Davagsumberel operates a tire repair and service business in his town. He began his business in 2004 with 50,000 MNT in working capital, which has since grown to 2,000,000 MNT. Over the years, he has built a stable and successful operation and has gained significant experience. For the future, he hopes to continue to grow his business. Davagsumberel is a gentle and hardworking man, and he says: "All I want is to expand my business and hand it down to my son." He is a modest and hardworking person who is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT in order to purchase tires for his repair center.

loans.use: To purchase tires

loans.name: Maqboolan's Group

texts.en:
Maqboolan helps her family financially by selling bed sheets. She purchases them from Lahore and sells to her local area customers. She has a good reputation among her clients for the good variety and quality of her bed sheets. She started this business after the death of her husband, and now her business is doing well and providing her with a regular income every month.

She lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and known for its agricultural industry. She lives in a 2 room brick house with her family in the area named EID Gah. She moved there 30 years ago. Maqboolan has 2 sons. Her elder son sells fruits. He puts the fruits on his four-wheeled cart early in the morning and sells it in different streets of the city. Her younger son works in the factory on a monthly wage. 

Maqboolan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantity to offer to his customers and increase sales. He has been doing this business for the past 5 years, and Maqboolan is hopeful that an investment will be a good step towards the positive growth of her son’s fruit selling business. She is a new loan applicant and applying for a loan for the first time.

This is a group loan. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Maqboolan.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit selling business.

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr: Dodji a 28 ans et est marié. IL a 2 enfants en sa charge et est né à Lomé. Il est revendeur de quincaillerie et compte dans cette activité près de 5 ans. IL s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend sur le boulevard Félix Houphouët Boigny.  Il sollicite le crédit pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Dodji is 28 years old and married. He was born in Lomé and has two children in his care. He is a retailer of hardware items and has been in this business for close to 5 years. He gets his supplies at the grand market in Lomé and resells them on the Félix Houphouët Boigny Boulevard. He is seeking this loan to obtain fresh supplies.

loans.use: To buy hardware items

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a single woman with two children, one still attends school while the eldest has graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

She has been operating a firewood selling business for the past three months, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells charcoal and owns rental houses to contribute to her income. Violet faces a major challenge in seasonality.  During the rainy winter season the supply of firewood is low, hence does not meet the demand of customers. She hopes to build more rental houses in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business. With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and pay for electrical wiring in her home.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, and pay for electrical wiring in home

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married woman from Lebanon living with her husband. She has worked as an esthetic specialist since 2005. Because of her reputation, she has been able to build a good number of customers who are very satisfied with her work. She cooperates with her husband in the family’s income. She is willing to have a baby in the near future so she hopes to get additional income to get ready for the maternity period. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a laser machine to be able to accommodate her clients who are asking her to offer this service.

loans.use: To purchase a laser machine

loans.name: Euladia

texts.es: Euladia, de 23 años, es una joven muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Noel (24)  y su pequeña hija, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Los largos días de trabajo que tiene en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, los plátanos y el café que cultiva, están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos naturales. Además le gusta cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde hace cuatro  años realizando y considera que lo más difícil  es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, pues es algo lejano a su zona. Para el futuro  espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción.Este es el tercer préstamo de Euladia con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta.Euladia tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados en la compra de  abono e insecticidas, para cuidar sus tierras, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Euladia is 23 years old. She is a humble and hardworking young woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Noel (24), and their young daughter, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Her long work days on her land have made her into a person who knows a lot about agriculture. The plantains and coffee that she plants are well cared for and she always gets a good sale price for her natural products. She likes growing crops, and she has been doing this activity for four years. She considers the most difficult thing to be transporting her products to the market in the city of Pichanaki, which is a little far away from her area. In the future she hopes to buy more land and thus increase her production. This is Eudalia's  third loan with MFP and she is saving to be able to make her payments, since she doesn't want to cause any problems for the other members of her community bank, where she is very happy. Euladia is planning on investing the five hundred soles she has asked for in buying fertilizer ad insecticide to care for her land. In this way, she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide to improve her crops.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”YANAPAKUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia tiene su negocio de restaurante ella brinda los servicios de almuerzo y cena la socia está a cargo de la administración de este negocio y a veces ella también cocina esta es una actividad que le gusta mucho realizar y de paso ella está más tiempo con su hijo sin tener un horario de oficina, la socia es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio como aceite, arroz, azúcar, menestras entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Yanapakuy". It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Josefina. She is 25 years old, married common-law, and the mother of one son. She has a restaurant and she serves lunch and dinner. She takes care of the administration of the business and sometimes she also does the cooking, something she really enjoys to do. She is also able to spend time with her son because she doesn’t have an office schedule. She is a very optimistic person, with a great desire to get ahead.

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of that loan.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jinifer

texts.en:
Jinifer is a 30-year-old married who supports her family by operating general store, a carinderia (eatery), and a ready-to-wear clothes business.  She lives in Compostela, Cebu. 

Jinifer has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,400. 

Jinifer is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell.   This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Jinifer aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference  in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Merimy

texts.en:
Merimy is a 47-year-old married woman wH. supports her family by operating four business ventures: food, general store, ready to wear clothing and frozen foods. She lives in Manapla, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. Merimy is borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she could fund operations. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merimy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community wH. has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a very hardworking married man with seven children. He is the sole breadwinner of the family and lives in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He longs to educate his children up to university. 

For 10 years, he has been rearing animals. He has challenges in transport costs and prolonged dry seasons; however, he wishes to set up a modern farm. Saidi needs the loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Cookies Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Cookies" esta ubicado en el estado de México, esta conformado por 9 integrantes entre ellas la señora Dulce Maria D. D. tiene dos negocios vende tacos los fines de semana y por las tardes vende papas fritas Tiene una hija de 3 años de edad y nos platica que desde muy pequeña tuvo muchos problemas de salud pues a su corta edad ya le realizaron dos operaciones en el corazon y una en los intestinos y eso fue lo que la impulso a iniciar su negocio ya que los ingresos de su esposo no alcanzaban para cubrir todos los gastos, ella anhela que su negocio prospere ya es un sustento para su familia. Con el prestamo que se le otorge va a comprar mercancia y asi poder hacer crecer su negocio y tener la seguradad para hacerle frente a cualquier problema.
texts.en:
This group is called "Cookies" and is located in the State of Mexico.  It has 9 members including Dulce Maria D. D. who has two businesses.  She sells tacos at weekends and, in the afternoons, she sells fries.

Dulce Maria has a 3 year-old daughter and she tells us that since she was very small she has had a lot of health problems.  At her young age she has already had two operations on her heart and one on her intestines.  This was what drove Dulce Maria to start her business since her husband's income didn't reach far enough to cover all the expenses.  One of her greatest wishes is for her business to prosper because it is a support to her family.  She will use the loan that she is granted to buy merchandise so that she can grow her business and know for certain that she will be able to face any problem.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne M. is a 26-year-old from the Lugulu area in Kakamega. She is married to Martin and they have two children aged four and two.  Carolyne runs a beauty salon, and also sells shoes to her clients. She is in need of towels, shampoo, and hair chemicals to add to her stock. She has applied for her second loan to enable her buy these items.  The profits generated from this business will be re-invested to ensure that the business grows. She hopes to be able to open a hairdressing college in the future.

loans.use: to buy towels, shampoo, and hair chemicals to add to her stock

loans.name: La Beneficiencia 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Silvenie is the group coordinator of L. Beneficiencia 2, 4 & 5 (Beneficence),  which is maD. up of fifteen micro-entrepreneurs. She said that her most difficult challenge is to improve her business.

Silvenie operates a "colmado", a grocery store, where most of her neighbors buy their daily meals. She will use the loan to purchase many items like rice, sugar, cooking oil, canned meal, vegetables, flour, etc. to increase her business inventory. She is excited to receive her 7th loan with Esperanza, as with each loan she has been able to make good investments in her business.

Silvenie represents women who decided to start small businesses to supplement the insufficient incomes their households receive. She started her business when she received her first Esperanza loan, almost four years ago. This group is located in the city of San Pedro D. Macoris, in one of the rural villages surrounding the main city. She enjoys attending church and working in her grocery store.

She thanks all of you for your support to her business and her group.

This group has two photos because there were too many to be in just one, and we tried to have the most visible faces by having two photos.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, canned meal, vegetables, flour, etc.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “SUMAC TIKA-VALLE SAGRADO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Qotohuycho, perteneciente a la Provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Cipriana, la socia tiene 40 años de edad;  la socia es casada, la socia tiene 6 hijos de 23, 23, 17, 14, 12, 10 años de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño negocio de venta de comida en el grifo principal de Urubamba; la socia elabora diferente potajes y los lleva en sus ollas especiales al grifo a vender sobre una carreta, ella tieen ya sus clientes que la buscan todos los días y le compran sus paltos típicos, la socia requiere el crédito para poder comprar insumos al por mayor tales como de preferencia, aceite, arroz, papa, fideos, queso, verduras y otros para poder cocinar en casa, a la socia le apoyan sus hijas y ella revierte lo que ingresa a su bolsa del hogar en la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos y elaborar sus platillos para la venta.

La  socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called "Sumac Tika-Valle Sagrado". It is located in the community of Qotohuycho, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Cipriana. She is 40 years old, married, and she has 6 children, aged, 23, 23, 17, 14, 12, and 10. She alternates her daily household activities with her small catering business in the downtown of Urubamba. She makes different foods and she takes them on her special pots to the area to sell on a wheelbarrow. She already has clients who look for her everyday to buy the traditional meals. She requests a loan to purchase ingredients in wholesale, such as cooking oil, rice, potatoes, pasta, cheese, vegetables, and other ingredients to be able to cook at home. Her daughters help her and she disburses what she earns to the household fund to provide the education and support of her children. She has requests a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare her foods for sale. 

She is thankful and she wants to underline that she will commit to her loan payments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients that she needs to prepare foods to sell.

loans.name: Rosario Emperatriz

texts.es:
Rosario es una mujer emprendedora de 41 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo e hija en una pequeña comunidad rural del distrito de Pacasmayo – La Libertad.

Rosario se dedica desde hace 10 años a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral (gallinas y pavos) y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida que la prefiere debido al buen tamaño y peso de sus crías y por la buena atención y carisma que tiene Rosario, quien labora en un mercadillo de la ciudad de Pacasmayo.

Rosario solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de aves de corral  y en el alimento balanceado que su crianza requiere. Esto le permitirá ampliar su negocio y tener mayores ventas para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Rosario goza de un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Rosario is an enterprising, 41-year-old woman living with her husband and daughter in a small rural community in Pacasmayo District, La Libertad.

Rosario has been raising barnyard fowl (turkeys and chickens) for the last 10 years.  He has a well established regular customer base that prefer her due to the good size and weight of her birds and for the good attention and charisma Rosario has; she works in a small market in the city of Pacasmayo.

Rosario is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy barnyard fowl and nutritionally balanced feed their development requires.  This will allow her to enlarge her business and have more sales to thus improve her quality of life.  Rosario has a good credit history.

loans.use: buy barnyard fowl and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan  dedicado al comercio de accesorios de ferretería esto en la feria de Quillacollo que por cierto solo son tres días a la semana una vez concluido la jornada el debe de recoger su mercadería para volver a traer la siguiente feria y esa es la rutina de don juan para poder comercializar sus productos y asi alimentar, vestir a toda su familia. El sueña con poder conformar su propia ferretería  estable alquilar un lugar y ofrecer ahí sus productos, con el dinero del crédito el Sr. Juan Comprara Carretillas para surtir mas su puesto ya que le hacen falta estos productos y los cliente le piden carretillas, el Sr. Juan es una persona responsable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan has a business selling hardware products at the Quillacollo market, which is open three days a week. When the market ends, Juan must collect all his merchandise and take it home and then bring it back the next day. This is Juan's routine, which he follows in order to sell his products and feed and clothe his family. His dream is to be able to open his own hardware store, to rent a  location and be able to offer his products there.   

With the loan, Juan will buy wheelbarrows to supply his business because he does not have them currently and his customers are always asking for them. Juan is a hardworking and responsible man. He is grateful to Emprender for the support it has given him.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrows.

loans.name: Merly Group

texts.en:
Merly is 46 years old and lives in Poblacion Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 6 children. 

To earn a living, Merly has a business selling of different snacks. She earns about PHP 3500 each month doing this type of work. Merly has a requested a loan to purchased raw ingredients for her snack vending.

Merly has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack business.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos es casada, tiene 46 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. asistir a la escuela, tiene 6 hijos 3 D. los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también a la artesanía  a la elaboración D. canasta D. plástico, inició este negocio gracia a un poco D. capital que tenia y hasta el momento lleva 5 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder solicitar  un préstamo que le servirá  para la compra D. cintas y venas D. plástico que es materia prima para la elaboración D. canastas ya que en el futuro desea ver su negocio mejor y más granD.. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, a la producción agrícola y a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Santos is married.  She’s 46 years old and never had the opportunity to go to school.  She has six children three of which are in school.  She is a housewife but also a craftswoman.  She makes plastic baskets.  She started the business thanks to a bit of capital she had and, to date, has five years experience.  She has support from her husband, who is a merchant.

She decided to organize a group to request a loan that she can use to buy plastic strips which is the raw material used to make the baskets because she’d like to see her business be larger and better in the future.  The other group members are in commerce, farming and crafts.

loans.use: to buy plastic strips.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 53, is a married woman with 10 children, aged 10 to 30. She is a farmer and helps her husband till their land in Surallah, South Cotabato. She also helps in growing rice crops and keeping the farm free of weeds and pests. Teresita also buys fresh fish and makes dried fish to sell. She works hard to help provide for their household needs and send her children to school.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and more fish to dry and sell. Teresita hopes for her family's living situation to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Candelaria Yolanda

texts.es: Candelaria vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 13 a 27  años,  en el barrio  20 de Julio, al sur de la ciudad, allí tiene una miscelánea en compañía de su esposo,  donde venden mercancía variada, accesorios, artículos para el hogar etc.,  negocio que inició desde hace 28 años, cuando llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Candelaria además ha aprovechado su punto de contacto con los clientes,  para ofrecer el servicio de telefonía celular, y también vende en los municipios del departamento del Atlántico, mercancías a crédito y cuenta con una cartera muy amplia.   Su sueño es lograr transmitir a sus hijos su capacidad empresarial para que en el futuro tengan su propio negocio. Aunque Candelaria se mueve en el mercado, no tiene el efectivo disponible para comprar en mayor volumen y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará exhibidores y mercancías como vestidos para damas, recipientes plásticos y calzado. Su rotación de inventario es de 32 días, y ella planea continuar ampliando sus ingresos mediante inyecciones de capital de trabajo a las cuales estaría accediendo con sus futuros credikivas, para que ella su esposo y su hijo tengan siempre ingresos productos de este negocio.
texts.en:
Candelaria lives with her husband and 4 children, who are between 13 and 27 years old.  She resides in the 20 de Julio neighborhood in the south of Barranquilla, where she has a general store with her husband.  They sell a variety of merchandise, accessories, things for the home, and so on.  They started this business 28 years ago, when they arrived in Barranquilla.  Candelaria uses her contact with clients to offer a cellphone service and also sells merchandise on credit around the cities of the Atlántico province; she has a large clientele. She hopes to spread the entrepreneurial spirit to her children so that they can have their own businesses in the future.  

Although Candelaria acts as a middleman, she does not have enough money available to buy in large quantities, and this is the reason she is asking for a loan.  She will buy samples and merchandise, such as women's clothing, plastic containers, and shoes.  Her inventory rolls over every 32 days, and she is planning to continue to raise her income by adding working capital with future loans so that she and her husband and son will always be able to make an income from this business.

loans.use: buy samples and merchandise, such as women's clothing, plastic containers, and shoes.

loans.name: Miguel Estuardo

texts.es:
Miguel Estuardo tiene 48 años de edad, vive en unión libre junto a su pareja y con sus dos hijos de catorce y tres años de edad, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Roca en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl, para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, urea, abonos orgánicos y semillas de maíz fréjol y arroz para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente  a toda la familia para poder suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para poder trabajar ampliamente y obtener mejores utilidades.

En su tiempo libre le gusta compartir con la familia salir de paseo, le gusta las fiestas del Catón ventans.
texts.en:
Miguel Estuardo is 48 years old and lives in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province with his common-law wife and their two children who are 14 and three years old.

The members of the "Nueva Esperanza" ["New Hope"] communal bank are located in the precinct of Jesús del Gran Poder, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Miguel works in agriculture. He plants corn, rice and pigeon peas. He buys his products at the Roca trading post in Ventanas and sells his products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to plant corn, rice and pigeon peas. He will buy manure, fertilizer, herbicides, urea, and corn and rice seeds. The support from this loan will help him and his entire family economically, so that they can cover their necessities. He faces challenges like insect plagues and plant illnesses. His dream is to buy a plot of land where he can work enough to be more profitable.

In his free time, Miguel likes to go for walks with his family. He also likes the festivals of Ventanas canton.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, herbicides, urea and seeds

loans.name: Salambogo
