texts.en: Salambogo is a thirty-one-year-old married man with four children, and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been buying and selling coffee for fifteen years. He started out with 500,000 shillings and now has 7,000,000 shillings as his working capital. His vision is supplying coffee to the East African region and educating his children. Salambogo needs the loan to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: To buy coffee for resale.

loans.name: Josué Nehemías

texts.es: Josué Nehemías de 25 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto con su querida familia la cual está conformada por su madre de 40 años y su hijo de 7 años.  Josué es un hombre trabajador, emprendedor y sobre todo amable. Gracias a estas grandes características y su gran espíritu de superación ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas los cuales lo admiran por ser un hombre integro. Él se dedica a la venta de sorbetes artesanales de manera ambulante en las principales zonas donde él reside. Muchas personas lo prefieren porque cuando de sorbetes se trata él es el indicado ya que ofrece deliciosos sorbetes artesanales para todos los gustos y preferencias, en sabores de melon, arrayan, coco y tamarindo,todos recubiertos con una jalea de piña y lo mejor de todo es que ofrece los mejores precios. Su sueño es dar a su hijo el estudio para que un día pueda tener el gusto de verlo convertido en un gran profesional. Esta es la razón por la cual día con día realiza su trabajo con mucho orgullo y dedicación. Esto lo ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios para la  fabricación de los sorbetes artesanales y además para invertir en la reparación y equipamiento de su bicicleta de reparto, de tal manera que esto le ayude a lograr su sueño y dar a su familia estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Josué Nehemías is 25 years old and lives in his own house, together with his beloved family, comprised of his 40 year-old mother and 7 year-old son. Josué is a hard-working man, entrepreneurial, and above all, friendly. Thanks to these great characteristics and his strong desire to overcome, he has succeeded in gaining the confidence of many people who admire him as a man of integrity.

He sells artisanal sorbets in an ambulatory manner, in all of the main zones of the area where he lives. Many people prefer his business because when it comes to sorbets, he is the one known to offer delicious artisanal sorbets for every taste and preference. He has flavors like melon, myrtle, coconut and tamarind, all covered with a pineapple jelly. Best of all, he offers the best prices.

Josúe's dream is to give his son an education so that, one day, he can have the pleasure of seeing him grow into a great professional. This is the reason why Josúe performs his work each day with pride and dedication. It also motivated him to request this loan from INTEGRAL, in order to invest in his business by purchasing the necessary ingredients for making artisanal sorbets. He will also invest in the repair and equipment of the bicycle he uses to distribute his sorbets. In this way, the loan will help him to achieve his dream and to give his family economic stability.

loans.use: to buy the necessary ingredients for making artisanal sorbets and to repair the bicycle he uses for distribution

loans.name: Victorio

texts.en:
Victorio is 51 years old and single. He lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. For the past 23 years, he has owned and operated a piggery in his barangay (village) and he earns 5,000 PHP each month. Victorio has been a member of GDMPC for about a year.  

Victorio is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy feed and supplies for his pigs. His loan will  help him to buy what he needs. Victorio's major business problem is the diseases he encounters. In the future, his dream is to buy more pigs and increase production. 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. GDMPC is people empowering people.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplies

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 9, 6 y 3 años, tiene una tienda D. productos básicos: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, detergentes, debido que hay mucha demanda D. clientes comienza su jornada D. 6 am a 7 pm, todos los días D. lunes a domingo. 
Ella necesita el préstamo para fortalecer su negocio y comprar más mercadería como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, gaseosa, boquitas, galletas y poder mejorar su inventario y obtener más beneficios.
El propósito D. María es siempre mantener su tienda surtida y D. esa manera mantener a sus hijos D. las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and three children, ages nine, six, and three. She has a store where she sells staple products like rice, beans, sugar, coffee, and detergent. Due to her customers’ wishes, she begins her work day at 6 am and ends at 7 pm every day, Monday through Sunday.
She needs the loan to improve her business and to purchase more merchandise – such as rice, beans, sugar, soda, sweets, and cookies, and also to be able to improve her inventory and earn more profits.
María aims to always keep her store well-supplied, and in that way be able to care for her children with the profits she earns.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, sugar, soda, sweets, and cookies.

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es:
María tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Cayaltí, una zona que es conocida por la actividad agrícola y ganadera de sus pobladores. 

Desde hace unos años tiene instalado en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Cayaltí un puesto de venta de verduras y tuberculos. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad de vegetales y tubérculos frescos. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda para su hogar. El negocio de María siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. 

Ella desea adquirir más verduras y tuberculos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo pude ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en:
María is 33 and lives with her family in their own house, which has water and electricity services. It is located in the urban area of Cayaltí district, an area where people make their living farming and raising livestock.

For a few years, she has had a stand selling vegetables and potatoes set up in the produce market in the city of Cayaltí.  Every day, she offers her customers a variety of fresh vegetables and potatoes. 

This business is an important source of support for her household.  María's business always has customers who prefer her good service and friendliness.

She wants to buy more vegetables and potatoes, so she has decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles.  With the loan she can expand her business, and improve her family's quality of life with the earnings she gets.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and potatoes, in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Marmashen.  She is married and has a two-year-old son.  Anna finished college with a teaching degree.  With difficult economic times, she has been farming the family land for the past five years.  She is working hard and would like to expand her business.  She would like a loan to purchase additional livestock.  She expects this investment to grow her net income by fifteen percent.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance and the reasonable rates.  Anna dreams of renovating her home.  She was born in Marmashen and enjoys the rural life.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
Aurea e socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 2 años.
Aurea se dedica a la venta de quesos los que lleva a la Selva. Tambien tiene una carpintería.
Con los préstamos que ha recibido ha podido comprar una máquina circular de carpintería y máquina de coser. Gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, sobre los valores, como cuidar su salud y a educar a sus hijos.
con el préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra de maderas y quesos.
Su meta es hacer su casa y abrir su tienda.
texts.en:
Aurea has been a member of the Prosperidad community bank, a partner of FINCA Peru, for 2 years.  
She has a cheese-sales business and a carpentry shop.
She plans to use this loan to buy a circular saw and a "maquina de coser" [normally a sewing machine, but looks like something else here].  Thanks to the training that she's received from her community bank, she has learned the importance of saving, as well as other basic skills.
Aurea will use this loan to buy wood for her carpentry shop and cheese for her cheese-sales business.
Her goals are to improve her house and open a store.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry business and cheese for her cheese-sales business.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Vive con su familia en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Pueblo Libre Dist. Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicada a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. Víctor vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

La actividad que desarrolla Víctor es la crianza de ganado menor (ovinos, porcinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.  Adicionalmente es agricultor con parcela propia de 0.62 has, en la cual tiene mango y limón en producción, además de trabajar en un mototaxi la cual le genera ingresos diarios.  Esto le sirve para solventar sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Víctor desea comprar fertilizantes para su terreno donde ha sembrado mango y otras frutas.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.

Víctor es una persona emprendedora y luchadora.
texts.en:
Victor is 53 years old, married, and has 2 children.  He lives with his family in his own house, which is located in the rural Pueblo Libre settlement in the Tambogrande district.  This is in the Piura region, 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.  Victor lives in a rural part of this district that does not have basic utilities (water or electricity). 

Victor is developing a business raising small animals (sheep, pigs and poultry).  Once the animals reach an ideal size and weight, he sells them in the local market.  In addition, he is a farmer with his own parcel of .62 hectares, where he cultivates mangoes and lemons.  He also works with a mototaxi (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle) with which he generates daily earnings.  These activities serve to cover his personal expenses and the expenses of his family.

Victor wants to buy fertilizers for the fields where he is cultivating mangoes and other fruit.  For this reason, he thought it would be a good idea to request a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Victor is a tenacious and enterprising person.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, a widow, is 44 years old and has five children. She works at a rice field and at a rubber plantation as a worker. She started farming on her rice field 17 years ago in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district to feed her family. 

This is Oun's first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy rice seeds for her rice field. With this loan, she hopes to make more rice and earn more income to better feed her family and also build on some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Veronica Beatriz

texts.es:
Verónica, nuevamente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, comprando más productos de la canasta básica como: arroz, frijoles, ropa nueva y bisutería todo esto para ofrecer a los clientes variedad de productos, y así ir aumentando la demanda. Ella ha logrado mejorar su negocio a través del préstamo, ya que ha incluido diversidad de productos para los clientes, permitiéndole mejorar e innovar la atención.
Culmino su ultimo prestamo con unos dias de retraso pero espera esta nueva deuda cancelarla a tiempo.
texts.en: Verónica is once again requesting a loan to invest in her business buying more basic staple items like rice, beans, new clothes and costume jewelry to offer her customers a variety of products and to increase demand.  She’s managed to improve her business through the loan because she’s included a diversity of products for her customers allowing her to improve and innovate customer service.  She was a few days late in paying off her previous loan but she hopes on this occasion to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, new clohtes and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan es cliente distinguido de la institución, es una persona  muy  trabajadora  que  se preocupa   día  con día  por  sacar  adelante a  su  familia, es por  ello  que desea comenzar un negocio de  venta  de  comida, para   lo cual  ya   cuenta  con una  traila donde iniciara con su proyecto,  pero  nos  comenta  que  le  hace  falta la rotulación de la misma, ve  en  el  crédito la posibilidad  de  obtener  mayores  ingresos que le permitan  tener una excelente  estabilidad  económica.
texts.en: Juan is a distinguished client of the institution.  He is a very hardworking person who strives daily to move his family forward.  Because of this he wants to start a business selling food.  He already has a trailer that he’ll use to start this project but he comments that he still needs signage on it.  He sees in the loan the possibility of obtaining higher income that will allow him to have an excellent economic stability.

loans.use: to pay for signage on the trailer.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима замужем и любящая мать шестерых детей. Её семья большая и она решила помогать мужу в содержания семьи. Более 17 лет она занимается купле- продажей женских тканей. Салима имеет широкий ассортимент товаров и имеет много постоянных клиентов. Салима хотела бы получить займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки новых товаров с целью пополнения оборотного капитала и улучшения ассортимента тканей. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Salima is married and is a loving mother of six children.  Her family is large, and she decided to help her husband to support the family.  She has been involved in buying and selling women's fabrics for over 17 years.  Salima has a wide selection of merchandise and has many regular customers.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of new merchandise in order to increase her working capital and improve the selection of fabrics.  Salima relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in order to expand merchandise selection

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children.
 
Imelda has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Imelda a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 45 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is divorced with three children. 

Jonah has a hog-raising business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more feed for her hog-raising business.

Jonah has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Jonah hopes to own a piggery and save more money because she wants her three children to finish their studies so they can have a good future. Jonah has a strong personality and she takes good care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 44 años está casado con la señora Silvana, tienen 3 hijas pequeñas de las cuales dos son gemelas, son una familia unida pero de escasos recursos económicos, aun no cuentan con casa propia viven en la zona norte de la ciudad de Cochabamba en anticrético,  viven en dos cuartos donde se encuentran muy incomodos. El señor José trabaja en un canal televiso como editor y jefe de producción, pues toda la familia depende de ese sueldo ya que la esposa no trabaja por cuidar a sus hijas.
El destino del crédito es para la compra de una computadora, esta compra  ayudara de mucho al cliente   porque le servirá como herramienta de trabajo para la edición y también para los estudios de la hija mayor.
Entre sus sueños y metas es comprar una casita pequeña donde puedan vivir más cómodos, y lo más importante que las hijas puedan estudiar una carrera profesional para que de esa manera puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 44 years old. He is married to Silvana and they have 3 small daughters, two of whom are twins. They are a close-knit family but of limited economic resources; they have yet to own their own house. They live in the north area of the city of Cochabamba under the “anticrético” agreement (the owner leases a property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.) They live in two rooms where they are very uncomfortable.

Jose works for a television station as an editor and production manager, the family depends on that salary as his wife doesn't work because she takes care of their daughters.

The loan is to purchase a computer. This purchase helps the client a lot because it will serve as a work tool for editing as well as for the eldest daughter's studies.

Among their dreams and goals is to buy a small house where they can live more comfortably, and most importantly that their daughters can study a degree so that they can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a computer for editing.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.en:
Mauricio lives in Pedro Escobedo Queretaro, with 20 years old, he is married and has a small son who loves with all his heart. Mauricio worked as employee from a Car Wash and learned that working and making good decisions are the success to be better every day. For this reason and for the love to his family, Mauricio offered the services from Car Wash to different companies and he had great success. Now he has a small place for his particular cars wash and his wife is the female leader. He has 4 employees and plans to improve their small business.

He requires a loan of $475 USD. To purchase car washed materials, Mauricio says that the new material will help to save time in his business, and also makes easy, simple and faster the job to his employees. For that reason, they will be increase the washed cars quantity. Mauricio and his beautiful family thank your support.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Mauricio vive en Pedro Escobedo Querétaro, con 20 años D. edad esta casado y tiene un pequeño hijo al que ama con todo su corazón. Mauricio trabajo como empleado D. un lavado D. automóviles y aprendió que el trabajo y la disciplina es el éxito para ser mejor cada día. Por esta razón y por el amor a su familia, Mauricio ofreció los servicios D. lavado D. autos a diferentes empresas y tuvo gran éxito. Ahora tiene un pequeño local para el lavado D. autos particulares y su esposa es la supervisora. Tiene 4 trabajadores y tiene planes para mejorar su pequeño negocio.

El requiere D. un préstamo D. $475 USD. para la compra D. equipo D. auto lavado, Mauricio dice que este nuevo equipo ayudara a ahorrar tiempo en el lavado D. un carro, además D. facilitar el trabajo a sus empleados. D. esta manera podrán aumentar la cantidad D. autos lavados. Mauricio y su hermosa familia agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase car washed materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: I am a 56-year-old grandmother of 15. I sell fruits. I take care of 9 grandchildren. Their parents passed on due to HIV/AIDS. I do this business to meet the basic needs of food and shelter for my grandchildren.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.en:
Maximiliano has been living on his ranch for over thirty years. There he has been able to cultivate rice and raise cattle in order to support his family. He has two sons who help him on the farm. One is 17 years old, and the other is 16. He also has a young 7-year-old daughter who is going to school. He and his wife hope to make the necessary investments in rice that will ensure that the crop goes well, such as fertilizer and pesticides. With this crop cycle's extra profits, they hope to save enough money to make some improvements to their home. He is pictured with Esther from the Mifex staff.

Max is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserves for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water basins that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the freshwater Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provide services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to sell them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in a rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Rugie

texts.en: Rugie M. was born in Northern Sierra Leone.  She is thirty-five years of age and is married. Her husband is currently unemployed.  With three children, Rugie takes care of the family expenses. She sells sandals in the center of town and offers a wide selection to her customers. With her business income, Rugie has been able to provide three meals a day for the family.  She will use the larger second loan for expanding her business and she is determined to improve the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: Increase the selection and variety of sandals she sells

loans.name: Iliganoa

texts.en: Iliganoa is 37 and a mother of six children. She runs a fishing business with her husband. Both she and the husband go out fishing 3 days a week if it’s good weather, but when the weather’s bad, her husband will go alone. The fish they catch they sell along the road side instead of transporting it to the main fish market in town. Most of the people who buy from them are passers by, because they know that they always sell fresh fish. Iliganoa feels that there should be an improvement to their business, which is why she’s now applying for a loan to purchase a fishing boat for her business. She believes that this boat will help them catch more fish and big ones too. She has got all her equipments needed and is looking forward to her new boat.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase a paopao (fishing boat)

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Married to a retailer, Mr. Kokou ABBOSSOU-SESSOU is a driver and is responsible for the care of four children. He was born in 1972 in Lome in the Gulf prefecture. Unable to continue his studies, he began learning how to drive and his late father bought him a van which allows him to partly support his family with help from his wife. The car, which isn't in good condition, creates many expenses for him and for this reason he would like a loan of $1000 to buy another van.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Marié à une revendeuse, monsieur Kokou A. est chauffeur et à quatre personnes à charge. Il est né en 1972 à Lomé dans la préfecture du golfe. Ne pouvant pas continuer ses études, il s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage de la conduite et son feu père lui a acheté un bus qui lui permet de subvenir partiellement au besoin de sa famille avec l’aide de sa femme. Cette voiture qui n’est pas aussi en bon état aujourd’hui lui crée trop de dépenses et pour cela il désire avoir un prêt de $1000 pour acheter un autre bus.

loans.use: Purchase of a van for transport

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.pt:
Lurdes Luis is 43 years old and a single mother of 3 children. She lives in the Magoanine district in Maputo. She entered the program in June of 2005 as a member of the Ahiculene group. She sells various food products such as cooking oil, sugar, cornmeal, rice, potatoes, onions, vegetables, etc. She has grown substantially in her business and in her social economic situation. When she entered the program she lived with her parents, and with the loans she was able to build her own home. She is taking a $625US loan and intends to restock her business and invest in some home improvements.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer.

Lurdes L. tem 43 anos de idade e mãe solteira de 3 filhos. Vive no bairro Magoanine em Maputo.Entrou para o programa em Junho de 2005 como membro do grupo Ahiculene. Vende diversos produtos alimentares como óleo alimentar, açúcar, farinha de milho, arroz, batata, cebola, legumes, etc.Tem estado a avoluir bastante tanto no negócio , como na situação sócio económica. Quando entrou para o programa, vivia na residência dos seus pais e com os empréstimos conseguiu construir residência própria.Vai tomar 15.000MT e pretende,para além de reforçar o stock, investir também no melhoramento da sua residência em construção.

loans.use: Increase inventory and construction

loans.name: Mwazani

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 42-year-old Mwazani M.. She is married with two children, ages 15 and 17. In 1990 Mwazani established a business selling tomatoes, and in 2000 another selling samosas (a filled, fried pocket). Mwazani has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requests a loan of $700 in order to purchase additional stock and ingredients in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Tillojon

texts.en:
A. Tillojon is 52 years old. She and her husband, a pensioner have raised 7 children. 

Tillojon sells foodstuffs like pastries, cookies, candies, condensed milk, tea, and canned meat in the local market. Tillojon has been in this business for 27 years. Tillojon is very polite and her trading place is very popular in the market. The business generates the main income for the family. 

Tillojon requests 3 500.00 Somoni (1,025.00 US Dollars) for the term of 3 months. She is going to spend the loan to purchase more inventory.  Tillojon has proved herself as an honest and reliable client. She thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs  to expand the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Iva Center - Group 3

texts.en:
Group 3 of the Iva Centre is the newest group of women who have joined the program.  More women are joining and enlisting in SPBD's training program since the excitement has spread throughout the village.

Participants learn about savings and loan schemes, business planning, and managing household finances.  Most of them are engaged in farming, but the women are aware of other possibilities.  Some are planning to process their products (for example taro and banana chips) before selling them in the market.  Others are planning to open flea markets where they can sell not only agricultural products but a whole range of other necessary commodities.  The weekly meetings that they attend are very enlightening for all of them.  It is in these meetings that they are able to share ideas and support each other.

loans.use: to purchase farming implements, agricultural supplies and pay for additional farm labor

loans.name: Hai Damaska 2014-2 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Gesayi F.. She is currently in the business of selling at a shop and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Gesayi is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband is a business man. They have 5 children ranging from age 10 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Gesayi makes approximately 280 Sudanese pound in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay fees for her children.

Gesayi is joined in her small group by Rejoice Peter, Jane M., Diana J., and Victoria J.. Rejoice Peter has a business in selling breads and beer and wants to expand the business. Jane M. is currently operating a business in selling vegetable and wants a loan to expand the business. Diana J. operates a business of selling breads and mangoes and wants to expand her business. Victoria J. is currently in the business of brewing alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Martina Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel started the business because she was pregnant and did not have insurance. She needed to pay the medical expenses and purchase the items that the baby will be needing. She started by helping a lady in the preparation of various food dishes. Later on she would sell the meals ( different stews, roasted cortadillo, stuffed chiles, tostadas, etc.) to offices and businesses and noticed that she was selling a lot. At that point she decided to go on her own, with the help of her children, providing the meals.

She is requesting a loan of USD $575 which she will repay in six months, to purchase the ingredients necessary to prepare a banquet for a wedding.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel inició el negocio por que no contaba con seguro y estaba embarazada por lo cual necesitaba pagar los gastos médicos y las cosas que el bebe necesitara por lo que inicio ayudándole a una Sra. a la elaboración de los platillos. Después ella ofrecía los platillos en las oficinas y los negocios de diferentes guisos como asado cortadillo chiles rellenos tostadas etc.) y veía que vendían mucho por lo que decidió independizarse con la ayuda de sus hijos en la entrega de los platillos.

Solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de los ingredientes para la realización de un banquete para una boda.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. sells charcoal. He is married, but his wife's income from farming does not cover the expenses for Mana and his four dependents. Nana has many customers who want charcoal.

He plans to use the loan to expand his business so he can increase his profits, and provide more income for his family.

loans.use: Purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
The women of the Benkadi group are married and have on average an age of 22 and four children. They live in polygamous households and reside in the village of Banankoro (Kati prefecture) in the Koulikoro region. The women of the Benkadi group are united professionally and by friendship, and they have all developed in the sector of small-scale commerce in various articles (soap, tea, cigarettes, catering, etc.)

For the most part, they get their supplies locally, in the village, from wholesalers (daily or weekly) and make their sales from displays at the marketplace of the same village, located along the axis road linking Bamako to the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire. Their customers, essentially composed of women, make their purchases throughout the day, sometimes even at night at their homes.

This group of Benkadi women is on its first collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. It intends to use this loan to buy a few boxes of soap, tea, packs of cigarettes, a large amount of condiments, and sacks of rice and of millet. They hope to realize a monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA each.

The group aspires to establish an EIG (Economic Interest Group) in order to organize their business better and to defend their interests better.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées avec une moyenne d’age de 22 ans et 4 enfants .Elles vivent dans des foyers polygames, et résident dans le village de Banankoro Préfecture de Kati Région de Koulikoro.

Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont unies par des relations d’amitié et professionnelles et évoluent toutes dans le secteur du petit commerce d’articles divers (savon, thé, cigarettes, restauration etc.).

Elles s’approvisionnent très généralement sur place au village auprès des grossistes (quotidiennement ou hebdomadairement) et vendent sur des étales au marché du même village situé sur l’axe routier reliant Bamako à la République de la Cote D’ivoire. Leur clientèle, essentiellement composée de femmes fait des achats durant toute la journée, même quelque fois la nuit à domicile.

Ce groupe de femmes Benkadi est à sa première collaboration avec l’Institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt quelques cartons de savons, de thé, des cartouches de cigarettes, une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires, des sacs de riz et de mil. Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 CFA chacune. Le groupe ambitionne de mettre en place un GIE (Groupement d’Intérêt Economique) afin de mieux organiser leurs activités et mieux défendre leurs intérêts.

loans.use: To buy various articles

loans.name: Gran Esfuerzo I Group

texts.en:
CriseL. H. is a 32-year-old woman who lives with her husband and five children (ages 14, 12, 10, 8, and 6) in a small Haitian community called Pringamoza in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She began a small business selling clothing a year and a half ago and continues to increase her inventory with each loan. CriseL. travels by bus from town to town selling her products to the other small communities in the countryside as many of these rural people do not have the means to travel to town to do their shopping. She has also recently started a little business making and selling breakfast from home in the mornings. She has started these businesses so that she can provide her children with a good education and a comfortable home.

CriseL. is the leader of the 15-person micro-bank group, Gran Esfuerzo. In English, this means `Great Force´. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.

On behalf of CriseL., the Gran Esfuerzo group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, and shoes

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is a very responsible and hard working woman. She is married and has four adorable children. Three years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She rents a sewing workshop which produces clothes she sells in the market. Her kids go to kindergarten and school.

Nazira wishes that her children can continue with their education. That is the reason she needs to continue growing her business. She asks for a loan of 700 USD that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and cover the customers' demands. She commits herself to return back the amount in 12 months. From the money she earns she wants to fix the house and pay for her kids’ education.

Help this family with improving the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Nazira's business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for making school clothes.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 04 hijos, no tiene estudios, sólo asistió al Programa D. Alfabetización. Vive en el Centro Poblado D. Acari, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo – Puno.

Hace 05 años que es socia del Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” del Centro Poblado D. Acari – Yunguyo. Con su primer crédito D. S/.300 Nuevos Soles incrementó su capital para comprar 01 cabeza D. ganado vacuno. DesD. los 18 años D. edad se fue a trabajar a las ciudades D. Tacna e Ilo, a los 22 años tuvo su pareja y desD. entonces se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno D. engorD..

Con este crédito D. S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 03 cuotas, comprará 01 cabeza D. ganado vacuno con S/.1,400 y con S/.100 D. forraje para el ganado.

Su sueño es tener un cobertizo más amplio para el ganado y un almacén para el forraje.
texts.en:
Agustina is 57 years old, is married and is the mother of 4 children. She has no education, only having participated in the Reading Program. She lives in Centro Poblado D. Acari, in the district and province of Yunguyo D Puno.

She has been a member of the community bank Banco Comunal "Fe y Alegria" of Centro Poblado D. Acari D Yunguyo for five years. With her first loan of S/.300 she managed to compliment her capital to purchase a cow. Since she was 18 years of age she has been visiting the towns of Tacna e Ilo to work, and when she was 22 years of age she married. Since then she has been dedicating herself to the buying and selling of cows.

With this loan amounting to S/.1,500, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase a cow (costing S/.1400) and with S/.100 she will purchase feed for the herd.

Her dream is to have a larger cow shed and to have a storage facility for the feed.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará una cabeza de ganado vacuno y forraje

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Mrs. Chab C. is a villager in Svay Village in the Kandal Province. She is ingle and she is a garment worker. Aside from this work, she also owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn for living.

Her farm work is difficult because does not own any animals to plow the rice field. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan so she can hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To hire laborer with two oxen and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Khen Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K. was selected as the village bank president by the 21 members of the group. They live in the Veal Kandal village in Kandal Province, Cambodia.  She has a 1-hectare farm where she cultivates rice to sell. Her field in infertile, and the crops have been badly affected. To resolve this problem, Mrs. Sok K. requests a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the field and make her rice crop more productive. She is a 62-year-old widow with five children; two are employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and the other two children attend the local school.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to increase the productivity of the rice field

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is currently in the business of selling fresh fish and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Mary is 31 years old and is divorced. She has 6 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open a restaurant

loans.name: Rakhman

texts.en: Rakhman A. is a 28-year-old married man who lives with his three children and owns a small farm. He lives and works in the Internally Displaced People Settlement called Bilasuvar. Rakhman has been selling sheep for the last six years. Since sheep-selling is a profitable business, Rakhman has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. His income has been enough to cover family needs, but as his children grow, covering the family's needs has become harder.  So Rakhman is applying for a loan to expand his activities and purchase more sheep.

loans.use: Purchase nine sheep

loans.name: Juana Marina

texts.es:
Marina  es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Marina es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Marina junto a su esposo tienen una ferretería en su casa, actividad que vienen realizando hace 1 año,  y les esta yendo cada vez mejor. Además Marina tiene una tienda de abarrotes y bebidas.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chapas, focos, pinturas.
Los sueños de Marina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una ferretería grande y ser mayorista, tener un hogar unido.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the communal bank "Amor Divino" (Divine Love). Marina is married, is 45 years old and has three kids. Marina and her husband have a small store in their house where they sell hardware supplies. They have been doing this for a year now and the business continues to improve. Marina also has a store where she sells groceries and drinks.

Marina needs a loan of 1,000 Soles which she will invest in the purchase of door knobs, locks, light bulbs and paint. The dreams of Marina are that her children will become professionals, she will have a large hardware store, she will be a wholesaler, and that she will have a loving and close family.

(Translated by Andrea and Tyler of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Purchase of Door Knobs, Locks, Light Bulbs and Paints

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita tries her best to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family.  She has started to operate a village store from which they can earn enough to cover some of their daily needs. She is planning to purchase more products for additional inventory that she can offer in her store.  With this, she would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000.00 as additional capital.  She and her husband are striving hard to provide a better life for their children and hopefully give them a better education.  

Tita Dacayan is married to Carmelito and he is working as a farmer.  They have two children: Christian - 6 years old, an elementary student, and Christine - 3 years old. The family lives peacefully in Caliguian, Burgos Isabela.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. They have 3 children who go to school. Linda is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC, an international development organization, started operations in Southern Sudan in 2007. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (Non Goverment Organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In Sudan the microfinance program, which is targeted to returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to open up a shop

loans.name: Sigifredo

texts.es:
El señor Sigifredo R. ya ha tenido ya un crédito con FVP el cual lo pago puntual mente, lo utilizo para poner las protecciones de su casa. En esté momento está solicitando un préstamo para poder construir la barda la rededor de su vivienda  y así su familia va estar mas segura cuando el no esté en casa. 
En el momento de la visita el domicilio del señor Sigifredo R. no se encontraba en su casa y quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora María Antonio Martínez quien es la persona que aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Señor Sigifredo R. currently has a loan with FVP and he makes his monthly payments on time. He used it to make his home more secure. At this time he is seeking another loan in order to be able to build a wall around his house so that his family can be more secure when he is not at home. When the Fundación staff visited Señor R.' house he was not at home and they were met by his spouse, Señora María Antonio Martínez, who is the person shown in this photo.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Tulkun

texts.ru: Тулкуну 42 года. Он женат и отец 3-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Тулкун занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление весны для Тулкуна – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Тулкун экономит на корме скота. С наступлением осени Тулкун продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Tulkun is 42 years old. He is married and is a father of three children. His wife does not work anywhere. She stays at home and does housework and feeds the cattle. Tulkun raises and sells cattle. With the arrival of spring for Tulkun it's the season of buying cattle because the price is low during this time. It's not expensive to feed the cattle. It eats mountain grass and Tulkun saves on the fodder. With the arrival of autumn Tulkun sells part of the fed cattle, but he does not buy any. He buys fodder for feeding of the remaining cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cultivate taro

loans.name: Buriev

texts.ru: Буриев Ассадило житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 48 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Зарабатывает путем работы на частных стройках. Но работает еще и  частным предпринимателем в сфере сельского хозяйства. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить качественные удобрения и семена для посева. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай , который сможет своевременно реализовать.
texts.en:
A. Buriev lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. He is 48 years old, married and has four children. He makes his living as a builder/contractor and supplements his income by farming. He is hoping to use the loan for purchase of quality fertilizer and seeds for the upcoming planting. This will allow him to collect a quality harvest which will be easier to sell on the market.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
Khanifa I., 27 years old, is the married mother of two children. Her lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an ecologist didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the family, so Khanifa decided to start her own business five years ago selling the fabrics of the national dresses. Little by little she has made her business grow, and by offering her clients the option of paying in installments, her orders are getting bigger. Now her business is running normally but she would like to continue bettering herself and her business so her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fabrics to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Roque Tito

texts.es:
Roque  es socio del Bancomunal Madres del Futuro.
Roque es conviviente tiene  47 años un hijo de tres años, que esta al cuidado de su  esposa.
Roque trabajaba en una empresa textil, se desempeñaba como mecánico textil, lamentablemente su jefe murió y el renuncio;  con la liquidación compro  un puesto y   se puso a vender en  el mercado abarrotes al por mayor y menor.  
Desde que Roque esta en Finca  aprendió administra su negocio, y dar buen uso al crédito.
Roque necesita un préstamo de  2800 soles para la compra de mercadería, sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de aceite, leche.
El sueño de Roque es crecer más hasta llegar a tener una tienda más.
texts.en:
Roque is a member of the communal bank “Madres del Futuro. He lives with his partner, is 47 years old, and has a three year old child that his wife cares for. Roque used to be a mechanic in a textile mill. Unfortunately, his boss died. Roque then left his job and bought a spot in the market to sell groceries with his severance pay. Roque has learned how to manage his business and use his loans wisely since he has been a member of Finca. He needs a loan of 2,800 soles to buy merchandise like: rice, sugar, oil, and milk. Roque would love to grow his business until he has another store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de mercadería, sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de aceite, leche

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is a 66-year-old woman married to Vincento, a laborer, and they have two grown children. She has had her Sari Sari store (general store) for over 12 years and has taken out nine loans, paying each of them back 100% and on time. Each one has helped her just a little bit more with extra capital to rise up from poverty and make a better life for her and her family.

This loan for 28,000 Pesos will be used to purchase goods and groceries for her store, but she is really excited because she plans to buy the cement-making materials to be able to make hallowblocks for beneath her store, which essentially support the framework and make the foundation stronger. 

Her biggest goals are to continue to help her children in any way she can (especially with costs associated with education) and to improve her whole family's way of living.

Written by Sloane Berrent, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: To rebuild her general store and buy items for the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Lucia Teodora

texts.es: La Señora Lucia T. tiene 41 años de edad, es Casada y con oficios  Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 Telares, habita junto  a sus Hijos, ella y sus Hijas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 10 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío I Palemop, de la Aldea V. del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia T. is 41 years old, married and a weaver. "Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres" has a workshop with 3 looms. She lives with her children, she and her daughters are all weavers and they have two employees. They have been making "Cortes" for 10 years at their home located in the village I Palemop of the Aldea V. of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Presently orders from her customers are growing but her economical conditions are not sufficient to increase her capital so therefore she approached "Asociación ASDIR" to request a loan to buy material and thus increase her sales as well as make her family get ahead and provide better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for craft making

loans.name: Akinola

texts.en: Akinola is 38 years old and married with 2 children. He sells cocoa beans. He has been in the business for the past 5 years. He is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more cocoa beans to sell. He say "thank you" to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more cocoa beans to sell

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans sa boutique située dans le quartier de Kagomé à Lomé. Grâce à ce commerce qu’elle a débuté depuis 2006, elle apporte sa part financière dans son foyer ; elle est en effet mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et vend du riz en détail, des savons, des œufs et même de la boisson locale alcoolisée dénommée « sodabi ». Parce qu’elle accueille bien ses clients, sa boutique est très fréquentée presque par tous les gens du quartier. Elle nécessite en ce moment de renouveler son stock qui s’épuise ; c’est pour ce motif qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 40 litres de « sodabi », 01 sac de riz et divers produits comme les tomates en boîtes et d’autres boîtes en conserve. Elle n’a aucune inquiétude pour le remboursement.
texts.en:
Mme. S. sells food in her boutique in the Kagomé neighborhood of Lomé. Thanks to the business, which she launched in 2006, she contributes to the financial support of her household. She is married with 3 children. She purchases her stock at the Grand Marché of Lomé. She sells rice in small quantities, soaps, eggs, and a local alcoholic beverage called “sodabi.” Because she takes good care of her clients, her boutique is popular with almost everyone in the neighborhood. Her inventory is getting low. This is why she has requested a loan from WAGES, to purchase 40 liters of “sodabi,” one bag of rice, and various products such as canned tomatoes and other canned foods. She is quite confident about her ability to repay the loan.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food for resale

loans.name: Olivia Nakintu 's Group

texts.en:
Olivia is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, ages 3 to 15 years old. All of her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she lives with six people. Olivia takes care of family members in addition to her children. The family has access to electricity, but no piped water. 

Olivia works in semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a stall where she sells second-hand clothes. She uses public transportation to travel to and from her shop. Olivia doesn’t pay rent for her stall, but she pays monthly dues and operating license fees. She is challenged by increasing clothing prices and buyers who borrow from her and then default. 

Olivia sells to all kinds of people and receives about 20 customers a day. Olivia works seven days a week. Her monthly expenses include medication and food for her family. She has been in the clothing business for ten years and she has been a member of MCDT for eight years. She is now servicing her sixteenth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more used clothing.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes, such as skirts, shirts, and blouses

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 38 years old, married and has two children. She makes a living selling groceries such as corn flakes, juice and detergent. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket in her home town of Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time, and is applying for this loan to buy more groceries to sell. She extends her thanks to Kiva lenders for all their support.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline R. is a 59 year-old businesswoman who is married and blessed with five children. Her children are adult age already but she still supports some of them. Their family lives in the village of San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela.

Evangeline operates a furniture business together with her husband. It has been their source of income and it helps a lot in providing for their family's needs.

Evangeline dreams of further expanding their business through obtaining more wood in order to produce more furniture and meet the demands of their customers.

She hopes to borrow a loan of 8000 PHP for the improvement of their furniture business. It will also be used to buy other materials needed and for the labor of some carpenters working in their manufacturing business.

loans.use: To improve their furniture business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a rice farmer living in a town in Agusan del Sur. She is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Her oldest is only 13 and is studying. Mercy wants her farm to be productive, so she does her best to keep it in good condition. She also sought financial assistance from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP. With this loan, Mercy will be able to purchase the farm supplies necessary for her farm to be productive.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden H. is currently in the business of selling cooked food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell.  Kiden is 29 years old and is married with a husband who works as a driver. She has 3 children, all of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build another big restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Ilori

texts.en:
Ilori is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Lagos, Nigeria. Ilori is hardworking and believes that women are helpmates to support men in keeping the home.
Ilori is a hairdresser and she also sells jewelry, hair extensions, and other accessories to make an additional profit. With the profit from her business she is able to save a little money and assist her husband in running the home. Ilori hopes to expand her business, and is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more accessories to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and accessories to sell

loans.name: Shalom 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the coordinator of her group called “Shalom” and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor in the eastern lowlands of the Dominican Republic where the economy is centered around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure of wooden walls and a tin roof with her husband and her son.

Josefina is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans without arrears. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and shoes by purchasing blue jeans, blouses and shoes. Her business model is to take orders for clothing and then to go to Santo Domingo and purchase the clothes in the main markets and come back to her community to sell the items at a profit. While 80% of her product is ordered in advance she will sell the rest by walking around the community and searching for clients.

Josefina will use the profits to invest in her home by completing the project her husband has started to replace the wooden walls with cement block. She also intends to continue investing in her family by purchasing medicine, school supplies and clothes for her son. In the long term her goal is to purchase a small plot of land so that she can construct her own home, as her current home is owned by her parents. She also plans to start university classes in business management soon. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more blouses, blue jeans and shoes to sell

loans.name: Rosabella Caracol Group

texts.en:
Rosabella S C. is from the village of Taguima, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Rosabella S is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosabella C. Group.

Rosabella S is married and has 4 school-aged children. Rosabella S owns & operates a business providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. Rosabella S has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosabella S joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosabella S has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed for her business. Rosabella S is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tools and equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosabella S from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Djiguisseme ont en moyenne  34 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Wela, un des villages relevant de la sous-préfecture de Konobougou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente d’articles divers tels les condiments alimentaires, les habillements,  les céréales, la  cola  et  la restauration.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  3 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires, quelques sacs de  céréales (riz, mil, haricot) et des ingrédients pour la restauration. 
Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et  à Konobougou. Elles effectuent leurs ventes, à Wela, au marché de Konobougou ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Djiguisseme" group are on average 34 years old with 2 children and live in traditional extended households in Wela, a significant town in the sub-prefecture of Konobougou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through familial relations, and run businesses buying and selling various items such as food condiments, clothing, cereals, cola, and prepared meals. After having properly repaid their 3 previous loans, the women of the Djiguisseme group are on their fourth solidarity (group) loan, which will be used to buy a large quantity of food condiments, several bags of cereals (rice, millet, beans), and ingredients to prepare meals. They get their supplies in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and in Konobougou. They make their sales in Wela, at the Konobougou city market, and at the neighbouring area market-days, in cash, at retail, and on credit, to a clientele composed of women and men. They plan to realize an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA each, which will be used to pay for expenses related to health, food, and school fees, with the remainder being reinvested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Julia Liliana

texts.es: Julia Lopez es una mujer trabajadora la cual se ha dedicado a la costura y reposteria profesional, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio y lleva 20 años, Doña Juliana es viuda desde hace 15 años y trabaja como comerciante, gracias a la ayuda y apoyo de sus 4 hijos, ella actualmente tiene su propio negocio al cual le ha sado mucho provecho. Doña Julia nos cuenta que ahora su negocio es mas grande, y poco a poco se ha podido ir superando y ha podido alcanzar varias de sus metas, pero en este momento necesita un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio de costura, ya que ella elabora uniformes de varias escuelas aledañas, y asi poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Julia is a hard working woman who has been sewing and tailoring professionally out of her home for 20 years. Juliana has been a widow for 15 years and has her own business, thanks to the help and support of her four children. Her business has helped her very much. She tells us that her business has grown and, little by little, she has been able to get ahead and has been able to reach several of her goals. She needs this loan in order to invest into her business, as she makes uniforms for schools in the surrounding area and she wants to be able to provide better service to her customers and build a better life for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest into her business

loans.name: Saolo

texts.en:
"Saolo V. is 25 and married with 1 child.  She is starting a business venture, selling traditional handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Saolo needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Saolo joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Saolo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Saolo V. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.7 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Magno

texts.es: Magno tiene 45 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rafaela de 45 años y sus 5 hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor vida. La actividad a la que Magno se dedica, es la agricultura, en donde cultiva papa, maíz y arvejas, por lo que todos los días desde muy temprano trabaja en sus chacras y sabe que cuanto mejor sea la calidad de sus productos, mejor será el precio que obtenga de la ventas de éstos, en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde ya cuenta con muchos clientes fijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, ya que así ve la recompensa luego de varios meses de trabajo, es así que lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre corre el peligro de que los químicos afecten su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprarse un auto, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos hasta el mercado con más tranquilidad. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Asimismo en su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, por estar de temporada estos productos, en donde tiene mayor demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Magno, 45, is a loving and responsible father. He lives in his own house with his wife, Rafaela, 45, and their five children, for whom he wants to provide a better life. Magno is a farmer; he grows potatoes, corn and peas. He goes out to work his fields every day very early in the morning. He knows that the better the quality of his products, the higher the sales prices they will command in Tarma’s wholesale market, where he already has many regular customers. What he likes best about his work is harvesting because he sees the result of many months of hard work. He has been in this line of work for 15 years and he considers the most difficult part of the job to be fumigating his fields because he always runs the risk that the chemicals might affect his health. In time, he wants to buy a car so that he can move his products to market more easily. This is his 9th loan with MFP and he states that the loan will be of great use to him. He is a responsible and respectful member of his communal group. He will use the requested 500 new soles to buy potato and pea seed since this is the season for these products when demand for them is highest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato and pea seed.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 28-year-old lady living in Hoima, Uganda. She operates a secretarial shop in the heart of the town. She is married to a civil servant and together they have one child, age 2. She dreams of constructing her own family home. She says renting is very expensive yet uncomfortable. She wants to expand on the business opportunities of her secretarial shop by adding stationery so as to have an all-round station for secretarial services and stationery. 

Sylvia got to know about HOFOKAM through a friend who advised her to inject additional capital into her shop to progress to the next level. She intends to use the loan funds to buy books, pencils, pens, rulers and printing paper among other things to add to her secretarial services shop.

loans.use: To buy books, pencils, pens, rulers and printing paper among other things to add to her secretarial services shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of spices

loans.name: Diodome

texts.en: Diodome D. P. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 40 years old. Diodome is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Diodome operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing taxi services to local community members. Diodome has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Diodome joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diodome is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Diodome from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines.
