It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nargis Bano's Group

texts.en:
Nargis bano has applied for a loan for her husband’s business of selling Pan (betel nuts) & cigarettes. His business is doing well but he needs to buy more brands of cigarettes and betel nuts to increase his sales. 

Nargis bano has five children and all of them study in a local school.  She is hopeful that an increased income will make it possible for her to give her children better education facilities and will help them to complete their education.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes & betel nuts for resale

loans.name: Rodis Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Rodis” group. They are petty-business women in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This will be their first loan from SMT, a Kiva partner in Makeni. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and make better profits.

Isatu M. (who is pictured left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni. The thirty-seven-year-old is married to a teacher and they have two children. One of her children is in primary school and the other is in secondary school.

Isatu has earned fifteen years of experience in selling market-foodstuffs like salt, palm-oil (the country’s most favorite cooking oil), Margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. With a loan of SLL 500,000, she can expand the size and quality of her business by buying more of the above mentioned items wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more market foodstuffs like salt, palm-oil, Margi, etc.

loans.name: Anecita's Group

texts.en:
Anecita P. is from the town of Tungawan Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. She is 33 years old. Anecita is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Anecita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as candies, some food for snacks, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Anecita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Anecita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joana Paula

texts.en:
Joana Paula E. is from the village of Obay, Polanco. She is 25 years old. Joana is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joana is starting a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Joana is just starting this business.

In 2010, Joana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Joana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kuña Rory Cañete Cue Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá Compañía Cañete Cue.
El Comité está integrada por  señoras muy trabajadoras y activas este Comité está en el noveno ciclo dentro del Programa Comité de Mujeres.  
Este grupo es muy unido y trabaja en forma conjunta ellas no presentan inconvenientes con el pago de sus cuotas ni en relacionamiento entre ellas.
Ellas se encuentran muy satisfechas con el programa ya que encuentran apoyo para trabajar, y de esa manera fomentar las  actividades que realizan para ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Feliciana, quien es una mujer muy activa y realiza todo tipo de trabajo con sus compañeras para fortalecer el grupo con sus compañeras.
Ella es ama de casa y tiene un pequeño negocio que atiende en su domicilio.P
Comente que el negocio le ayuda con la alimentación de la familia que es lo más importante, y los ingresos de su parece lo utilizan para otros gastos. 
Desea invertir en su negocio y solicita el préstamo para la compra de fideos, azúcar, aceite, arroz y otros para contar nuevamente con mercaderías suficientes para sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá, Cañete Cue. The committee is composed of hard working, active women. The committee is in its 9th cycle within the Women’s Committee Program. This group is very unified and works together. None of them has any problem neither with repayments of loan installments nor with their relationships among themselves. They are very satisfied with the program because in it they find support to work and ways to encourage the activities they are involved in to help their families. One of the members is Feliciana who is a very active woman and performs all sorts of tasks with her fellow members in order to strengthen the group. She is a housewife and has a small store in her home. She stated that the store helps her provide food for her family, which is the most important thing, and also helps cover other expenses. She wants to invest in her store and needs the loan to buy noodles, sugar, cooking oil, rice and others to once again have sufficient stock for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice, flour, cooking oil, cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj S. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two older children attend university while his younger two children study at a local secondary school.

Purevdorj and his wife have been operating a dairy product retail business in their town at the local market since 2008. His business has grown quickly within this period, and he has increased his working capital. His business earnings have enabled him to purchase land where he is planning on building a house in the future.

Purevdorj is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan in order to purchase and preserve more dairy products during the fall season when prices for such products are cheap and then resell them once prices climb. He will use his loan to purchase more dairy products to sell, build a house and save money for his children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve more dairy products

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es:
Yrene es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector San Isidro Desaguadero del caserío Calazán, una zona rural del distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años  a la venta de pan y leche en una esquina de uno de los barrios ubicados cerca al centro de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella realiza esta actividad diariamente y debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en la zona ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fidelizados. El pan lo adquiere en la zona donde vive y la leche la extrae de una vaca que cría en su casa. Este negocio le sirve para poyar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos familiares.

Yrene desea ampliar su negocio incursionando en la venta de productos derivados de la leche como queso y mantequilla y también en diversos embutidos como jamón y salchicha. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro de su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante alegre y amable. Sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una mujer entregada a su familia y a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar alguna carrera superior.
texts.en:
Yrene is a 38 year old mother who lives with her husband and four children in the San Isidro Desaguadero sector of the village of Calazán, a rural area in the district of Monsefú. This community is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past ten years, Yrene has been selling bread and milk at a street corner in one of the neighborhoods near the central part of the city of Chiclayo. She engages in her business every day and has built up a group of loyal customers throughout the time she has been working. The bread is acquired in the area where she lives and the milk comes from a cow that she raises at home. This business enables her to help her husband, who is a farmer, with the family expenses.

Yrene wants to expand her business by venturing into the sale of other dairy products such as cheese and butter. In addition, she wants to sell different cured meats such as ham and sausage. To accomplish these objectives, she has decided to apply for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Yrene is a cheerful and friendly woman. Her neighbors and customers have great respect for her and consider her to be a woman who is dedicated to her family and her work. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with the opportunity to study for a college degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products & cured meats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and other cocoa bean farming supplies.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has been practicing mixed farming for 10 years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces milk, which he sells to the local market and households. He also earns income from the sale of his horticultural products to the local market. His biggest challenges have been lack of organized markets for their products and the high cost of farm inputs.

He has requested this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from this dairy cow will assist in food sustainability and the education of his children. In five years' time, he would like to venture into brick molding business to supplement his income. 

Moses is 33 years old. He is married and has been blessed with four children who are between the ages of two months and 10 years. Three of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mathew Kibet

texts.en:
Mathew has been rearing and selling sheep and goats in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 32 years old, married to Priscilla Karonei, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He plans to use the cash to buy more sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Mathew hopes to start keeping cows for both meat and milk.

loans.use: To buy more sheep which he will rear and sell later

loans.name: Din

texts.en:
Din O. is 22 years old, and he is a teacher in a public school in Phnom Penh City. He can earn an income of approximately $3 per day by teaching every day. He lives with his old mother who is a local farmer. Din O.’s mother has been planting a variety of crops for ten years, and she usually generates around $3 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. The main income received from his mother's farming business is during the rice harvesting season.

Din O. needs capital for his mother to purchase many sacks of rice to store. He will sell them when the rice commands the highest price, and the rest of the loan will be used to purchase farm supplies to use on the field. Din O. was not available that day, so his mother is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice to store. He will sell them when the rice commands the highest price.

loans.name: Boaventura Chachuai

texts.pt:
Boaventura Chachuai B. nasceu na cidade de Xai-xai, província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique casado pai de 5 filhos de idades entre 02 a 18 anos de idade, os 4 mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez 4ª classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Gaza para a cidade da Maputo com seus pais quando estes foram transferidos pelos serviços. Trabalha como motorista numa empresa e também tem um negocio de venda de frangos ha mais de 18 anos. Conta com ajuda de seus filhos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversas com um amigo que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 24.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade da sua criação. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 15.000.00 e 20.000.00mt aplicados na habitação.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito, para continuar com a criação de mais frangos.
texts.en:
Boaventura Chachuai B. was born in the city of Xai-xai, province of Gaza, in the south of Mozambique.  He is married, the father of five children aged 2 to 18 years, the four eldest of which attend school.  He finished fourth grade but didn't continue due to financial conditions.  He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't have any other dependents.

He left Gaza for the city of Maputo with his parents when they were transferred for work.  He works as a company driver and also has had a business selling chickens for more than 18 years.  He depends on the help of his children, and manages to bring in an income of about 5,000 MT per month, which he puts towards household expenses and still is able to put some aside in his bank account.

He has never had loans with other banks, and got to know about Hluvuku through conversations with a friend who is also a client of this institution.  This is his third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 24,500 MT, with which he plans to purchase chicks, feed, and vitamins to increase the quantity of his livestock.  The previous loans were in the amounts of 15,000 and 20,000 MT, and were invested in his residence.

He is confident that he will repay by the deadline and will ask for another loan in order to continue breeding more chickens.

loans.use: purchase of chicks, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Erduujargal

texts.en:
Erduujargal M. is 36 years old and lives with sister and mother in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home, in a housing district in the city. Her sister, age 10, attends a secondary school. 

Erduujargal operates a clothes selling business in a rented stand at the trade center of her district. She rents her stall at a monthly rental fee of 200,000 MNT. She started his business in 2005 and has since gained much experience as a businesswoman. She sells a variety of clothing items that are imported from China twice a month. After years of successful operation, her monthly business revenue has reached 1,000,000 MNT. She is a very clever and business-minded person. She hopes to continue to grow her business in the future, and plans to buy a car for herself. 

Erduujargal  is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more evening dresses to sell at her stall for the upcoming New Year holiday.

loans.use: To purchase evening dresses to sell for upcoming New Year holiday

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile owns a business that sells food items. She is 53 years old, married and has five children who are between fourteen and thirty years old. She has two children whom she cares for as dependents. All of her children go to school. Her husband is a teacher. Cecile has been selling food items for one and a half years. She will use this loan to buy more rice, sugar, and maize flour. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase the output and growth of the business. She would like to have a car for better transportation for her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Era Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Era, inicia su ciclo 35 con 14 socias, las cuales tiene diversos negocios como es el caso D. Rosa María, que es Presidenta del Banco Comunal, tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. animales menores como: cuyes y gallinas y tambien venD. cereales.

Rosa Maria es natural D. Cayara, sus hijos vinieron a estudiar a Ayacucho, así que cada vez que venia a ver a sus hijos aprovechaba en traer animales menores y venderlos para sustentar algunos gastos en Ayacucho. Le va bien, ahora viaja a la feria D. Cayara, Pampas los viernes y regresa los domingos, venD. sus animales a sus caseras del mercado 12 D. Abril. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. más animales y cereales. 

A Rosa María le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal en Finca por la capacitaciones que recibe, pueD. ahorrar y le dan créditos. El sueño D. Rosa María es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales, poder tener un capital y poder abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Era" ["New Era"] Communal bank is starting its 35th cycle and has 14 members who work in various business.  One member is Rosa María, president of the communal bank, who is 42 years old, married, and has eight children.  She sells young animals like guinea pigs and chickens, and she also sells grains.

Rosa María is a native of Cayara.  Her children came to Ayacucho to study, so each time she has come to see them she has taken advantage of the opportunity to bring young animals with her to sell in Ayacucho in order to cover her expenses. Her business is doing well and now she also travels to the market in Cayara, Pampas on Fridays.  She sells her animals at the 12th of April market and returns on Sundays.  The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more animals and grains.

Rosa María enjoys her communal bank's meetings at Finca because she appreciates the trainings they receive, and also because she is able to save and borrow money.  Rosa María's dream is for her children to become professionals and to have enough capital to open her own business.

loans.use: To buy young animals and grains to sell

loans.name: Dominique Xavier

texts.en:
Dominique Xavier is 28 years old, married and has as yet no children. Dominique Xavier owns a hardware shop, which he has done for eight years. His wife has no specific occupation because she is still a bride. 

Dominique Xavier will use the loan to add more metal items to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Dominique Xavier plans to re-invest in his hardware business. He would like to have a capital of two million in the future for further growth of his business.

loans.use: To buy more metal items to sell

loans.name: Ganchuluun

texts.en:
Ganchuluun is a 45-year-old single mother who lives with her son and mom in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on her brother’s plot of land. Her son Tsogbadrakh is 22 and currently employed at Ochir Aldar LLC as a sales manager. Her mother is retired. 

Ganchuluun has been running a retail clothing business for many years. She rents a stall at Narantuul market, the biggest market in Ulaanbaatar. Ganchuluun buys her products from wholesalers who import them from China. She is a very hardworking and persistent person. 

Ganchuluun is requesting a loan to increase her working capital. In the future, she hopes to improve her family’s living conditions by expanding her business.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Komeza Group

texts.fr:
Nicodeme N. est un commerçant âgé de 29 ans qui habite  la commune urbaine de Cibitoke en Mairie de Bujumbura. Il fait le commerce des articles de boutique  depuis 3 ans. Ila fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau des humanites completes. Il est celibataire. Il   arrive au 3e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant beaucoup  d’articles pour sa boutique et les  revendre a ses clients dans l’espoir de réaliser de grandes épargnes et ainsi accroitre son business. Il espère  arriver au stade d’importer de grandes quantites en provenance des autres pays de la sous-région comme l’Ouganda et ailleurs.

Il est un des membres  du groupe  Communautaire« Komeza».
texts.en:
Nicodeme N. is a 29 year old shopkeeper who lives in the Cibitoke quarter of the Bujumbura municipality. He has been a shopkeeper for three years. He attended school and was fully educated in the Humanities. He is single and this loan will be his third with the Turame microcredit association.

He is seeking a Kiva loan to boost his capital and to purchase a number of items for his shop which he will sell on to his customers. His aim is to put some savings aside and to grow his business. He wishes to reach the stage where he can import goods in large quantities from other countries, such as Uganda and others. 

He is a member of the Komeza community association.

loans.use: boosting his capital by buying a large number of products for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing various goods for door-to-door sales

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem K., 45, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. K. rents her house to workers, earning an income of $3 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $60 US on food and $74 US on other necessary expenses. Kimsan is requesting a loan of $1000 US to build more rooms to rent. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to build more rooms to rent.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: From the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh city, Chan N. has been earning a daily income by selling meatballs at the busy market. On average, she could make around 5 USD in profit from her food sales business. She is 54 and she divorced from her husband years ago. Presently, she lives with her six children; five are single and one is married. She has two employed children who always contribute a part of their incomes toward the family's daily expenses. Chan N. would like to ask for her loan in order to rebuild some parts of her broken house. With this loan, she and her children will be able to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: to rebuild some parts of her broken house.

loans.name: Jorge Ulises

texts.es:
Jorge, nació en Estelí, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado, de oficio comerciante, solo estudio hasta sexto grado de primaria, es jefe de familia, cuida a su mama. Inicio a trabajar a los 13 años de edad como vendedor ambulante en los barrios de Estelí , desde tempranas horas salía a vender , a recorrer las calles buscando el alimento diario para el y su familia sin horario ni salario fijo , el se buscaba como ganar la vida vendiendo productos de uso popular , también vendió en las comarcas aledañas de Estelí , para entonces un pastor de una iglesia evangélica le ayudaba a vender  sus productos de ahí el adquirió la experiencia en ventas , aprendió a negociar precios. Actualmente es dueño de una pulpería la cual estableció con las ganancias que obtuvo de su trabajo anterior y préstamo que el ha hecho, lleva tres años y medio con su pulpería.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la pulpería, para comprar productos alimenticios como azúcar, arroz, aceite, caramelos  y también hacer recargas de minutos a celulares. Esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar su inventario, hacer nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ganancias. 
Tiene como meta poner una distribuidora de alimentos en el centro de la ciudad de Estelí y comprar su casa para darle un techo digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge was born in Estelí.  He is 42 years old, married, and works as a salesman.  He only studied up to the sixth grade of elementary school.

Jorge is the head of his household and cares for his mom.  He started working as an itinerant street vendor in the neighborhoods of Estelí at the age of 13.  He used to go out to sell his products from early in the morning.  He would walk through the streets looking to make enough money to feed himself and his family.  He didn't work regular hours or receive a fixed salary.  He looked for ways to earn a living selling basic household products.  He also sold his products in regions neighboring Estelí.  Back then, a minister from an evangelical church helped him to sell his products and that is where he gained his sales experience.  He learned how to negotiate prices.

Jorge is currently the owner of a grocery store which he set up with the profits that he made from his previous work and a loan that he took out.  He has been running his grocery store for three and a half years.  Jorge is requesting this loan to invest in his grocery store, so that he can buy food products such as sugar, rice, oil and candies.  He will also buy cell phone minutes.

This investment will help Jorge to increase his stock, gain new customers and improve his profits.  His goal is to set up a food distributors in Estelí city center and to buy his house so that he can provide his family with a decent home.

loans.use: to invest in his grocery store, buying food products such as sugar, rice, oil and candies, and also cell phone minutes

loans.name: Loren Tania

texts.es:
Tania es una madre soltera de 36 años de edad, ella vive con su madre e hijo en el distrito de Olmos – Lambayeque.  Olmos es una comunidad agricultura y ganadera que en los últimos años se ha ido desarrollando  debido a un proyecto hidro-energético que se desempeña en la zona. Esto ha traído consigo el aumento de pobladores en la zona.

Tania  se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y como una ganancia adicional a la venta de alimentos (galletas, papitas, chocolates) y bebidas (gaseosas, agua). Debido al proyecto de la zona, Tania cuenta con una ardua afluencia de personas en sus dos negocios.

Tania solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de ropa, para comercializarla  y en la compra de alimentos y bebidas, para tener mayor variedad en su bodega. Tania desea tener mayores ingresos para ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Tania is a 36 year-old single mother.  She lives with her mother and her son in Olmos district - Lambayeque.  Olmos is an area where people farm and raise livestock.  In recent years it has been developing owing to a hydropower project which is being implemented in the area.  This has brought with it an increase in the number of people living in the area.

Tania's business is selling clothes and, as an additional income-generating activity, she also sells food (cookies, chips and chocolate) and drinks (soda and water).  Owing to the project in her area, Tania has a good flow of customers to her two businesses.

Tania is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy clothes to sell and also to buy food and drinks so that she can offer a better variety in her store.  Tania would like to make more income to help her mother with their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothes and groceries for her store

loans.name: Sop Sa Jëker Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sa Jëker fait partie du Banc villageois de Artillerie 2; il est composé de 16 femmes qui sont parentes et amies qui habitent le même quartier. Il est créé depuis le 28 mars 2008.L'activité principale que mènent les femmes est le petit commerce de divers produits.



Aminata est la responsable de groupe, elle est âgée de 37 ans,mariée et a cinq enfants en charge dont un neveu. Elle mène une activité de vente de bouillie à domicile et a une expérience de plus de dix ans dans ce domaine.Sur la photo elle debout est à l'extrême droite habillée en tenue wax sombre.


Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité de commerce pour réaliser beaucoup de revenus.


Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices construire une maison pour ses enfants. Les charges familiales sont au compte de son mari.
texts.en:
Solidarity group Sop Sa Jëker belongs to the Artillerie 2 Banc villageois. The group is made up of 16 women who are either related or are friends, and who live in the same neighborhood. The group was set up on March 28, 2008.

The women's main activity is small-scale retail in various products. Aminata is the leader, she is 37 years old, married and responsible for five children, one of whom is a nephew. She has been selling "bouillie" (a type of gruel) from her home and has more than ten years' experience. In the photo, she standing at the far right dressed in a dark wax-cloth dress. The loan will allow her to increase her business in order to make a lot of income. With her profit, she hopes to build a house for her children. Her husband is responsible for the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy millet to make "bouillie" (a type of gruel) to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: L. señora Mercedes con 54 años D. edad, juntamente con su pareja (conyugue) se dedican a L. venta D. abarrotes , donD. lleva más D. 14 años en este negocio gracias a sus  esfuerzo pudo educar a sus 3 hijos, también  nos cuenta que empezó vendiendo jugos en L. puerta D. su casa y que por motivos D. salud no pudo seguir en ese negocio, pero con L. ayuda  D. su esposo y D. sus 3 hijos pudo hacer su pequeña bodega, L. cual lleva el nombre D. su nieto “Jesusito” , gracias a los ingresos que obtuvo D. su negocio y ayuda D. su familia Mercedes compró una combi, actualmente elL.   cubre con los gastos D. su nieto apoyándolo en su educación. Con el crédito solicitado elL. piensa surtir su bodega comprando  arroz, azúcar, leche, gaseosas, cervezas, etc.  y utilizarlo para el mantenimiento D. L. combi.
texts.en: Mercedes, 54, together with her spouse runs a grocery store.  She’s been in business for over 14 years.  Thanks to her effort she’s been able to educate her three children.  She also tells us that she started out selling juices at her front door but because of health reasons wasn’t able to continue with this activity.  However, with help from her husband and her three children she was able to set up her small store, which is named after her grandson “Jesusito.”  Thanks to income from her business and help from her family Mercedes bought a minivan.  She helps cover her grandson’s expenses paying for his education.  She plans to use the requested loan to stock her store buying rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, beer, etc. and to service the minivan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and lives with eight family members. Four of his family members work.

In 2007, Haydar opened a cafeteria. He gained his experience from his father. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan to make an advertising light box and to buy a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make an advertising light box and buy a generator.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 35-year-old, married woman with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Grace has been raising pigs for 4 years, and she also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business. Grace is seeking to borrow 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She explains that she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Salha

texts.en:
Salha, 43, is a single woman who has been working in women's beauty for 10 years and is still working hard to achieve the best in this field. She insisted to make her own business in 2004 and she's doing her best to improve it to fit all customers needs. Salha also sells accessories in addition to beauty supplies.

To increase her stock of accessories, Salha requested a loan from Al Majmoua and hopes it will be effective like the previous three loans she paid back, with a good standing history.

She is willing to expand her business more but she believes that she has to plan in a very cautious way to not do something she might regret.

loans.use: to increase her stock of accessories.

loans.name: Candida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cándida, se dedica a la venta de lácteos y tortillas, vive con una hija de 18 años de edad; Ella elabora el queso en su vivienda donde alquila, lleva 10 años de estar en el negocio, lo vende en la zona, porque sale a ofrecerlo o sino los clientes llevan hasta donde ella, a parte de los quesos también vende tortillas por los mediodías.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra le leche para la elaboración de quesos, también maíz y leña para las tortillas, con estos materiales podrá continuar en su negocio y proveer siempre ganancias para su hogar.
El sueño de Cándida es algún día comprarse su propia casa, ya que alquilan con su hija y pues espera dentro de algún tiempo tener la posibilidad de obtenerla.
texts.en:
Candida has a business selling dairy products and tortillas.  She lives with her 18 year-old daughter.  She makes cheese in her rented home.  She has had this business for 10 years.  She sells in her neighborhood.  She goes out to sell the cheese, or her customers come to her, and in addition to the cheese, she also sells tortillas at lunchtime.

She is requesting a loan to buy milk to make her cheese, and also corn and firewood for the tortillas.  With these supplies she will be able to continue with her business and will be able to provide continuous earnings for her household.

Candida's dream is to someday buy her own house, since she is renting with her daughter.  She hopes that in the not too distant future she will be able to do this.

loans.use: to buy milk to make cheese, and corn and firewood to make tortillas

loans.name: Kushinga Group

texts.en:
Esnut, a 50-year-old married mother of four, lives in Gweru, where she also cares for two dependents. For the past five years Esnut has been operating a manufacturing business producing candles. She says the main challenge faced is high competition from well-established manufacturers.

Esnut has requested a loan of $400 to purchase wax, dye and string. The extra income arising from this loan will allow her to finish building her rural home and feed her family an improved diet. In the future, Esnut plans to open a small manufacturing company.

loans.use: to buy wax for candle making.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
From Kompong Speu Province, Mr. Sum is 48 years old and married. He has four single children. Three of his children are working in a garment factory as sewing workers. They regularly get a formal salary from their occupations of around $80 USD per month.      

Mr. Sum has been working in the farming business since 1979. He and his wife assist each other in the crop-planting business. They normally earn a revenue of $1.66 USD per day.  Mr. Sum will use a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to buy cows to help him in the farm field as his cows are getting old now. 

In the future, Mr. Sum wishes to build a new house that is bigger than his current house. Mr. Sum is in the photo with his wife under their house.

loans.use: to buy cows to support him on the farm

loans.name: Luis Elías

texts.es: Luis Elías de treinta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañera de vida. El posee un negocio donde vende artículos varios como carteras, gorras, billeteras entre otros; últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela ya que Luis siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan, el tener productos variados le da muchos beneficios, además son productos de muy buena calidad que vende a precios muy accesibles y el servicio que presta es grato al visitante del negocio; Luis Elías es un hombre trabajador él piensa que el camino de la vida no es tan difícil si se trabaja con esfuerzo y dedicación  es por eso que decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar carteras, billetera, gorras, calculadoras,  relojes etc. Luis Elías tiene confianza que su duro trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, espera poder contar con el apoyo de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Luis Elías is 35, and lives with his life companion. He has a business selling various articles, such as purses, caps, wallets and other things. 

Lately he has been getting a lot of customers, as Luis always has what people need. Having a variety of products is very beneficial to the business, and besides, he sells good quality products at very reasonable prices. Visitors to the business are pleased with the service he provides. 

Luis Elías is a hard-working man, and believes that the road of life isn't so hard if you work with effort and determination. That's way he decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy purses, wallets, caps, calculators, watches etc. 

Luis Elías is confident that his hard work will allow him to give his family a better quality of life.  He hopes to have the support of this loan.

loans.use: To buy purses, wallets, caps, and calculators.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine sells different kinds of products in her mini store or general store to earn a living. She is married with four children. Josephine is 54 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She has unluckily encountered problems because of the crisis. But, in spite of that, she is a determined person. She believes that nothing is impossible. She is striving hard to cope with things. 

Josephine is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos to purchase more goods to sell and to be more progressive. She plans to build a new house. 

======================================

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in her general store (sari-sari store)

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 4 años Luis se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su  seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio sea más grande y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Luis es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles todo lo mejor a los suyos.
texts.en:
Luis is 39 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own home which does not receive basic services.  His home is located in Paijan district, in La Libertad department.  This area is noted for its farming and livestock raising.

For four years, Luis has sold basic household products (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc.) and drinks.  His business is set up in his home for his own security.  He uses the profits that he makes from selling his products to try and cover all his expenses and improve his family's quality of life.

In order to expand his business, Luis has requested a loan for 2,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise.  His sole aim is to enlarge his business and have more products in stock to offer his customers.  Luis is a responsible, committed and hard-working person who tries to provide his family with the best.

loans.use: to buy more food products with which to stock his store

loans.name: Jose Dagoberto

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la colonia Vista Hermosa y se dedica a la venta de repuestos y accesorios para vehiculos como ser parabrisas, parlantes, gatas, tapasoles, alfombras, radios entre otros, cuenta con varios años de tener su negocio, sus ventas las realiza de Lunes a sábado en una calle muy transitada de la ciudad, la mayoría de sus clientes son los motoristas y dueños de taxis, todas las mañanas junto con su hermano exponen sus productos en el vehículo para que todas las personas que transitan por el lugar puedan observar la variedad de accesorios y repuestos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de accesorios y repuestos para diferentes marcas de carros.
gracias a las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio puede cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Vista Hermosa. He works selling car parts and accessories such as windshields, speakers, jacks, sun shades, mats, radios, and more. He has had his business for several years. He sells his merchandise from Monday to Saturday on a very busy street in the city. The majority of his customers are taxi drivers. Every morning, he and his brother display their wares in a vehicle so that everyone who travels by can see the variety of accessories and car parts.

He will use the loan to buy car parts and accessories for different makes of cars. Thanks to the income from his business, he can provide for his family's expenses.

loans.use: buy car parts and accessories

loans.name: Najmeh

texts.en:
Najmeh is 40 years old.  She is a mother of eight sons and daughters. One of her children is married.

She has been working as a hair stylist for the last 18 years in her own beauty salon. Her salon started small and through the years, she was able to add more seats and new sections to the salon.

Now Najmeh has applied for this loan in order to buy more beauty products such as make-up to use in the salon and to sell. She also wants to buy more equipment that is needed in the salon, like hair dryers and other items.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and equipment for her salon including hair dryers and makeup

loans.name: Martha Maritza

texts.es:
Martha tiene 53 años de edad y  vive su familia en una comunidad del distrito de Hatillo, que es urbano y residencial, sin embargo es objeto de una creciente actividad comercial, concentrada principalmente en los centros comerciales. Se ha ubicado gran cantidad de mueblerías, tortillerías, panaderías, librerías, talleres mecánicos y automotrices, gasolineras, dentisterías, farmacias, consultorios médicos, bares, restaurantes, tiendas e imprentas.

Martha dio inicio a este negocio hace unos meses, para ayudarse con los gastos de su hogar. Ha visto la buena disposición y resultados que ha tenido en su comunidad, ya que los vecinos expresan que están satisfechos con los productos brindados.

Es por eso que Martha está solicitando un crédito de 500,000.00 (quinientos mil colones), para vender mercadería a sus amistades; asi como zapatos y ropa, para asi hacerse de mas clientela y tener mayores oportunidades de obtener ingresos para sacar a delante a su familia. 

Martha es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Hatillo, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de EDESA en Costa Rica. Es su segundo préstamo con la Empresa y da muchas gracias por toda ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Martha, age 53, lives with her family in an urban, residential community in the Hatillo district. However, there is increasing business activity concentrated primarily in commercial centers. Here there are located a number of furniture stores, tortilla makers, bakeries, book stores, mechanics’ and automotive shops, gas stations, dental clinics, pharmacies, medical offices, bars, restaurants, shops, and printers.

Martha began her business a few months ago in order to help with household expenses. She has had a good start and has seen good results in her community, and her neighbors have said that they are pleased with the products she offers.

This is why Martha is applying for a loan of 500,000 colones to purchase merchandise that her customers will like, such as shoes and clothing. This will allow her to have more customers and have greater opportunities to earn income so that her family can get ahead.

Martha is a member of the Hatillo communal bank. This is one of EDESA’s 150 communal banks in Costa Rica. This is her second loan through her communal bank, and she is thankful for all the help that has been offered to her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Fevie

texts.en: Fevie is 23 years old and married with two children. She is from Pan-taon, Ozamis City. Fevie has been raising pigs for sale for three years, and she earns 5000 PHP a month. In 2011, Fevie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fevie is requesting loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed for the pigs. This will be the first loan taken out by Fevie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pig feed.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar la puerta de la entrada a su casa, ya que actualmente la que tiene esta en muy malas condicione, no hay seguridad y le preocupa sus hijos.
Doña Silvia se dedica al cuidado de niños que son de su misma comunidad y su esposo es empleado de una fábrica, son los ingresos que tiene para su familia y pagar la educación de sus tres hijos que estudian en la primaria.
Colocando la puerta tendrá la tranquilidad de salir a diversos lugares ya que su casa estará más segura y podrá ir por sus hijos a la escuela mas tranquila y realizar sus actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia is requesting a loan to buy a front door for her home, since the one that she currently has is in very bad shape. Her home is not secure and she is worried about her children.
Silvia takes care of children from her community, and her husband is employed in a factory. From this they make an income for their family and are able to pay for the education of their three children, who are in elementary school.
After installing the new door, she will have the peace of mind to be able to go out knowing that her home is secure. She will be able to take her children to school without worrying, and do her job.

loans.use: to buy and install a front door for her house.

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Olga es socia del banco comunal Rosa Rojas, vive en la ciudad de Paute lugar que tiene un clima cálido, lugar propicio para el cultivo de las más hermosas flores y de una gran variedad de frutas, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y muy carismáticas, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Olga tiene 36 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 14, 10, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos siguientes hijos estudian en la escuela. Su esposo labora como operador de maquinarias pesada, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Olga se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 3 años y vende su mercadería solo días de ferias, en su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Rosa Rojas communal bank. She lives in the city of Paute, which has a hot climate and is a propitious place for the cultivation of the most beautiful flowers and a wide variety of fruit. Its people practice farming and raise animals. They are kind and very charismatic people, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

Olga is 36 years old. She is married, and this union has produced 4 children, who are 2, 4, 10, and 14 years old. Her oldest son is in secondary school and her next two children are in primary school. Her husband works as a heavy machinery operator. They own the house in which they live.

Olga sells all kinds of clothing. She has been doing this work for 3 years. She sells her merchandise only on market days. In her home, she raises guinea pigs and chickens.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years, and she will use her new loan to purchase clothing to supply her inventory.

Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Jean Nepomuscene

texts.en:
Nepomuscene is 28 years old and is married. He takes care of two dependents. Nepomuscene sells local drinks. This is his second year in this business. He works from 6am until 5pm every day and currently employs one person to help him. 

Nepomuscene has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 36 years old and married with three children who are currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her sari-sari store.

Annabelle has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, eggs, oil, spices, bread, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne is a female Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to expand the business. Her business goal is to establish her own wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have frequent cashflow and a good lifestyle.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Kanyampara Thuyimanaye Group

texts.en:
Chrispo, a 49-year-old man and married with ten children, is a member of the Kanyampara Thuyimanaye Group. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Chrispo is a butcher, and he also does farming and sells coffee flour as additional sources of income. He has been in this business since 2000. He dreams of educating his children and expanding his business. He is a hardworking person even though he is faced with the challenge of bad debtors.

He needs the loan to buy cows and goats for slaughtering.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats for slaughtering

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: ANA ISABEL: Es una joven de 27 años de edad emprendedora, casada. Su esposo trabaja como docente. Desde hace 2 años estableció una pequeña tienda de ropa nueva, en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y genera sus propios ingresos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Managua blusas, faldas, ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños, entre otros productos, para venderlos a precios accesibles a su clientela de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.

loans.use: para comprar en Managua blusas, faldas, ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños, entre otros productos

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: Miss. Isoken O.’s interest for beauty, motivated her to venture into hair beauty business. She had three (3) years hair dressing training in a reputable Beauty Saloon institute in Nigeria. She is eager to expand her business. As a result she need the sum of $400.

loans.use: To buy more hair driers

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Lomé, Mrs. Ayaba T. is married to a teacher and is a mother of a child. The income of her husband, a substitute teacher, is too low to provide for the needs of the household; therefore, she started selling cloths in the Hédzranawoé market.

Today, in spite of her hard work, due to her limited means, her business has not taken off. In order to increase her buying capacity in department stores and contribute to her household needs with an increased profit, she is asking for a credit of $800 which will be used as capital for the purchase and sale of the fabrics. Thus her family will have a better standard of living.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1970 à Lomé, Madame T. Ayaba est mariée à un enseignant et est mère d’un enfant. Le revenu du mari, un enseignant vacataire, étant trop bas, pour suppléer le dans les besoins du ménage, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes au marché de Hédzranawoé. Aujourd’hui, malgré son dévouement et avec le peu de moyen dont elle dispose, son commerce n’arrive pas à décoller. En vue d’augmenter sa capacité d’achat dans les grands magasins et réaliser un profit maximal pour contribuer aux charges du ménage, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l'achat et la vente des tissus pagnes. Ainsi sa famille connaîtra un niveau de vie meilleur.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of textiles

loans.name: Shamis Allah

texts.en: Shamis A. is 20 years old. He lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan with members of his family. He is a shopkeeper. He has a retail shop in a good area of Kabul. He is a part-time student. He wants to take an individual loan to buy more items like Cokes, bags of chocolate, and sweets. He is young but he wants to expand his business and be a good business dealer in the future.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs Mom T. is 47 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She is a farmer and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. They earn 4 dollars a day. 
Mrs Mom T. would like to purchase a tractor to expand their farm and make more profit.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Chnathou

texts.en:
Mrs. D. Chanthou is married in 2004 with 1 son. She just started her business of weaving scarf by using semi-automatic machine at home in early this year. So far she learned and worked for the neighbor in weaving scarf. She currently owns one machine and now she purchases two more semi-automatic machines to expand her business in scarf production. One machine will be setting up for her husband, who is currently assisting her sometimes. Another one she will hire her neighbor to weave. 

She is asking a loan from MAXIMA for the first time with the amount of $800. She will use this part of loan to purchase 2 semi-automatic machines and cotton fabric to expand her scarf production.

loans.use: Purchasing two more scarf semi-automatic machine and cotton fabric.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Mrs. Bernardita O. is 48 years old and married with three children. All her children are fully-grown and have jobs. The two younger children and their own children live with Bernardita. Seeing her grandchildren growing up brings her a great deal of happiness.

Bernardita, or Sra. Berna, as her friends and clients know her, has owned a small grocery store for the past 18 years. She has established a regular client base and also receives good business from the School of Mother Theresa of Calcutta that is located across the street from her store. She has worked since she was a child, primarily as a maid. When she was able to, she saved and used her earnings to pay for cooking and baking classes. Later she formed a partnership with the father of her children and rented a small dwelling where they began making clothes. After a few years the two of them divorced, and Bernardita began a new phase of her life.

She and a good friend opened a small restaurant serving typical foods in the city of Loma Pyta. With a great deal of hard work she obtained a small piece of land and began the construction of her own house. Within two years of starting construction, she was able to open her grocery and eatery in her house. This house is the source of her success. Her three children always came first for her and she priorotised giving them their education as well as creating a home filled with love.

Bernardita has asked for a loan to buy merchandise for her store such as drinks of all kinds, chicken, beef, flour and oil.

loans.use: To buy  the following merchandise for her store: drinks of all kinds, chicken, beef, flour and oil.

loans.name: Eng Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. R. Eng Heang married in 2001 and has two daughters. She is currently in the business of weaving silk. She learned to weave silk from her aunt in 2000 and started her silk production in the same year. She trained her husband, Mr. Muth Socheat, to weave in 2002. Both of them are currently weaving silk at home. Moreover, Mr. Socheat is also growing rice and raising animals.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of US$500. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on their looms.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms

loans.name: Lotolagi

texts.en:
Lotolagi M. is a fifty-three-year-old lady from the village of Manunu. She is running a Pop Corn Business and she is also running a big plantation which covers almost four acres of their land. She grows taro and bananas only and she works from Monday to Friday. She only goes to the market three days of the week and she manages to bring in about US$120 a day so about US$ 400 a week.

Lotolagi is very active and she is working hard to make sure that her children will have a good education and a better future life than she has had. She is planning on spending this loan improving her business, and she is hoping to spend her next loan on improving her house.

loans.use: buy chemicals, an axe, knives, and a wheelbarrow for her plantation

loans.name: Arinti

texts.en: Arinti, 58, is the mother of 1 son. Together with her husband, H. H., she runs a food stall in front of their house. From that business they can earn as much as $9 a day. Now she is asking for a loan of $100 to expand the business so she will be able to provide tuition for their children. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of their little food stall

loans.name: Din

texts.en: Mrs. Din S., 28, works as a housewife: she stays at home cooking food and looking after the children for her entire family. To supplement the household income her husband works as a taxi driver in Phnom Penh, typically earning about $10 a day. To have additional income, he decided to get a loan from Kiva to open another small business for his wife. The loan will be used to purchase a large amount of bananas in his village to resell to the market for profit.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of bananas to resell to the market for profit

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis O. is a married mother of four children in Offinsu, Ghana. For the past two years, she has earned a living by selling groceries and charcoal. She uses the profits from her store on her children's school fees.

Mavis has applied for a loan of $625 U.S. dollars to purchase more rice and sugar. She also hopes to buy a refrigerator so she will be able to sell frozen foods. Mavis member of the group called “Yonko Do” (translation: oneness), which ensures that members re-pay their part of the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer, rice, and sugar for a small store

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Eight years ago, Jorge (32) got married to Nilda Pena. The couple has two sons; the oldest one is eight years old, and the youngest is 4.

Luque is famous for its artisans who make beautiful jewelry. There is a street in the center of the city full of jewelry stores. A typical Paraguayan jewelry is called “filigrana” and is made in Luque.

Jorge used to work in a supermarket selling meat, and in his free time he used to help his uncle designing and making jewelry. Fourteen years ago, he decided to open a jewelry workshop where he employed four poor people from his neighborhood. He sells his products to different jewelry stores. Jorge’s main goal is to open his own jewelry store.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of silver and gold for the production of jewelry.

loans.use: Purchase of silver and gold.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. is a multi-businesswoman. She is a farmer growing food for both home consumption and for sale; and this time around, she has a lot of ginger for sale. She has three fresian cows at home for milk, for which she has a ready market. She also has had a fishing business for 18 years with three boats. She employs six men whose payments are agreed upon depending on their catch measured in kilos everyday.

She became a widow with 10 kids after her husband died of “AIDS." She is her family's sole source of support. She is really a strong woman. Her businesses are profitable but they can not give her the required money for fees, hence the need for a loan.

loans.use: She needs a loan to help pay school fees as her business makes the repayments.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita is a courageous woman. She’s been doing arduous work in the fields for several years. This has allowed her to support her household and her children who are now good men and thankful to their mother. Juanita continues working for the good of her children and herself. In order to continue to cultivate beans and potatoes, that are the principle products of her imperious labor, she needs to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides. Support Juanita so she can continue working the land.

Translated by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Juanita es una mujer valiente, ella lleva varios años de trabajo arduo en el campo. Esto le ha servido para ser el sostén de su hogar y de sus hijos que ahora son hombres de bien y agradecidos con su madre. Juanita continúa trabajando por el bienestar de sus hijos y por ella misma. Para continuar con el cultivo de habas y papa, que son los principales productos de su imperiosa labor, necesita comprar abono, semilla e insecticidas. Apoya a Juanita a seguir labrando la tierra.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy S. sells bananas and plantains. She is married, but her husband's income as a carpenter is not sufficient for Mercy and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en:
Modupe A. lives in Ojodu, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 42-years-old and is married with three children. Modupe sells food staples; yams, rice, garri and plantain. She has been in this business since 1996.

Modupe is requesting the loan to buy more food staples for resale. She expresses her gratitude to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more food staples for resale

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
Doña Crescencia tiene 47 años de edad, estudió tercero de primaria, es casada y madre de 04 hijos. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” del Centro Poblado de Acari – Yunguyo. En un inicio obtuvo un crédito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, con el que aumentó su capital para comprar 01 cabeza de ganado vacuno. Se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno desde que convive con su esposo.  

Con el préstamo de S/.3,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 vacunos a S/.1,500 cada uno, comprará en la feria de Acora y venderá en la feria de Yunguyo.

Su visión es apoyar a sus hijos en sus negocios, los cuales se dedican a la venta de ají, compra y venta de ganado vacuno, ya que no pudo apoyarlos en su educación para que sean profesionales, pero sí terminaron la secundaria. También piensa comprar un camión para el negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Crescencia L. is 47 years of age, studied up to the third grade in elementary school, is married and has 4 children. She lives in Centro Poblado de Acari, in the district and province of Yunguyo.

She is one of the founding members of the “Fe y Alegría" (Faith and Happiness) microfinance institute in Centro Poblado de Acari Ð Yunguyo. In the beginning, she obtained a loan of 300 PEN, with which she increased her capital in order to purchase 1 head of bovine cattle. She has been buying and selling bovine cattle for a living ever since she started living with her husband.

With this loan of 3,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 3 monthly installments, she will purchase 2 cows at 1,500.00 PEN each at the Acora market, and then sell them in the Yunguyo market.

Her vision is to support her children in their businesses selling chili peppers and buying and selling bovine cattle, since she was unable to help them get an education and become professionals. They were, however, able to finish high school. She also plans to purchase a truck for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cows

loans.name: Florence Nawire’S Group

texts.en:
Florence is a leader of a 5-member loan group.  

She is a 30-year-old married woman with 4 children between 2 and 12 years of age. Three of her children go to school. Florence takes care of two additional family members. She rents a two-room house where she is staying with seven people. They don’t have electricity or piped water at home 

The family gets two meals a day; they occasionally take tea. She lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Florence uses public transport to get to and from shopping.

Florence brew a local beer in Kasubi, one of the city suburbs. She buys raw materials, like maize flour and millet, from Owino market in Kampala. She sells to all categories of people, both wholesale and retail. Florence receives 15-20 customers a day, depending on the weather. When it rains, few customers come in for a drink. 

Florence has been with MCDT for four years, is is now requesting her 12th loan. She wants to use this loan to boost her business and to open another branch taproom in Nakulabye.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Sakhiba

texts.en: Sakhiba (her husband is seen her because she was not available to be photographed) was born in 1981 and lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. Her husband makes a living repairing cars. He has been in this business for three years and is applying with his wife for a $1,200 loan to buy parts and equipment he needs to improve his small company.

loans.use: to buy parts and equipment for a car-repair business

loans.name: God Is With Us Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of Abdul K., Ramatu K., Fatmata K., Isatu K., Kadiatu K., Marie S. and Fatmata T.. They call their group "God Is With Us". They have received several loans through SMT. They have re-paid previous loans successfully. Their previous loan was for Le 1,000,000 each. That loan helped them a lot. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan, thus able to solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a new loan for Le 1,200,000 each to add to their businesses.

Abdul (front right) is the leader of this group. Abdul was born in Roketeh, six miles from the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. He is thirty-five years of age, married with two children – one is in nursery school and the other is only an infant. Abdul also cares for two of his deceased elder brother’s children who are attending school. Abdul’s wife is a businesswoman. Abdul sells ready-to-wear clothes.

With this loan of Le 1,200,000, Abdul will buy about forty pairs of jeans and four dozen shirts. He travels to neighboring Guinea to buy the clothes, paying a round/trip fare of Le 60,000. In Guinea, a pair of trousers costs Le 25,000.  He sells each pair in Sierra Leone for Le 30,000.  

The only challenge Abdul is facing is that of bad debts. Sometimes relatives will borrow money from him and will never pay back. Apart from this, business is going fine and he enjoys doing it. Outside of his business, Abdul would like to do great things for himself. He would like to buy a plot of land for his family and eventually build a house.

loans.use: buying more jeans and shirts to sell in his store

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Dương Thị Đào năm nay  48 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1993. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ nguồn thu nhập của gia đình chị Đào chủ yếy dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt, sau khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để  đầu tư  kinh doanh, buôn bán. Hiện tại gia đình chị có một cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh rau, và các loại thực phẩm khô. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay (4.000.000đ/ tháng). Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của các con đã đi làm nên kinh tế đang ngày càng ổn định hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Duong Thi D. is 48 years old. She has been a member of TYM Fund since 1993. Before joining the fund, her family's main income comes from farming and raising livestock. After joining the fund, she has borrowed funds to invest in a small business selling vegetables and dried food. This main source of income brings her 4,000,000 VND per month. With extra financial help from her working children, her family's income is very stable. She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es socio del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
 Wilfredo es soltero, tiene 40 años y vive con sus padres, Wilfredo es docente de educación secundaria, vende material pedagógico, libros que ofrece a sus colegas, sus ventas son al crédito. 
Wilfredo necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de laminas, programas y libros.
Los sueños de Wilfredo son tener una librería y culminar sus estudios de maestría.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is partner of the Communal Bank called "Amor Divino" Wilfredo is single, he is 40 years old and lives with his parents, Wilfredo is a teacher of secondary education, he sells pedagogic material, books that he offers to his colleagues. His sales are on credit. Wilfredo needs a loan of 1500 soles ($475) money that will be invested to buy paper, software and books. Wilfredo's dream is to have a bookstore and to finish his Master's Degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paper, software and books.

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Nao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people who live in Preak Svay village in Kandal province form the village bank loan.

The members selected M.. Chantha N. as the village bank president.  She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. She is 47 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in different careers while the remaining three attend the local school.

Her husband, Mr. O., is a construction worker and he also conducts a Tuk Tuk taxi business. Although they T. to work hard, they still cannot provide better conditions for their family. They also live uncomfortably because they have an old lavatory which needs to be fixed. M.. Chantha N. is asking for a loan to fix her lavatory to make her family members more healthy.

loans.use: To fix her lavatory to make her family members more healthy.

loans.name: Waridi Group

texts.en:
Zaina M., age 59, is married with two children ages 29 and 25.  She has two grandsons.  Zaina sells clothes from door to door and also supplies small hotels.  She started her businesses in 1997 and works daily from 9am until 5pm.  Zaina is able to earn a monthly profit of around $167. 

Zaina will share this loan with her group, Waridi which totals 20 members.  Members of the group hold each other accountable for repaying their loans.  In the picture, Zaina is second from left, front row.

This will be Zaina’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase capital, built three frames for renting and bought 50kg of baking flour.  Zaina has repaid the loans successfully.  She now hopes for another loan to increase capital by buying baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: Increase capital and buy bakiing flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Dolores es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Dolores se dedica a la venta de flores sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Dolores necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de flores variados.
Dolores sueña con comprar un terreno y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the Banco Comunal Azucenas. Dolores is married, 42 years old, and has two children. She sells flowers with the help of her children by walking around the Abastos market in the city of Ayacucho. Dolores needs a loan for 3,000 soles so that she can purchase a variety of flowers. She dreams of purchasing land and giving her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of flowers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: opening up a workshop and purchasing necessary tools for it

loans.name: Las Colorinas Group

texts.es: El Baco Comunal " Las Colorinas" esta conformado por un grupo D. socias que cuenta con experiencia D. trabajo en grupos solidarios ya que cumplieron con responsabilidad y puntualidad con sus anteriores financiamientos. el grupo se encuentra dirigido por la señora Susana y conformado por 13 miembros en su mayoría mujeres dedicados a actividades comerciales como la venta D. relojes, abarrotes, material escolar, ropa, lácteos y alguno D. los varones al transporte público D. pasajeros. Dentro del rubro comercial existe gran demanda y oferta D. productos por lo que los socios deben esforzarse el doble para poder llevar el pan D. cada día a sus hogares, es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento ya que coadyuvara al crecimiento D. sus pequeños negocios para que estos con mayor mercadería y con herramientas en buen estado generaran mayor ingreso pudiendo así brindar una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias. El grupo esta conformado D. manera sólida puesto que ya cuenta con la suficiente experiencia en grupos solidarios y con la capacidad para el buen manejo D. los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The "Las Colorinas" communal bank is make up of a group of members who have experience with support groups and have been responsible and punctual in complying with their previous loans. The group is managed by Susana and maD. up of 13 members, most of them women, who work in different commercial activities such as the sale of watches, groceries, school supplies, clothing, dairy products and some of the men work in passenger transportation. Within the marketplace there is a stiff competition and the members have to work doubly hard to earn money for their households. For this reason they need financing to help their small businesses grow, so that with more merchandise and with good working tools they can generate greater income and proviD. a better standard of living for their families. The group is solid and has enough experience in support groups to manage the loans they receive.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda T. is 38 years old and lives in Balasdio. She has one child who is not yet old enough to attend school. To earn income, Luzminda runs a general store, selling a variety of food products to the local community. She started the business almost 20 years ago and earns about 10,000 pesos per month. Presently, Luzminda needs a loan of 20,000 pesos to be able to purchase of a new freezer.
