MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy prepared chocolate and sweet rolls for her business.

loans.name: Diris Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Diris tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la residencial Panchita y se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, ropa interior y ropa para dama. sus ventas son de lunes a sábado, sus clientes son sus vecinos y personas que trabajan en diferentes empresas privadas, sus ventas son al credito.
Diris desea tener un negocio grande y surtido en el futuro, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos de uso personal, detro de poco comienza la epoca de navidad y desea estar preparada con una variedad de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Diris is 35 years old and lives in Panchita neighborhood.  Her business is selling personal care products, underwear and women's clothing.  She makes her sales from Monday to Saturday.  Her customers are her neighbors and people who work in different private companies.  She makes her sales on credit.

Diris would like to have a large, well-stocked business in the future.  She will use her loan to buy personal care products.  The Christmas season will begin soon and she would like to be prepared, with a range of products to offer her customers.  She needs the profits to cover her household expenses and to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, deodorants, shampoo, hair conditioner, underwear and blouses

loans.name: Arafati

texts.en:
Arafati is 35 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school.  Arafati has been working hard to manage his bakery, which makes bread, doughnuts and cakes. 

To help expand his business, Arafati has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more wheat for breadmaking, and will help Arafati to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Arafati hopes that in the future he will be able to set up another bakery. 

Arafati is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Arafati who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more wheat for breadmaking,

loans.name: Oscar Leonel

texts.es:
el sr. Oscar Leonel tiene 34 años de edad, esta casado y es padre de 1 hijo, su actividad principal es la caficultura, tiene 6 años de experiencia. el lugar en donde el vive es apto para este tipo de actividad, gracias a su negocio a logrado salir adelante con su familia. 
Oscar utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel solar, en su comunidad no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y piensa que contando con un panel solar su hijo va a tener más posibilidades de salir adelante en el ámbito estudiantil, aprovechar mas tiempo de la noche para estudiar.
tambien desea tener entretenimiento por medio de television.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar Leonel is 34 years old, married and the father of one son. His principle work is coffee growing in which he has had 6 years of experience. The place he lives is suitable for this type of cultivation and thanks to his business he has succeeded in getting ahead with his family.

Oscar will use the loan to buy solar panels for his home. In his neighborhood they do not have electricity and he believes that owning solar panels will provide his son more possibilities to succeed as a student, since he will be able to spend more time studying at night. Oscar would also like to have television as a form of entertainment.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: 5.5.39 Điện Biên Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lan has a retail business selling rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to resell.

Lan is 49 years old, and she is married with two children. Lan is the group leader of the 39 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of five members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for five years. The main harship that Lan faces is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 52 years old and married with seven children. She is from Gango, Ozamis City. Merly has been in her current business for three years, and she earns 5000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly is requesting loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Merly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Edelmira

texts.es: La señora Maria Edelmira a sus 48 años de edad es madre cabeza de familia y tiene un hijo, se dedica desde su propia casa a la confección de ropa para proveedores de otras empresas. La señora Maria Edelmira solo cuenta con dos maquinas para realizar su oficio, las cuales le permiten generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. La señora Maria Edelmira necesita comprar una maquina fileteadota industrial que le permita realizar otros procesos en sus prendas, de esta manera, los ingresos podrán ser mayores y así brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. El sueño de la señora Maria Edelmira es tener conformado su taller con un mayor numero de maquinas que le permita elaborar prendas terminadas y generar empleo directo a varios familiares y vecinos.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Edelmira at her 48 years of age is the head of family with one child. She devotes herself to making clothes out of her own home for providers at other businesses. Ms. Maria Edelmira has only two machines with which to do her work, which allow her to generate the income that supports her household. Ms. Maria Edelmira needs to purchase an industrial serger which will allow her to carry out additional processes on her clothing items. In this way her income may increase and thus she will be able to offer her son a better quality of life. 

Ms. Maria Edelmira's dream is to have her workshop outfitted with a large number of machines that allow her to produce finished articles of clothing and generate employment directly for various family members and neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial serger.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Korn is 32 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She works as a cleaner at Panhasastra University, which is located in Phnom Penh city.  Her husband is also a staff member at Panhasastra University.  Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Korn is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work.  In the future, she would like to improve her house and support her children until they earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita, 32, is married with two children and lives in Silanga, Tangub City, Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years and each month she earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.

In 2009, Angelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Angelita wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba pero vive en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de colchones. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo tela, hilos, esponja y otras cosas más. 

Se encuentra contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Francisca is 30 years old. She is married, and she has three children from that marriage. She was born in the city of Quillabamba, but she lives in the charming city of Cusco. Her main economic activity is making mattresses. She has worked in this business for several years, and it's going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

At this time, she needs a loan to buy raw materials like, for example, fabric, thread, and foam, among other things.

She is happy about the loan and she is committed to making her payments punctually. She is thankful for the help provided.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like, for example, fabric, thread, and foam, among others.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la  même maison. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sabine (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 25 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Sabine  est mariée a un peintre du nom de Mathieu. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sabine vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Sabine vend des fourniture de couture à son domicile depuis dix huit ans. De façon secondaire à son activité, Sabine vend également du charbon de bois. Sabine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Sabine ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHUGNON sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des fournitures de couture et du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
This is Amelia, a resident of Binondo, Manila, Philippines. Married to Rodolfo, she has three children. Her children are in college, high school and elementary school, respectively. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income to meet her family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Amelia buys different kinds of fruits like oranges, apples, grapes and ponkas. Filipinos love to eat these kind of imported fruits, aside from their local fruits, for their yummy nutritional value. These fruits are also very much welcome as gifts from friends and relatives, especially on special occasions. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more boxes of fruits. This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business. 

Amelia hopes to be able to grow her business and give her family a better life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for imported fruits like grapes, apples, and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jackline is 48 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 6 and 26 years.They all go to school. She sells used clothes and she has been selling clothes for the past 15 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes such as shirts and women's clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build her house. In the future she aims to earn at least 600,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Abihanganye Group

texts.en: Gloriose is a group leader; aged 47 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 15 and 27 years. The group is called ABIHANGANYE means “Patience People” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She sells food stuffs and has been doing in a business for 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava and bananas for sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and bananas for sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Mrs. Patricia O. is 40 years old, married with four (4) children. An industrious woman who uses every available opportunity to enhance her business. She is need of $500 for her business.

loans.use: To buy beverages for sale

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Born on 31 December 1975 in Sokodé, Mrs. Yvette S. is married and has one (01) child. She is a jewel merchant and owner of a telephone booth, and her husband is a part-time professor.

In order to increase her income and financial benefits to better help her unemployed husband in meeting the needs of the family, she would like to buy a photocopier which she will install in her telephone booth, which is close to a school.

Thus, she is asking for a loan of $900. She is a woman with lots of experience in this field and can easily make her business more profitable for the benefit of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 31 décembre 1975 à Sokodé, Madame S. Yvette est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Commerçante de bijoux et propriétaire d’une cabine téléphonique, son mari est professeur vacataire.

En vue d’accroître ses revenus et ses bénéfices commerciaux pour mieux aider son mari sans emploi dans les besoins de la famille, elle désire acheter une photocopieuse qu’elle installera dans sa cabine téléphonique qui est proche d’une école.

Aussi sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $900. C’est une femme qui a beaucoup d’expérience dans le domaine et peut facilement rentabiliser son activité pour le meilleur de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his Mobile Shop Business

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.en: Aripova Shafoat is mother of 5 children. She is a good businesswoman. Her business is trade of household goods. She engaged in trade for over 10 years. During this time she got enough experience in trade. Today she has many constant clients and she knew their style. She always tries to attract them with the variety of her goods. Most of her clients are housewives. Shafoat easily helps them to find goods, in which they need. All her clients are very satisfied of her service. In nearest future she wants to increase her working capital and collect money for her son’s wedding.

loans.use: Business developing

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Sra. Nelida B., 31 years old, is married with 5 children living in Mariano Roque Alonso, Paraguay, near the capital city of Asunción. All of her children are currently in primary school.

Nelida owns a small grocery that she runs with her partner. They have had their grocery for the past 8 years. In that time they have established a regular clientele and the store is growing.

Nelida and her family are living together in a community created and donated for persons of limited resources so that they may obtain their own house. Since the beginning of this project, until the building was complete, Nelida was able to care for her family and begin her grocery store with her own money. During this time, her partner was employed by a private security company. The money he saved while working at this job also went toward opening and running the store. He now works in the store with Nelida and ensures its continued growth.

Nelida wishes to expand her business by also including a section of party supplies and notions. Many of her clients have already requested such items and she is confident in the continued demand for these products.

The credit Nelida is now soliciting will go toward buying stock for her grocery, including: sugar, yerba mate (tea), pasta, breads, drinks, meat and clothing items.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, yerba mate (tea), pasta, breads, drinks, meat and clothing items.

loans.name: Madex

texts.en: Ayola Madex is 33 years old, married and has 2 children.  She comes from Afromedia, a semi-urban area in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells drinks, bread and eggs. She requests a loan to buy a refrigerator and 10 crates of eggs.

loans.use: To buy more eggs and a refrigerator

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam!  This is 44 year-old Subira K..  She is single with four children aged 7,15,19, and 20.  In 2006, Subira established a pharmacy business and now requires a loan of $425 in order to purchase additional stock.  She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Upper Kawuga A(2061) C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Madina M.. She is currently in the business of running a bridal shop. She is requesting a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to purchase more bridal garments and accessories. Madina is 40 years old and a single mother of 8 children. Her children range in age from 8 to 20. They all go to school. Each week, Madina makes approximately UGX 35,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

Madina is joined in her small group by Justine S., Jennifer N., Monica S., and Bridget Z.. Justine S. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to increase her stock. Jennifer Nakaferoa is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her business. Monica S. is currently in the poultry business. She is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to purchase more poultry feed. Bridget Z. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to purchase more furniture.

loans.use: To expand the businesses

loans.name: Hout

texts.en: Mrs. Hout S., 42, is a rice vendor, who makes on average about $4 a day of income. Her husband Mr. Saom Sophea, 47, is a police officer, whose salary is $60 a month. To push the rice selling now they are requesting a loan to purchase more rice to sell. They do hope that the increase of rice selling would produce more profits. Moreover, some part of the loan they will spend on house construction.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel has been a member of the Communal Bank “Despertar” for 2 years. She became a member at the invitation of a friend, and during this time has learned to be punctual, supportive, and help herself and other members.

Marivel is married, is 23 years old, and has a 1 year old daughter. Marivel and her husband sell clothing in the 12 of April Market. Marivel says that they both have worked selling clothing and with the first loan from the Communal Bank she bought a dozen shirts, and this is how they grew their business little by little. Today they have 2 stands and sell clothing for children and men. Marivel anticipates also selling women’s clothing.

Marivel needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy pants, jackets, and women’s and men’s shirts.

Marivel dreams of building a big house and renting, having a store, finishing her studies in accounting and provide a good education for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Marivel es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar hace 2 años, llegó a su Banco Comunal por invitación de una amiga, en este tiempo aprendió a ser puntual, solidaria y a ayudarse entre socias.

Marivel es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hija de 1 año, Marivel junto a su esposo venden ropa en el mercado 12 de abril. Marivel cuenta que ambos trabajaban como vendedores en tiendas de ropa y con el primer préstamo que obtuvo del Banco Comunal compró una docena de polos, fue así que poco a poco fueron creciendo. Actualmente tienen 2 puestos y venden ropa para niños y caballeros, Marivel tiene proyectado vender ropa de mujeres.

Marivel necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, casacas, polos para damas y polos para caballeros.

Los sueños de Marivel son construir una casa grande y alquilar, tener una galería, culminar sus estudios de contabilidad y brindar una buena educación a su hija.

loans.use: needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy pants, jackets, and women’s and men’s shirts

loans.name: Sandra Yessenia

texts.es:
Sandra is 42 year old woman who works as a caretaker in the Rents Administration Building in Juigalpa. She begins work at 6:00 AM and finished as 3:00 PM. In order to earn additional wages, she spends her remaining hours selling clothing in a store owned by her brother.

Sandra is a humble woman. She is down to earth and loved by all of her friends. She is requesting this loan in order to build a room for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La sra Sandra de 42 años trabaja como conserje en la Administracion de Rentas de Juigalpa inicia sus labores a las 6 de la mañana finnalizando a las 3 de la tarde , el resto del tiempo lo utiliza para vender ropa de un negocio de su hermana obteniendo extra de ingreso para poder hacerle frente a la dificil situacion, es una persona humilde , sencilla y muy querida por sus compañeros , solicita el credito para comprar materiales para construir un cuarto para su hija

loans.use: Construct a separate room for her daughter.

loans.name: Noel Alfredo

texts.es:
Noel is requesting a loan to invest in a home-improvement project (construction of a room). For the past 19 years, he has worked as a secondary school teacher at the Rubén Darío Institute.

He is a hard-working man, honest and responsible, who has demonstrated his love of teaching for many years, in spite of the low salary. He does not have any children, but Noel cares for two nephews who are living with him this year while they study, because in the region where they live there is no secondary school.

His dream is to study a master´s degree and to have a more comfortable home and work stability so that he can help out his family, who have limited economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Don Noel está solicitando refinanciamiento de su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construccón de una habitación), trabaja como docente de educación secundaria del Instituto Rubén Darío, desde hace 19 años.

Es un hombre trabajador, honesto y responsable que ha demostrado durante muchos años amor por la docencia a pesar que el salario es poco, no tiene hijos, pero Don Noel cuida a dos sobrinos que este año estan viviendo en su casa, ellos se encentran estudiando ya que en la comarca que ellos viven no hay secundaria.

Su sueño es estudiar una maestria, tener una vivienda con mas condiciones y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos,.

loans.use: Build a room onto his home.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita sells perfumes and cosmetics in all markets south of La Paz. She has a system that allows her to give credit to her customers and make charges daily and/or weekly. She is married and has a son who attends school.

The family lives in the area Irpavi II of La Paz. However, they have no home, so Margaret is forced to be the caretaker of the land they occupy in exchange for not paying rent.

This is her fifth credit with Impro and her third with Kiva. The client has a maximum score on compliance with a payment plan. The credit will be used to purchase goods in larger quantities (perfume, cosmetics, etc.) that may reduce her costs, increase her income, and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita vende perfumes y cosméticos en todos los mercados de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz. Dispone de un sistema que le permite otorgar crédito a sus clientes y poder hacer cobros diarios y/o semanales. Ella esta casada y tiene un hijo que asiste al colegio.

La familia vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, no obstante no cuentan con domicilio propio, por lo que Margarita se ve forzada a ser cuidadora del terreno que ocupa a cambio de no pagar alquileres.

Este es quinto crédito en Impro y el tercero en Kiva. La clienta tiene una puntuación máxima en cuanto a cumplimiento de plan de pagos. El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería en mayor cantidad (perfumes, cosméticos, etc), así podrá reducir sus costos, aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: For working capital to purchase perfume and cosmetics

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old single man who lives in Saida, in the south of Lebanon. Mohamad is a hardworking and very ambitious person who wants to improve his own social status. He works in many different businesses: he owns a restaurant, he does telephone exchange, and he deals in trading cars.

Mohamad already borrowed twice from Al Majmoua and repaid each loan on time. The first loan was dedicated to the maintenance of his restaurant and the second loan to purchase a new refrigerator. Mohamad now needs a loan for $1200 to decorate his restaurant.

loans.use: To decorate his restaurant

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther T. is a 46 year old mother of two children who are schooling. She is very hard working and resourceful for her family. She trades in charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Esther obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Sunyani, where she lives and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of charcoal to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to pay her children's educational fees. She belongs to the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Esther would like to buy a bulk supply of charcoal.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Blanca, es propietaria de una despensa ella está casada y tiene 4 hijos, su despensa esta muy bién surtida y lo tiene en su mismo domicilio en la ciudad de Caacupé compañia Cabañas.

Comenta la señora que con los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo surtir de gran cantidad de productos de rotación rápida, como ser azúcar, yerba, carne vacuna, pollo, aceite, fideo, arroz entre otros productos de consumo diario, ésto genero más atracción a los clientes potenciales por lo bién surtido que esta su negocio.

Su objetivo a corto plazo y pensando en las festividades del 8 de Diciembre es la incorporar ventas de helados y comidas rápidas, ya que en años anteriores ya experimento con estos productos y le fue muy bién, entre las comidas a ofertar son hamburguesas, empanadas, pollo, milanesas, etc
texts.en:
Blanca is the owner of a small grocery store. She is married and has 4 children. Her grocery store is very well stocked and she runs it right out of her own home, located in the city of Caacupe Compania Cabanas.

The loans that were provided to her by Fundacion Paraguaya were used to restock her shelves with a great many products that are of high demand, such as: sugar, herbs, beef, chicken, cooking oil, pastas, and rice and other products that are of daily use. More attention was generated in her potential clientele because she offered so much selection in her business.

Her short term goal is to include the sales of prepared foods and icecreams to her business to take advantage of the holiday season. Years ago she had experimented with these products and it was very successful. The foods that she prepared were hamburgers, pastries, chicken, meat patties etc../p>

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as sugar, herbs, milk, cookies, drinks of all kinds etc..

loans.name: Kokadiè (La Sinsinrité). Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe kokadiè est un regroupement de six femmes du   quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso.  Elles ont une moyenne d’âge 49 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 8 enfants.
Les membres mènent différentes activités (la vente d’habits de chaussures et de parures.) et sont des clientes de longue date de Soro Yiriwaso et cela depuis 6 ans.
Le prêt actuel de 100.000 FCFA par membre sera utilisé pour constituer des stocks importants d’habits et des parures pour les fêtes de Tabaski et de fin d’année.
Les achats se font à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes du marché principal et les ventes au marché de Koutiala à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes.
Elles espèrent sur un bénéfice de 80 000 CFA. de bénéfice. En dehors du remboursement des prêts elles utiliseront une partie de leur revenu pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Kokadiè is a group of six women of the Hamdallaye district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region). They average 49 years of age, are married, and are mothers of at least eight children. The members do different work (selling clothing, shoes, and finery) have been long-time clients of Soro Yirowaso for six years.

The current loan of 100,000 francs CFA for each member will be used to build up a sizable inventory of clothing and jewelry and other finery for the holiday of Tabaski and for year-end holidays. The purchases are made in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers of the main marketplace. Sales are made at the Koutiala marketplace to customers composed essentially of women.

They are hoping for a profit of 80,000 francs CFA. Besides paying back the loans, they will use a portion of their income to address typical family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and finery

loans.name: Sath

texts.en: Mr. Sath T. is a villager in Preak Thom village in Kandal Province. He makes Khmer noodle. He is a 60 year old widow and the father of five children. Two of his children help in his business, another is a motorbike driver, and the other two are attending the local school. Even though they have different businesses, they do not have much money to fix the house. Thus, Mr. Sath T. decided to ask for a loan to repair his house so that his family members will live in better conditions.

loans.use: To repair his house so that his family members live in better conditions.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. is 58 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. By means of her business, Ama has paid the fees for one of her children to finish senior high school and the others are now working. She sells used clothing. Used clothing is purchased by most Ghanaians due to its affordability and quality.

Ama wants to use this loan to buy more bales of used clothing to expand her stock. She hopes to increase her savings to finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Revelation Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. She does not sell on group meeting days, and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Tý  45 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia dình chị là từ chăn nuôi, buôn bán thực phẩm và lương làm thợ xây của chồng với tổng thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới chị Tý mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm một số mặt hàng thực phẩm phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con địa phương
texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị Tý is 45 years old, a TYM fund member since 2003. Currently her family income of 3.000.000 VND a month comes from raising livestock, food sales and her husband's salary as a construction worker. For this loan cycle, she is requesting 10.000.000 VND to buy food products to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products for sale

loans.name: Edwins

texts.es:
El señor Edwins B. actualmente vive en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino donde se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos de uso domésticos y electrónicos como lo son controles de televisores, antenas y otros artefactos.

Es importante destacar que el señor B. vende ambulantemente todos los días por las calles de Ciudad Sandino y por medio de esta actividad lleva el sustento a su casa de habitación beneficiando a su pequeño hijo. Con el crédito que solicita a Ceprodel se beneficia grandemente porque logra salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de financiamiento.
texts.en:
Edwins B. currently lives in the municipality of Sandino where he is dedicated to his business selling products of cosmetic use and electornics, such as televisions, antennas and other accessories.

It is important to emphasize that B. sells door to door every day on the streets of Sandino, and through his business he provides sustenance for the home, for the benefit of their baby boy. The loan he is requesting from Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) will be of great benefit to him because he can see success in his business that requires such significant financing.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married to Gerardo, a tricycle (local 3-wheeled vehicle) driver. They have two lovely daughters: Mary Ann, 11 years old and Marielle, 8 years old; both are in elementary school. The family lives in Nuesa Roxas, Isabela. They own a passenger tricycle, which Gerardo is using to earn an income.

To help her husband support the family, Marilyn started a village store business which serves as their source of added income wherein she earns a gross income of PHP 700 a day that they utilize as rolling store capital and for their basic needs at home. She wants to further develop her enterprise, thus, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 that will assist her for the progress of her store. She will then purchase basic commodities that she can offer to her customers.

Marilyn is determined to sacrifice everything for her family and to send her children to school because she wants them to finish their studies and have a better life. She says these things will be possible if you always put God in everything you do.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
Ilhomjon demands a lot of himself in his work, having been a farmer since childhood. Today, as a head of household, he works tirelessly to generate stable income. He works caring for his animals, getting up very early to gather grasses so he can keep his livestock well-fed. He sells both the milk they produce, as well as the hay that he cultivates on his land. He is seeking this current loan for the purchase of one additional cow to expand his business. Please help support Ilhomjon’s efforts so he can continue to improve his family's standard of living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a cow in order to expand the business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Married with a child, Theresa T. is a 22-year-old trader. She lives and does business at Eguase which is a suburb of Moore in the central region of Ghana. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty, and because of this, she is very serious about her business. She trades in cereals like maize. She started this business three years ago. She has a strong customer base who she supplies with foodstuffs. She takes delivery from the farmers at Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and this has enabled her to cut out the middleman and increase her profits. Through this Theresa has been very resourceful to her family. Out of the maize she also prepares fante kenkey and sells it by the roadside. Fante kenkey is prepared from milled grains taken with fish and any gravy or soup. It is enjoyed by many Ghanaians. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize to serve her customers throughout the season. It is her desire to go back to the classroom soon. Theresa belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize.

loans.name: Essolisam

texts.fr: Mme D. Essolisam est née en 1980 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de famille, elle vend devant un établissement scolaire des articles scolaires. Afin de pérenniser son activité, elle sollicite un financement pour faire des stocks d’articles scolaires et ouvrir une boutique. Avec les revenus, elle pourra subvenir au maintien et à l’entretien de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Essolisam D. was born in 1980 in Tsévié. Married and the mother of a family, she sells school supplies in front of a school. In order to make her business viable for a long time, she is requesting a loan to stock up on school supplies and open a shop. With the income, she will be able to help support her family and assure their well-being.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying school supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: El Sr.G. cuenta con un centro de molinos operando bajo el nombre de MOLINO  "MONTE CRISTO" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, el es casado y padre de 3 hijos, todos dependen de el,  todos ellos estudian en la secundaria y primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad.  El Sr.EUSEBIO tiene mucha experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocio ya que son 17 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su preferible clientela estan muy satisfechos con su esmerada y fina atencion brindadas por su persona y su esposa ya que juntos atienden este negocio, el cual les genera recursos finanacieros para suplir los gastos dentro del hogar y el mantenimiento de su negocio, pero como casi siempre es necesario buscar apoyo financiero esta solicitando un credito para poder arreglar unos de los motores que tiene en mal estado.
texts.en:
Mr. G. has a center for mills named Molino Monte Cristo. His business is located in his house. He is married and has three dependent children. The children all attend the city’s public schools in elementary and high school. Eusebio has a lot of experience managing this type of business. He has worked in this area for seventeen years. His better customers are very satisfied with his attention to detail and the polite attention he and his wife offer. Eusebio and his wife tend the business together. This generates enough income to cover the household expenses and run the business. However, he almost always needs to look for financial support. He is asking for a loan to be able to repair some of the motors he has that are in bad shape.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for the mill

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.ru: Абдуламитов Бахтиёр- мужчина 43 лет. Женат отец 6-х детей. Бахтиёр занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Он   кредит в первый раз получает. У него пока малое количество скота. Бахтиёр надеется увеличить количество мелко рогатого скота с помощью кредита. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Бахтиёр планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашей организации в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Bahtier A. is 43 years old, married and a father of six children. Bahtier raises and sells cattle while his wife sells the milk at the market and makes cheese and yogurt from it. This is his first time taking out a loan. Bahtier currently has only a few animals and would like to use the loan to expand his herd. His wife has only one milk cow and Bahtier would like to purchase another milk cow with calf for his wife. He is very grateful to this organization for making his plans possible.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Хайитбаев  Абдукарим  -  мужчина  1964  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет  4-х   детей.  Он  занимается  откормом  и  куплей-продажей  крупнорогатого  скота.  Абдукарим  покупает  молодых  бычков  на  скотных  рынках  района  и  откормив  их  в  течении  3-4  недель,  затем  продаёт  их.  Кроме  того  он  работает  в  дехканском  хозяйстве,  где  имеет  земельный  участок.  Там  он  выращивает  овощи  для  продажи  на  рынке,  а  также  корм  для  скота.  С  целью  расширения  своего  бизнеса  он  обратился  в  нашу  организацию.
texts.en:
Born in 1964, Abdukarim H. is married and has 4 children. He is involved in feeding and sales of cattle. Abdukarim buys young bulls at livestock markets of the district and, having fed them for 3-4 weeks, resells them. Besides the business, he works at a dekhan farm, where he has a plot of land. He grows vegetables for sale at the market and also grows feed for the livestock. Abdukarim reached out to our organization in order to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 3 sont toutes des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Massoukou  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités  agricoles. Elles font exclusivement la culture d’arachide qui reste la principale culture de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 10 hectares.
La production sera vendue au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes, au comptant surtout  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 3 ambitionnent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are all married women who average 34 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Massoukou, one of the villages of the rural city of Tingolé, subprefecture of Fana, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to realize their farming activities. They exclusively grow peanuts, which is still the main crop in the area. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold for cash at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 45) per campaign. The women of the Benkadi 3 group ambition to obtain loans corresponding to the desired amount.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Mrs. Chariya Chheang Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en: This loan will benefit 14 people who live in Boeng Krum Leu village in Kandal province. They will use the loan in different ways. Mrs. Chariya C. makes a living breeding pigs. She does not have a place to house her animals, and has applied for this loan to build one. Her husband, Mr. Leom Sarioeurn, is a policeman who makes a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Chariya C. is 42 years old, and she and her husband have four children, all of whom attend the local school.

loans.use: To build a place to house her farm animals.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Haydee es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Haydee viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende ropa usada, producto que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, además Haydee junto a su esposo tienen 1 carro con el cual realiza taxi en la ciudad.
Haydee necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa usada.
Los sueños de Haydee son construir su casa y tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the Arco Iris Community Bank. Haydee is 35, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Haydee travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she sells used clothes. She gets her products in the city of Lima. Also, Haydee and her husband have a car, which is used as a taxi in the city. Haydee needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy used clothes. Haydee’s dreams are to build her house and to have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothes

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She sells electronics. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Faidha

texts.en: Faidha K. is a married woman in Tanzania who started a business as an entrepreneur. She raises poultry at Yombo Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. She keeps both broilers and layers in her poultry cages. For the layers, it takes almost five months to get the first lay out, but broilers can be sold after only three months. Income derived from selling broilers is used to buy layers, feed, and to pay medical expenses. Faidha collects six trays of eggs daily from her poultry cages and sells to both retail and wholesale customers. She plans to expand her business by constructing more poultry cages and increasing the number of layers. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To construct poultry cages and buy more layers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen sells medicines and cosmetics to earn a living to meet the needs of her family. She is 51 years old and married with three children. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria.

Helen is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more cosmetics and medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more medicines and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Tonny's Group

texts.en:
O. Tonny is the leader of his lending group in Mukono.

Tonny is a 38-year-old man, determined and hard working, with a business of selling shoes from Nakawa central market. He has had the business for two years now and he is grateful that at least he is able to make 80,000/= as profits a week. He sells mostly men’s shoes and his business challenge is the high tax and the rent for his business.

At the moment, Tonny sells in small quantities but he would like to increase his stock by buying in bulk. He also wants to build his own house and stop renting for comfort and increased savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Posing with a great smile together with her products is Mrs. Lina T., 52 years of age, married and a resident of Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is blessed with five children and most of them are presently working abroad. Only one is still living with her.

As an optimistic and motivated micro-entrepreneur, Lina operates in different types of business like direct-selling, production, and even in networking activity. With her husband’s support, she has now been engaged in Glutathione soap production for a year already. This time she is earning an average net income of not less than P10,000 a month from her beauty soap production.

Now Lina is planning to deal in a new product from Wellness and Fitness Corporation with its coffee as the star product.

As a member of Paglaum MPC for one year, she is now enjoying our products and services, especially our loan. She is applying for P20,000 as her new loan amount to add to her revolving capital for her new line of business dealing in Wellness and Fitness coffee. She is hoping that someday she will become a stockist of these food supplement products.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her coffee business

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en: Jelly, 34, is a farmer who owns a rice field in Surallah, South Cotabato. She is married to Arsenio and has a 9-year-old child. The income from her farm helps a lot in sustaining their every day living. She wants to improve her farming so she can have a bigger harvest in the future. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizers and farm supplies. This loan will help provide additional capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is thirty six years old and married with two children. All her children are still in grade school. She loves fashion very much and as a result, trades in jewels like ear rings, necklaces and other fashionable accessories including beads. The women in her community adorn themselves with the beads. She has been selling jewels for the last six years. She sells her goods house-to-house and also treks to nearby markets. Mary wants to use the loan to buy jewels in bulk so she can trek to other markets. It is her hope to make enough income to support her kids in school.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Mrs. Shova T., a 35-year-old lady, lives in Bhaishepati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single-family home with four members: herself, her husband, a daughter and a son. Her husband, Mr. Shiva T., works in a private office. Both her son and daughter are studying in grade 10.

Mrs. T. started selling cows’ milk a year ago. She already owns one cow and now she is requesting loan of Rs10,000 to buy another young cow to sell its milk in the local area. She lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. In Nepal people love to drink cows’ milk so demand for milk is increasing constantly.

loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D. est une veuve de 72 ans et a 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois de puis 7 ans et demi. Son activité est la vente de savon et balais traditionnels et de jus de citron. Son objectif est de participer aux différentes dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Awa D. is a 72-year old widow who supports four children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for seven and a half years. Her business is selling soap and traditional brooms as well as lemon juice. Her aim is to contribute to the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Latifath

texts.fr: O. Latifath est née en 1986 à Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN. Latifath vit environs depuis 7ans à Avotrou, un quartier de Cotonou. Mariée à AFFOTON Foard, Latifath est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous deux scolarisés. Latifath vit avec son mari et leurs 2 enfants. Le couple se partage ensemble les charges familiales. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Latifath exerce d’une part comme activité principale la vente de divers produits vivriers (riz, boissons en plastique et en cannette, lait, conserve, huile, jus de fruits etc.) ; d’autre part Latifath vend également de l’alcool médical à 90°. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN, et au NIGERIA, pays voisin du BENIN, que Latifath s’approvisionne. Latifath effectue la vente de ses produits dans les environs de son domicile et à Dantokpa. Latifath n’a jamais fréquenté mais fait du commerce depuis 8 ans. Latifath est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de 4 prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Compte tenue de la restriction de ses revenues, Latifath désire obtenir un cinquième crédit dans le but de renforcer son capital et d’étendre ses activités.
texts.en:
Latifath O. was born in 1986 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living for about seven years in Avotrou, a neighbourhood in Cotonou. Married to Foard AFFOTON, Latifath is mother of two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children, and they share household expenses. To assist her husband, Latifath’s main activity is to sell food products (rice, bottled or canned soft drinks, milk, oil, fruit juice, etc.). She also retails medicinal alcohol (90°). Latifath gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and from a neighbouring country, Nigeria. She sells her products in the vicinity of her home and in Dantokpa. She has never attended school but has been active in retail for eight years. Latifath is an active member of ALIDé, and has already been granted four loans, all fully reimbursed. Given her limited financial means, she is requesting a fifth loan to bolster her working capital and extend her activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various food products (rice, pasta, canned goods, milk, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: One Love Group

texts.en: Nancy S. is the leader of a group five borrowers called One Love Group. She is 35 years old, married and has no children. She was not able to go to school because her parents died when she was in her youth. Nancy's business is the sale of hardware such as hammers, nails, locks and hinges. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail on a table in the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She has been running this business for a year and hopes to grow her business in the future. She provides high-quality products to her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Nancy started selling with 75.00 Liberian dollars as working capital, and now operates with 4,000 in working capital. Nancy will use this loan to purchase additional nails and hammers for resale. She dreams of always being able to help her family when they need her. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Nancy is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional nails and hammers for resale

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es:
Asuncion es una madre de familia de 47 años que vive junto a su esposo y a sus menores hijos en el caserío La Piedra del distrito de Lambayeque, en la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace veinte años a la crianza y venta de animales de corral. Ella cría aves (patos, pavos, gallinas) en la parte posterior de su domicilio y las comercializa con los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive con mucha frecuencia. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para la economía de su familia ya que su esposo, como la mayoría de hombres del lugar, trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no con suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

Asunción desea mejorar la calidad de sus animales para percibir más ingresos al momento de venderlos, por ello se encuentra solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para aves.

Asunción es una mujer bastante responsable y trabajadora. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona confiable y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a los que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Asunción, age 47, lives with her husband and their minor children in the rural community of La Piedra in the Lambayeque district and province of the same name. It is a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. For twenty years she has been raising and selling poultry. She raises birds (ducks, turkeys, chickens) in the area behind her house. She sells them to merchants who frequently visit the area where she lives. This business is very important to her family’s economy because her husband, like most men in the area, is a farm worker. His income is not enough to pay the family expenses. Asunción wants to improve the quality of her animals to get more income when it is time to sell them. That is why, for the first time, she is asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 1,000 PEN. She plans to buy balanced food for birds. Asunción is a very responsible and hard-working person. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be trustworthy. She is always ready to help those who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced food for the improvement of her business of raising poultry

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken N. is married and resides with her husband (shown in the photo) in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children. She stays at home as a housewife and takes care of the household chores.

Her husband is a skillful painter, earning an income of USD 10 per day. He has been in this business since 2001. Their standard of living has been improved since he has had this business.

N. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a motorbike to easily transport her husband’s paintings to his middlemen. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport her husband's paintings

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
68-year-old Catalina has been a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) for more than a few years now. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store at her house. She sells soft drinks, oil, vinegar, and other goods that people in her neighborhood regularly look for.

Having ten children, Catalina and her husband work hard to give them a proper education. Now that their older children are already grown-up, she still wants to help provide for her family. She is currently requesting Php 25,000 from CEVI which she will use to buy supplies for her store. She also hopes to earn more and to improve her house.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her store

loans.name: Chiti

texts.en:
Chiti R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, onions, and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to stock Irish potatoes and cooking oil to sell. Chiti is thirty years old and is married; her husband is a nurse. She has three children, who are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward assisting returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock Irish potatoes and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret O. is a thirty-seven-year-old business woman. She is married with five children; in addition, she has six dependents, four of whom are in school. Margaret sells silver fish and has done so for over six years.

Margaret will use her loan to purchase more bags of silver fish, thus increasing her customers’ satisfaction. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of silver fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more head-ties and underclothes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 27 years old, married and a mother of one.  She runs a boutique where she sells new and second-hand clothes.  Her business has been operating for two years.  She also gets additional income from her rental houses.  She is a member of Jobowisa group in Faulu Kenya.  Through the group, she saves her money weekly.  She has requested a loan of Kes.40,000 to renovate her boutique so as to attract more customers.  She hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Sayima

texts.en:
Sayima Y. is currently in the business of selling bags of maize, sorghum and millet at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and rice to sell.  Sayima is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a storehouse for her cereals.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita C. is from the village of  Kidahon Malinao Gingoog City. She is 58 years old. Emerita is widowed and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Emerita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Emerita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2009, Emerita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Emerita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emerita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Chun Maen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
PO. village, Takeo province, has 19 people who make up a village bank. Mrs. Koem ChU. M. is the village bank president, selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Koem ChU. M. and her husband are farmers who own a 2 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. She is also a vegetable seller, while her husband is an ice cream seller door-to-door. She was born in 1983 and is the mother of two children, one of whom is attending school, while the youngest one is 3 years old. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. To improve her production of rice, Mrs. Koem ChU. M. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Unidos Por El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: UNIDAS POR EL TRIUNFO

Hercilia C. actualmente tiene 60 años, casada y con 07 hijos, participa en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, en la ALCANCIA COMUNAL “UNIDOS POR EL TRIUNFO”, quienes conforman 07 mujeres emprendedoras.

Hercilia se dedica a elaborar carteras, gorras, bolsos a base D. telas y cueros (con máquina D. coser), asimismo elabora aretes, collares y anillos D. perlas, lleva más D. 30 años dedicada a este negocio; tiempo atrás ella trabajaba en una fábrica textil D. telas, y es allí donD. aprendió a cocer y remallar. Debido a eso Hercilia decidió estudiar por correspondencia en una CETPRO, la carrera D. costura.
Del mismo modo doña Hercilia trabaja D. limpieza en una casa, ella invierte sus ingresos para comprar materiales D. trabajo, para los pasajes, alimentos y otros gastos D. su hija, D. la misma forma el esposo colabora con los gastos D. su hogar; el reciente préstamo que se le otorgará lo invertirá  para comprar telas, cueros y demás materiales D. trabajo,
En el futuro ella sueña con especializarse más en su carrera D. costura, y dictar clases D.  manualidades a base D. telas, perlas, y cueros
texts.en:
COMMUNAL BANK: UNITED FOR VICTORY Hercilia C., 60, is married and has 7 children. She is one of 7 enterprising women who compose EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD’s “Unidos por el Triunfo” (United for Victory) communal bank. Hercilia makes purses, caps and bags from fabric and leather (using a sewing machine). She also makes pearl earrings, necklaces and rings. She has been in this line of work for over 30 years. Long ago she used to work for a textile factory and that’s where she learned how to sew and install finishings. This led her to take a correspondence sewing career course at a CETPRO (Technical Productive Education Center). Hercilia also works cleaning a house. She invests her earnings in work supplies, transportation costs, food and other expenses of her daughter. Her husband contributes to household expenses similarly. The latest loan that will be granted will be to purchase fabric, leather and other work supplies. She would like to specialize in some aspect of sewing in the future and to teach crafts courses based on fabric, pearl and leather.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and leather.

loans.name: Chimedregzen

texts.en:
Chimedregzen R. lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in an apartment that is mortgaged through the bank. Her husband is self-employed and runs a private business. Her oldest daughter lives on her own and helps in her mother's business, while her older son works as an electrical engineer. Her two younger daughters attend a local secondary school. Chimedregzen works very hard and is a clever woman.

Chimedregzen operates a hair and beauty salon named "Anhiluun" in Ulaanbaatar. She started the salon in 1990 with only two hairdressers in Hovd Province. Her business grew quickly over the years, and her number of employees increased to eight hairdressers. Her business is in a popular spot that attracts many customers. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more equipment, tools and beauty products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment, tools and beauty products

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El  Sr. Julio Cesar A.   es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Republicano, tiene 29 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Noelia Alfonzo Servin con 19 años de edad, actualmente tienen 2 hijos todos en edad escolar.
 
       Posee dos Automovil Mca. Toyota y Mercedes Benz,  en el cual trabaja como Taxista de Pasajeros en el cruce Tacuara, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente con la Fundacion Paraguaya y con otras entidades financieras.

             El cliente con este crédito esta pensando cambiar su vehículo por otro mas nuevo para mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Julio Cesar A. is from the neighborhood of Republicano in the city of San Estanislao. He is 29 years old and married to Sra. Noelia Alfonzo Servin, age 19. They have two school age children.

Julio has two automobiles, a Toyota and a Mercedes Benz, that he uses for his job as a taxi driver. He provides passenger transportation services from the Tacuara crossing. Since he has an established customer base, Julio is able to earn a good income. He has good business and personal references and is a hard worker. Julio has been an excellent client of Fundación Paraguaya as well as with other financial institutions.

With his loan, Julio is planning to replace his vehicle with a newer one so that he can provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre en el fundo San Martín, una zona rural situada a un lado de la carretera que une la ciudad de Chiclayo con el distrito de San José.

Desde hace tres años ella dirige un negocio de venta de comida y bebidas en un ambiente situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella ayuda a su madre con los gastos familiares. Los clientes son los pobladores del lugar que prefieren su establecimiento debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara los alimentos y al buen trato que brinda al momento de atenderlos.

María está pensando en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más insumos para preparar comida, así como también en la compra de más bebidas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar a su negocio adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en: María Esther is 22 years old, single and lives with her mother in San Martín, a rural area situated on the side of the highway that connects the city of Chiclayo to the district of San José. For the past three years she has managed a business selling food and beverages out of the back part of her home. She helps her mother with household expenses with the income she earns. Her customers are locals who prefer her establishment because of the good seasonings she uses to prepare her meals and her quality customer service. María is thinking about expanding her business by purchasing more ingredients to make her meals, as well as more beverages. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve this objective. María is a woman who always gives her all to make headway for her business. She has previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and beverages to expand her business

loans.name: Baldirmaa

texts.en:
Baldirmaa R. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and four daughters in Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family all live together in their own apartment. Her older two daughters are students at the universities and her younger two daughters attend a school. Her husband works as fire hydrant cleaner for a company. 

Baldirmaa operates a used item retail business. She sells a variety of secondhand clothing and shoe items for both children and adults. She started her business in 2000 and since then has built a stable operation and has gained much experience as a businesswoman. Baldirmaa is a modest, honest and responsible woman and says, "I want to expand my business and open a new branch of my store in the future." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase blankets, pants, shoes and bed covers to sell at her business.

loans.use: To purchase blankets, pants, shoes and bed covers

loans.name: Jenny De Los Ágeles

texts.es:
La venta de frutas es la actividad a la que se dedica la joven Jenny G. en el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua. Es una persona muy trabajadora que desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia sus ventas y se ha ganado el cariño de muchos clientes que le compran el productos.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido directamente en la compra de bananos para la venta ya que están siendo muy demandados. Espera ser beneficiada con el crédito y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su amada familia que tanto lo necesita ya que percibirá mayores ingresos por las ventas.
texts.en:
Jenny G. is a young woman who sells fruit at the Wholesale Market in Managua. She is a hardworking individual who begins selling in the early morning hours and has earned the affection of many of the customers who buy her products.

Jenny is currently requesting a loan to invest directly in the purchase of bananas to sell since they are in great demand. She hopes to benefit from this is loan so that she can improve the living conditions for her beloved family. Therefore, she needs to generate more revenue from her sales.

loans.use: Purchase bananas to sell

loans.name: Amy Diagne

texts.fr: Madame Amy  Diagne Cissé est âgée de 46 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le commerce de légumes, poissons fumés et sel depuis1997.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis décembre  2009. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100000frs prévu pour l’achat de s produits qu’elle commercialise en vue de renforcer son stock .Le crédit lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus et de  mieux prendre en charge les dépenses au sein de la famille.
texts.en: Madame Amy Diagne Cissé is 46 years old. She lives in Bambilor.  She is married and has been active in the business of selling vegetables, fish, and salt since 1997.  She has been a member of the Bambilor credit union since December of 2009.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 frs to purchase more of  the products she sells so that she can build up her stock.
