The loan will allow her to increase her revenue and to better meet family expenses.

loans.use: to increase capital

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school and one who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills, school fees, and electricity bills. 

She operates a restaurant business from home; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Salim faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She hopes to expand and establish a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, bundles of wheat flour, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business and her living standards.

loans.use: To  purchase sacks of beans, bundles of wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Idikhuja

texts.en:
L. Idikhuja is 41 years old. Together with his wife, who works to help pay household expenses, they have five children. His goal for his children is to support them so that they may complete their studies leading to professional careers.

Idikhuja has worked as a farmer for the past five years. The greatest obstacles for him are pests. He began his work with his own efforts, and the help our organization was able to offer led to better production. With this loan Idikhuja will invest in the purchase of fertilizers and high quality seeds to get a better harvest, which he will be able to sell at a better market price. Let’s support this hard-working man so that he can reach his goals! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Titus Risa

texts.en:
Titus Risa, 25, trades livestock at Bissil market in Kajiado. He is married to Pessy S., who is a farmer, and together they have one child, Sopon S., who is two years old. Titus was introduced to KADET by other KADET customers. 

Titus has been in the livestock trading business for a period of five years and his monthly profit is Kshs 4,000. This loan of Kshs 20,000 is his first loan with KADET and he intends to use Kshs 10,000 to purchase cows and Kshs 10,000 to buy goats, both for trading. If the loan boosts his business, Titus will start a butchery business. Titus hopes to become a prominent businessman. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats for trading.

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man R. is an older woman, 62 years old, and is a mother blessed with a daughter and a son. Her children are employed: her son works in a hotel in Phnom Penh City and her daughter is a coffee seller. They also provide their income to contribute to their family’s living expenses. Man R. was married, but her husband died of many years ago. To earn a living, Man R. sells Khmer noodles to her neighbors who live in the village as well as managing the housework. Man R. will be using her loan to help improve her daughter's business. She will use the funds to buy coffee and other soft drinks for selling.

loans.use: To buy coffee and other soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Las Doncellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Doncellas está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedora una de ella es la señora Blanca Zolorzano desde hace cuatro años vende celulares con el cual ha sacado adelante sus cuatros hijos. Ella tiene el sueño de poner su propia tienda de celulares.

Las otras integrantes de grupos son Irma Isaguirre Osorio quien vende perfumes y Noelia L. tiene una fritanga.
texts.en:
The group "Las Doncellas" is made up of 3 hardworking and enterprising women.  One of these is Blanca Zolorzano, who has been selling cellular phones for 4 years and has supported her 4 children with this business.  She has a dream of having her own cellular phone store.  

The other members of the group are Irma Isaguirre Osorio, who sells perfumes, and Noelia L., who has a fried food stand.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a palm leaves selling business, selling from her home to her neighbours and to passersby. Mishi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase palm leaves to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm leaves to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make kenkey for sale

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 33 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de Chinchero, él tiene su pareja y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Fredy es un hombre que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia y quiere sacar adelante a su hijos, él trabaja haciendo artesanía como por ejemplo chompas de lana y otras cosas más. Ya son 4 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Fredy en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como lana, tintes naturales y otras cosas más. Fredy pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva victoria” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por esta oportunidad y se comprometo con los pagos correspondientes.
texts.en: Fredy is 33 and was born in the city of Chinchero.  He has a partner with whom he has two children.  He is a man who is very concerned with the well-being of his family and he wants to support his kids.  He works as an artisan, making things like wool sweaters and other items.  He's been in the business for 4 years and it's going really well.  At present, Fredy needs a loan to buy more materials like wool, natural dyes, etc.  He belongs to the "Nueva Victoria" Village Bank, which is part of Asociación Arawiwa.  He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy more materials, like wool, natural dyes, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph O. is 41 years old, married and the father of one child. He has been working as a mechanic in a garage where he repairs vehicles for his customers in Kangemi, Nairobi. He earns an income of 10,000 KES per month.

Joseph learned about KADET LTD through a friend. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase spare parts. He intends to use the anticipated profit to save and plow back into the business.

In the future Joseph would like to grow his business and start selling spare parts from Dubai and Japan.

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Mrs. Vuthy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The ten people who make up this a village bank loan will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living.  Mrs. Vuthy is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. 

Mrs. Vuthy was born in 1982. She is a duck breeder and her husband, Mr. Vai, is a driver who receives a low salary.  He is also a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to sell as well as to feed his family.  Since Mrs. Vuthy's business is going well, she wants to expand.  To achieve her purpose, she is seeking a loan to buy more ducks as well as piglets and pig food to start a new business. 

Mrs. Vuthy is a mother of one child who is still too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and pigs

loans.name: Señoras De Pumayunga (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Señoras de Pumayunga está formado por 2 hombres y 8 mujeres quienes trabajan día a día en diferentes actividades ya sea como obreros o en sus pequeños negocios, estas actividades les han permitido mejorar económicamente y sacar  adelante a sus familias. Viven por el sector de San Pedro del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene un hermoso centro histórico que es patrimonio cultural,  su gastronomía es muy variada y su gente es muy hospitalaria.

La Señora. María Isabel Valladares vive por el sector de San Pedro en la comunidad de  Pumayunga, es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá.

Tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de un año y medio de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer  y se dedica a la conducción de transporte pesado, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

Doña María Isabel se dedica  a la elaboración de artesanías, hace flores artificiales, esta actividad aprendió hace 8 años que trabajaba para otros pero ahora labora de manera independiente y trabaja por obras. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes, conejos y pollos a  los que los  vende en su comunidad y también son para su consumo.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir para instalar un local de venta de artesanías.
  
Su meta es hacer realidad su negocio.
texts.en:
The Señoras de Pumayunga [Women of Pumayunga] community bank is made up of two men and eight women who work every day doing a variety of jobs, either as laborers or at their small businesses.  These activities have allowed them to improve economically and improve the lives of their families.  They live in the San Pedro del Cebollar area in the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate, and has a beautiful historic downtown that is a cultural heritage, with diverse cuisines and hospitable people.  

María Isabel Valladares lives in the San Pedro neighborhood in the community of Pumayunga.  This is her first loan with the community bank, which she was invited to join by her mother.

She is 26 years old, married, and has a one and a half year old son.  Her husband is a driver, and he works driving heavy freight.  With both of their hard work, they have built their own house.

María Isabel works making artificial flowers.  She learned this craft eight years ago.  She used to work for others, but now she works independently and also for others.  At her house, she also works raising guinea pigs, rabbits, and chickens, which her family consumes, or she sells in the community.

The loan will be used to set up a store that sells crafts.  Her goal to make her store a reality.

loans.use: to set up a store to sell her crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make some improvements and to buy food staples to supply her store.

loans.name: Always Faithful Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Always Faithful” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Gbassay.  Gbassay is 40 years old; she was born in Bo city, but she is currently residing in Kenema with her three children. Her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Gbassay has been selling fish and palm-oil for many years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and palm-oil in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion  is from the village of Kinuman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Visitacion is widowed and has 4 adult children. Visitacion owns & operates an agricultural business, planting & harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Visitacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Visitacion is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. This will be her seventh loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mburu

texts.en:
For the last 43 years Mburu has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru Town. He is 74 years old and married to Kezia. 

He got to know about KADET through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru Town. This will be his fourth loan, after he repaid his previous loan of KES 55,000 in full and on time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy two sheep, a heifer, and farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

In the future, Mburu aspires to practice large-scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru Town.

loans.use: to buy two sheep, a heifer, and farm supplies.

loans.name: Sam At

texts.en:
Sam At (shown in the photo) is 39 years old and her husband, Sopheap, is 42 years old. They live in a village along National Road number five, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1989 and have four sons. Two are garment workers and the other two are in school.  

Sam At is a garment worker, while her husband is a school principal. She is in the process of building new house, but she lacks some money to pay for building fees. That’s why she has decided to ask for a loan.

loans.use: to pay for her house building fees.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael has run a garage in Naivasha for seven years. He is 33 years old and married to Jane. He has two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET customer. This is his second loan. He paid the other loan well and in good time. 

He intends to use this loan to buy spare parts such as oil filters and plugs.

Michael’s future dream is to open a new garage.

loans.use: To buy spare parts such as oil filters and plugs.

loans.name: Cecilia Maribel

texts.es:
Cecilia de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es vendedora de joyería y ropa. Empezó hace 13 años atrás vendiendo bisutería y ropa poco a poco fue incrementando su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad sigue vendiendo ropa pero con la variedad de joyas. 

Trabaja desde las 14h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Las joyas están a un valor aproximado de $ 25- $ 30.00, la ropa tiene un aproximado de $ 10.00 hasta $ 30.00. Ella tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo joyería y ropa y así darle una mejor economía a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 34 years old, hardworking, and sells jewelry and clothes. 13 years ago she started by selling jewelry and clothes. Little by little the amount of merchandise she sold grew. At the moment she continues to sell clothes however she now sells a variety of jewelry.

Everyday she woks from 2 a.m. to 7 p.m. The price range for her jewelry is $25.00 - $30.00 and her clothes $10.00 - $30.00. She has many aspirations with her business which is why she wants to use the loan to buy jewlery and clothes and be able to offer her 3 children better financial support.

loans.use: buy jewelry and clothes.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Abel; el socio tiene 41 años de edad, el socio es soltero y tiene 4 hijos de 11, 9, 5, 4 años de edad, el socio es de profesión carpintero y el requiere el préstamo para poder comprar madera para la realización de sus trabajos, el socio tiene su taller desde hace 18 años y el socio es muy solicitado, por lo que muchas veces se le acaba el acopio de madera que suele tener, el socio desea poder comprar madera al por mayor por pies cúbicos para poder trabajar y entregar sus muebles a pedido. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "GRANITO DE MOSTAZA" communal bank which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Abel, 41, is single and has four children, ages 11, 9, 5 and 4.  He is a carpenter by trade and is requesting a loan to buy wood for his business.  He has been running a shop for 18 years and he has many customers.  He often runs out of wood because of all the orders he has, so he wants to buy wood by the cubic foot, wholesale, in order to avoid this problem.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old married man. He is the father of one child. He owns an Internet cafe, which is his only source of income so he has to take good care of it in order to develop himself and his family's social and financial situations.

Ali's shop is well known in the region; most of his customers are friends, neighbors and relatives. His work improves a lot during the summer season, while during winter, most of his customers are busy with their education and might come only during their weekends or when they have to do a certain project.

Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his number of computers, which will increase his income. He will also continue building his sweet home, and he hopes to make it the way he imagined with his wife.

Ali is experiencing Al Majmoua's loan for the first time, and he hopes it will be with a positive impact.

He is planning to expand his business through opening another branch in the future.

loans.use: To increase the number of computers in his Internet cafe.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, se dedica a la venta comida y bebidas, ella vive con su esposo y tres hijos, se han dedicado al negocio desD. hace 8 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, el negocio es rentable, se apoya D. su esposo para  realizar las ventas.
Ella invertirá un préstamo en la compra D. bebidas (gaseosa, jugos, refrescos naturales), también mercadería como aceite, condimentos y carnes, para surtir el negocio D. productos que le permitan atender mejor la demanda.
El objetivo D. Sandra es invertirle al negocio, ampliar la variedad D. platillos, y continuar creciendo como microempresaria D. la mano con préstamos.
texts.en:
Sandra works selling food and drinks.  She lives with her husband and three children, and has worked in the business for the last 8 years.  She is a very hard-working woman, and the business is profitable.  Her husband helps her make the sales.

She will be investing the loan in the purchase of drinks (sodas, juices, natural refreshments), and also ingredients such as oil, spices and meat, to stock up her business with products that will allow her to better meet demand.

Sandra's objective is to invest in her business, expand the variety of dishes, and to continue growing as a micro-enterprise thanks to the loans.

loans.use: to buy drinks (sodas, juices, natural refreshments)

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Violeta has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Violeta is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Violeta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Alejandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, la señora Alejandra del Carmen  se ha   se desempeña como supervisor facturación  y se dedica a esta labor desde hace dieciocho años. Es casada y con tres personas a su cargo.

Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción, para comprar cinz, perlines y pagar mano de obra, para reparar techo que se encuentra en mal estado por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Managua, Señora Alejandra del Carmen has worked as a factory supervisor for the last 18 years. She is married and has 3 dependents.

She has now turned to Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan to improve the condition of her house. By buying building materials such as zinc, perlin and paying for labour, she is going to repair the roof which is in a bad state of repair and so improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia sigue en su negocio de venta de frutas,ella vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos entre otras frutas y tambien se dedica a vender coronas de caridad,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas como amanzanas,naranjas y platanos al por mayor y para comprar coronas de caridad.al por mayor.
                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Gladys, is 33 years old.  She is partnered and has 3 children.  She operates a fruit business, selling apples, oranges, grapes, bananas and other fruits.  She also sells "coronas de caridad" [an offering of penitence or hope].  The business is her means of supporting her children.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of fruits and "coronas de caridad".  

Sra. Gladys is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is 42 years old with 2 children. She has been rice noodle maker for 4 years. Joining in our credit program in 2009, she has received 2 previous loans which she has used effectively to expand her business. She finds that this kind of credit is very suitable with her earning activity. She wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy rice as material for making noodles.

loans.use: to buy material to make rice noodles

loans.name: Carmen Emerita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, ella tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijas aun viven con ella, una de ellas está casada y vive con su familia. Su esposo trabaja en Santa Elena.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa interior por catalogo de la marca Leonisa y  productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). También  ella tiene un local en el centro en el cual vende helados, local que no hace mucho abrió y en el que también aprovecha para vender todos sus productos. Lleva seis años trabajando en ventas y recién 6 meses con su heladería.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa interior y helados. Lleva 8 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido financiar sus negocios.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en sus negocios.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed back then, the “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) communal bank meets every fifteen days.

We met Carmen, 61, here.  She’s married and has five children who are all adults now.  Two of her daughters still live with her.  One of them is married and lives with her family.  Her husband works in Santa Elena.

She is a housewife who, in order to earn her own resources, sells underwear of the Leonisa brand via catalogue and also sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She also has a locale downtown where she sells ice-cream, a locale she opened not long ago and that she also uses to sell all her other products.  She’s been working in sales for six years and only six months in her ice-cream shop.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, underwear and ice-cream.  She’s been in the communal bank 8 years and likes it because thanks to the loans she’s been able to finance her businesses.  Her dream is to continue with her businesses.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, underwear and ice-cream.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and from food vending. Delia is borrowing 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture-making business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 28-year-old hardworking lady with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children.  She has been running a cosmetics business for eight years.  The main challenges are customers not paying on time, high taxes and high fuel and transportation costs; her business goal is to hire employees to expand her business and to move her business to a more permanent location. The purpose of the loan is to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
En este lugar conocimos a María, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  tres hijos de 7, 4 y 1 año  de edad, dos de ellos estudian en escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio, vende productos Yanbal y Avon (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios, entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, ella sale a recorrer por su localidad dos o tres días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esta hora sus hijos están en la escuela ya que en la tarde tiene que dedicarse a sus hijos ayudándoles en sus tareas que les dejan en la escuela. Ella  deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra cada 8 días, lleva un año en este negocio y empezó con su primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar perfumes, cremas y bisutería. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos ya que con ellos puede financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en:
The "Emprendedora De Los Cerezos" ["Entrepreneur of Los Cerezos"] communal bank meets twice a month in the Los Cerezos area of the city of Portoviejo. This is a highly populated area on the edge of the city.

This is where we meet María. She is 25 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has three children, aged 7, 4 and 1 year. Two of them attend school. Her husband works in construction.

Jenni is a great mother and housewife who also works in retail selling Yanbal and Avon products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, and accessories, among other things). Her sales approach is going door-to-door and on request. She travels her area two or three days a week. mainly in the mornings as this is when her children are in school, and in the afternoon she looks after her children, helping them with their homework.  She sells her products on credit, and collects on a weekly basis.  She has been doing this work for one year, and began it with the first loan that she received from the bank.

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry.  This is her fourth loan with the communal bank, and she likes it because of the loans with which she can finance her business.

Her dream is to continue increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: 03.08.07-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Tý has a retail business selling medication. She is requesting a loan to purchase more medication to resell. Tý has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main harship that Tý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Tý is 28-years-old and she is married with 1 child. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 030807-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 

In 2010, Tý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tý has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Tý hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to buy more land for her own.

loans.use: to purchase more medication to resell.

loans.name: Luceriana

texts.en:
Luceriana is 41 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She is resident of Manila, Philippines.  Luceriana oversees operations of a tricycle transportation business. She has one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day. The regular customers are the local community. She earns about 300 PHP a day.

Luceriana is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP to help her continue operations of her business. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of her tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Luceriana dreams of giving her children a high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for and do maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Leonardo fishes and sells his catch at the public market. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy materials and tools to maintain his fishing boat.

Leonardo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Leonardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools to maintain his fishing boat.

loans.name: Kirdiom Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est créé depuis le 03 décembre 2007 Il est composé de 23 femmes qui habitent dans le même village et aux alentours.Elles font comme activité principale le commerce d'habits .Absa âgée de 62 ans est veuve et mère de 6 enfants dont 01 garçon et 05 filles. Elle est debout sur la photo et levant la main gauche.Avec le prêt reçu elle compte acheter des habits qu'elle revend auprès de ses clients dans les villages environnants, elle s'active dans le commerce d'aliments,elle gère une boutique chez elle. Les bénéfices lui permettent de gérer le petit déjeuner de la famille et d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group was created on December 3, 2007. It comprises 23 women who live in and around the same village. Their main work involves commerce in clothing. Absa, 62 years old, is a widow and the mother of six children (1 boy and 5 girls). She is standing with her left hand raised in the photo. With the profits received, she intends to purchase clothing that she will resell to customers in the surrounding villages. She is active in food commerce. She runs a shop in her home. The profits will enable her to manage breakfast for the family and to ensure that her children's schooling costs are covered.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Agustine

texts.en: Augustine was born in Kolwa west Kisumu District. He has been doing business using a rented motorcycle for for two years. He is married with two children and he is happy to own his own bike. Augustine has committed to provide transport to CHWs targeting the youth and prevention of drug abuse. He is also interested in supporting youth groups counseling and positive living. The motorcycle will enable Augustine provide for his family and support the community as well. He hopes to encourage other motorcycle taxi drivers enroll in the CHW support programme in order to adequately cover all remote locations of Kisumu county. Augustine is an experienced motorcycle taxi trader and he hopes to make money and buy another motorcycle and support two CHWs.

loans.use: To Purchase Motorcycle to Support Community Health Workers and Micro Business

loans.name: Esperanza Viva 4 Group

texts.es:
Angela is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza Viva (Hope live) 4. Her story is representative of both her group members and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently moved from the Haiti to the DR) clients. Her group is based in the Hato Mayor, one of the rural city in the Dominican Republic.

Here she makes her home in a simple structure being a single mom of 5 and 4 of her children live together with her. Angela is excited to take her third loan from Esperanza. 

She plans to use this loan to improve her underwear sales business. She has been doing her business almost 2 years ago after she took her first loan with Esperanza. Angela says she enjoys doing business, and to read. Her most important dream is to have a successful business to produce enough income to have a tranquil life along with her family.

She will continuing saving and re-investing her business profits. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy underwear

loans.name: Dúo Los Chajones Group

texts.es:
DÚO LOS CHAJONES
Este dúo esta formado por doña Oralia  de  25 años de edad  es casada y tiene 1 hijo, nos cuenta que desde hace 4 años tiene una tienda de artículos de consumo diario (frijol, maíz, golosinas y aguas)  también vende frutas y verduras, tiene una pequeña librería (cuadernos, libros, resistol, hojas, lápices,etc.)  Ahora que se aproxima la época navideña su negocio es muy frecuentado por su clientela, por eso quiere tener bien surtida para que los clientes le compren la fruta para hacer el ponche y otras comidas y golosinas.    Por eso quiere que Fape KIVA pueda otorgarle el crédito que solicita.
texts.en:
DÚO LOS CHAJONES The duo "Los Chajones"

This duo was formed by Oralia de los Angeles who is 25, married with one child. She advises that for the last four years she has been running a convenience store selling staples (beans, maize, snacks and water) as well as fruit and vegetables. She also has a small bookshop (notebooks, books, glue, paper, pencils etc) With the Christmas season approaching, her customers are coming to her shop more often.She wants to stock up so that her customers buy fruit to make punch and other meals and snacks. This is why she wants Fape Kiva to disburse the loan that she has applied for.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Mrs. Petra has a business of sale of soda, purefied water and groceries. She is asking for a loan 1.200dlls to buy more merchandise in her small little store and to make it bigger because at the present time is inside her house, and she would like to separate her business and her house and the have more privacy. Also there is a school very close to her business and she want to sell school supplies that why she is asking for a loan. she lives with his husband, who also work in her business; he is a construction worker and has 70 years old. \"My business is our main source of income.\"

Español

La Sra. Petra tiene su negocio de venta de refrescos y agua destilada cuenta también con algo de abarrotes; solicita un préstamo de 1.200dlls.para surtir su pequeña tiendita y acondicionar su local ya que lo tiene en parte de su casa. Tiene muy cerca una escuela por lo que quiere vender útiles escolares; vive con su esposo el cual trabaja también eventualmente; pues es una persona de 70 años como albañil “Mi negocio es nuestra principal fuente de ingresos”

loans.use: Venta de abarrotes y ampliar el negocio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Bethua would like to purchase foodstuffs such as sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and wheat flour for her shop.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria is married and has seven children, all of whom are already married. Her husband Jose is retired.

Eight years ago Gloria started her own business selling clothing and toys, to help with the family's expenses. She sells her products in flea markets located in Escobedo, Nuevo Leon, where she is from. Little by little she has been investing in more merchandise and has made her business grow throughout this time.

Now Gloria needs a loan for $375 with which she will purchase used and new clothing to cover the demand of her clients, and increase the diversity of the products she sells. She has committed to pay back the loan in 6 to 12 months.

Today you can help someone who needs it the most. You can help Gloria. Don't think about it anymore and make your mind to support her.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Gloria es casada y tiene siete hijos, todos ellos ya casados, su esposo José es pensionado y para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, hace ocho años Gloria inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa y juguetes, ella vende sus productos en los mercados ambulantes ubicados en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, de donde son originarios, poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo más en mercancía y ha hecho crecer su negocio durante todo este tiempo.

Ahora Gloria necesita un préstamo por $ 375 dólares con los que va a adquirir ropa usada y nueva para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, y tener una mayor variedad, ella se compromete a devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes ayudar a Gloria, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria G. owns a small shop selling household items. She was able to open her business thanks to a loan from her husband who sent $300 from Italy where he works. Every day from 7am until 9pm, Ms. G. runs her store, which happens to be located in her house.

Victoria is applying for her second loan with Mifex and Kiva. Her first credit was a success as she was able to improve the appearance of her store and invest in products that increased profits and business. She saves a part of her profits in order to improve the standard of living of her children and save up to pay for their education. She says it is hard living as a single mother, but she has no desire to uproot her family and move to a foreign place. This 32 year-old entrepreneur who is from the Provincia de los Rios wants nothing more than to succeed in business and give her kids a better life than she had growing up.

loans.use: Victoria would like to continue investing in different products for her shop.

loans.name: Nigarkhanum

texts.ru:
Nigarkhanum T. was born in 1953. She was born and lives in the town of Aksu. Nigarkhanum is a widowed mother of 4 children. When her husband died, her family lived through some hard times. Nigarkhanum was able to recover by taking a $300 loan from Aksu branch of Normicro. She used the money to start selling fruits and vegetables on the central market. Now, Nigarkhanum wants to take another loan to increase the variety of goods sold. Nigarkhanum expresses her gratitude to all of you, who consider helping her and others.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тарвердиева Нигарханум 1953 года рождения.Родилась и проживает в городе Аксу. Имеет четверо детей, вдова. Когда умер муж семье стало тяжело.Взяла в кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала 300$ .На центральном рынке начала заниматься торговли фруктами и овощами.Теперь она хочеть взять еще кредит чтобы, купить больше товаров.Нигарханум благодарна тем людям который ей помогает.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sutiami

texts.id:
Because of high living cost to pay for expenses of 2 school aged children, Ni Ketut Sutiami forced herself to open a retail stall in her home. She is doing this, since she wants a better family life from her increased income. Previously Ni Ketut Sutiami only works as a tentant farmer. Ni Ketut Sutiami sells vegetable, light food, bread and drinks. With an initial capital of Rp 1,000,000 (about US$110), Ni Ketut Sutiami buys her items and vegetables from her customers. Ni Ketut Sutiami goes to the market from 4:00 AM to buy her retail items needs in the Morning Market in Negara city. Ni Ketut Sutiami opens her retail stall from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM. Each day profit could reach up to Rp50,000 (US$5.50). This profit is used to help her husband I Made Rina who works as a tenant farmer, to pay living expenses and education expenses for their 2 children. First child is in 9th Grade, and the second in 5th grade. Capital loaned from Dinari would be used to complete facilities in retail stall. Ni Ketut Sutiami hopes that with Dinari's capital her business would expand, moves forward, and their lifes needs fulfilled.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Karena biaya hidup yang cukup berat karena harus menanggung dua anak yang masih sekolah, Ni Ketut Sutiami memberanikan diri untuk membuka usaha warung dirumahnya. Hal ini dilakukannya, karea ia ingin kehidupan keluarganya lebih baik dari peningkatan pendapatannya. Sebelumnya Ni Ketut Sutiami hanya bekerja sebagai petani. Ni Ketut Sutiami menjual sayur - mayur , makanan ringan, roti dan minuman. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Ni Ketut Sutiami membeli barang dagangan dan sayur mayur dari langganannya. Ni Ketut Sutiami pergi kepasar pada pukul 04.00 pagi untuk membeli keperluan warungnya di Pasar Pagi di kota Negara. Ni Ketut Sutiami mulai membuka warungnya dari jam 07.00 pagi sampai jam 18.00 sore hari. Keuntungan yang diperoleh satu hari mencapai Rp.50.000,- perhari. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk membantu suaminya I Made Rina yang bekerja sebagai petani untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga pendidikan kedua anaknya . Anak yang pertama duduk dikelas 3 SMA dan yang kedua duduk di kelas 5 SD.Modal yang dipinjamn dari Dinari digunakan untuk melengkapai persediaan di warungnya. Ni Ketut Sutiami berharap dengan modal yang didapat dari Dinari usahanya akan lebih maju dan berkembang, dan kebutuhan hidupnya terpenuhi.

loans.use:
To add capital to complete facilities in retail stall

Menambah Modal usaha untuk melengkapi fasilitas warungnya

loans.name: Murayo

texts.en: Moriyo T. is a 37 year old married woman with 2 children from Okoko, Lagos, Nigeria. She sells garri in the market. She has been a LAPO member and requests a loan to enable her buy more garri for sale.

loans.use: To buy more garri

loans.name: Phov

texts.en:
Mrs. Phov S., age 42, is a housewife. Her husband is a fisherman, who earns about $4 each day. They have four children; one is employed at a golf course and three are enrolled in school.

She requests a loan of $300 to purchase fishing tools to assist her husband with his business. This will increase the family’s income and allow her to be able to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase fishing tools

loans.name: Upper Kawugab(2061) B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth L.. She is currently in the business of raising and selling poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to expand her poultry business. Ruth is 30 years old and is married with 7 children. Her children range in age from 3 to 12 and they all go to school. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 35,000 in profits from her business. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children and re-invest in her food business.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Joyce Nakitenda, Jane K., Safina T., and Justine K.. Joyce Nakitenda is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan of UGX 250,000 to re-invest in the business. Jane K. is currently in the business of raising and selling poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 250,000 to start a piggery business. Safina T. is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to construct a new poultry house. Justine K. is currently in the poultry business as well and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to buy a plastic water tank.

loans.use: To re-invest in the businesses

loans.name: Kimnye A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rehema N.. She is currently in the business of selling firewood and is requesting a loan to purchase in bulk. Rehema is 37 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 3 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Rehema makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her children's education. Rehema has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rehema is joined in her small group by Mary N., Resty L., Sarah K., and Prossy N.. Mary N. has a business selling arts and crafts and wants to increase her capital stock. Resty L. is currently operating a piggery business and wants a loan to construct a piggery house. Sarah K. operates a business of clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Prossy N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to buy a weighing scale and shelves.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is the mother of four children. For the past two years, she has also taken care of two primary schools as a matron. A matron provides meals to school children during their breaks. The proceeds of this loan will help Yaa buy supplies to prepare food. The profits from her business will help her with her children’s school fees.

Yaa is a member of the trust group Yesu Mo (Thank God). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy food supplies

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Mrs. Savy H. lives in Kork Sandek Village in Kampong Spue province. She owns a plantation which she cultivates twice a year. She is 48 and is a widow with two children, all of whom are employed in a garment factory. The household relies on both her children salaries to support the family expenses such as food, wedding and funerals ceremonies.  Mrs. Savy H. has never obtained a loan before.  She now lacks money to work the plantation, so she has decided to request a loan to buy cows to plow the field.

loans.use: To buy cows to plow the field.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Señor Gabino is 37 years old and is married to Mary Caballero who is 35 years old and is a housewife. She also helps in the care and milking of their cows. They have a five-year-old son who is starting elementary school.

At a young age, Gabino started selling milk with his father. Later he went out on his own and today is doing very well in producing his own milk and delivering milk from door to door by bicycle. Even though he often experiences bad weather, he is motivated by his friends’ and clients’ appreciation and value of his work.

Today, thanks to the quality of his product, he has a large clientele for which he needs a motorcycle to reach more consumers and to go longer distances.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Gabino tiene 37 años, está casado con Mary Caballero de 35 años de edad quien es ama de casa, quien también ayuda en el cuidado y ordeñe de las vacas. Tienen un hijo de cinco años quien esta empezando su escolar básico.

Gabino empezó desde temprana edad en la venta de leche junto con su padre, luego se independizó, hoy en día cuenta con su propia producción de leche lo cual le va muy bien, ya que las ventas las realiza casa por casa en bicicleta, a pesar de que muchas veces se presenta inclemencias del tiempo, motivo por el cual es muy apreciado y valorado la labor de Gabino por sus amigos y clientes.

Hoy día gracias a la calidad de su producto cuenta con una numerosa clientela para lo cual necesita de una motocicleta para llegar a más consumidores y en lugares más distanciados.

loans.use: Purchase of a Motorcycle

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
Etibar I. is a 54 year old man who keeps food store in his store. He has lived and worked in the Saatli Region since 1998. He is married and has 2 daughters.

This store is the one and only financial source of income for his family. Therefore, Etibar tries very hard to attract as many clients as possible. In the summer time, the most popular products are cool beverages. However, Etibar does not have them in his store. Thus, he is worried that he could lose a significant number of clients. To improve this situation, he has applied for a $1200 USD loan that he will use to to purchase a refrigerator and beverages to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and beverages

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Saida, in the south of Lebanon. He owns a shoe store. He is a very responsible man whose priority in life is the happiness of his family.

He first heard about Al Majmoua's loans through word of mouth. The institution's good reputation pushed Samer to request a loan for the first time. He is requesting $1200 to purchase more merchandise to diversify the inventory in his shop. Indeed, his shop can't currently answer the demand of all his clients in term of choice and brands.

loans.use: To diversify the inventory of goods in his shoe shop

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin D. lives in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 36 years old and married with three children. Toyin sells catering materials, including baking butter, decorations, and flour. She also engages in catering services at both inside and outside functions. She has been employed in this business for a long time.

Toyin is requesting a loan of $1025 UDS to buy additional catering materials to grow her business and maximize her profits.

loans.use: To buy additional catering materials to grow her business and maximize her profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying an overlook sewing machine

loans.name: Ibadatoy

texts.ru: Каримова Ибодатой жительница района Гиссар. Возраст 51 года,замужем,имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее.Клиентка имеет небольшую торговую точку,на которой торгует растительным маслом.На доход от бизнеса она содержит семью.На кредит Ибодатой планирует закупить очередную партию масла у оптовых поставщиков.Погасит кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ibodatoy K. is a resident of Gissar region. She is 51 years old, married and has four children. Gissar has a high school education. This loan client has a small trade outlet, where she sells vegetable oil, and with the proceeds from this business she supports her family. With this loan Ibodatoy plans to purchase another batch of oil from the wholesale suppliers. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Ms. Phun T., 50, is single and lives with her sister, Ms. Ly T., 38, who is a silk weaver. The family lives in a small village near the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Phun has been a silk weaver since 2002 and has been selling silk fabric for three years. She buys the finished products from weavers in her village for resale at Oreu Sey market in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Elfida Paulina

texts.es: Elfida se dedica a la venta de maíz, huevos, aguas gaseosas, y venta de ropa para damas y niños, tiene ya doce años con el negocio. Ella inició su negocio únicamente vendiendo tamales y helados, pero la misma necesidad de poder ganar un poco más de dinero le hicieron buscar otros productos que vender, así fue como inicio con la venta de de maíz, el cual compra en el mercado de la Terminal en la ciudad capital, y lo lleva a su aldea Chixolis en Santiago Sacatepequez, donde lo vende entre sus vecinos y amigos.  Conforme fue adquiriendo clientes, ellos le pedían otras cosas, así fue que empezó a vender huevos, aguas gaseosas y ropa.  Ella tiene 4 hijos, y su esposo es le apoya en su negocio, ella quiere invertir el crédito para comprar una cantidad mayor de mercadería, ya que es más barato comprar por mayor, ella desea tener bien surtido se negocio para poder incrementar también sus ganancias.  Sus metas son poder ir mejorando su casa, ya con mucho esfuerzo han luchado para tener su propia casa, ya que ella y su esposo son originarios de la costa sur del país.  Por todo eso ella sigue luchando para mejorar y tener un lugar digno para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elfida sells corn, eggs, soda water, and clothes for women and children. She has been in the business for twelve years. She began her business only selling tamales and ice cream, but the need to earn more money made her look for other products to sell. It was in this way that she began to sell corn, which she buys in the Terminal market in the capital city. She brings it to her village of Chixolis in Santiago Sacatepequez, where she sells her products among her neighbors and friends. As she got more clients, they asked Elfida for other things. Because of this, she began to sell eggs, soda water, and clothes. She has 4 children, and her husband helps her in her business. She wants to invest the loan to buy more merchandise because it is cheaper to buy at wholesale. She wants to have a well-stocked business so that she can also increase her earnings. Her goals are to be able to continue improving her house. She has already fought with a lot of strength to have her own house, since she and her husband are originally from the Southern coast of the country. Because of all of this, she continues fighting to improve and have a dignified home for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business to sell corn and eggs

loans.name: Groupement

texts.fr: Le groupement  V. est un groupe familial composé de Monsieur AZIADRO Kokou Domefa né à Tsévié et âgé de 37 ans et Madame ALITE Akouvi,  32 ans née également à Tsévié. Cette famille très dynamique, a entrepris très tôt L. fabrication de savon sauvage appelé communément  « KPEVIDI ». Ce savon est fabriqué à base d’huile rouge et soude caustique et autres ingrédients qui, aussitôt préparé, trouve de preneurs à l’intérieur du pays. Cette famille dispose des moyens très insuffisants pour satisfaire sa clientèle malgré l’appui financier de tout coté. Actuellement elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat de produits de fabrication. Une fois ce crédit accordé, cette famille honnête et laborieuse pourra améliorer ses conditions de vie socio-économique.
texts.en:
The "V." [Victory] group is a family group made up of Mr. Kokou Domefa Aziadro, born in Tsévié and 37 years of age, and Mrs. Akouvi Alite, 32 years old and also born in Tsévié. This is a very energetic family who started early on making soap known as "KPEVIDI". This soap made from red palm oil and caustic soda and other ingredients. As quickly as they make the soap, it is bought by customers in the interior of the country. This family is not in a position to meet their customers' demand despite financial help from all sides. They are now asking for a loan to purchase the raw materials to make more soap. Once the loan is extended, this honest and hard-working family will be able to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell soap.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith D. has 2 children and both of them are married. She is a farmer and loves to grow crops. She likes rice. Every day she works in her farm, feeling the dirt and the heat of the sun for a living. She also sells rice. In 1985, she began her business from a little money that she had saved when she was still young. Until now, she is still in this kind of business. This keeps Judith busy all the time working hard to earn more for her needs as well as her children's needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. She dreams of having her own land. The loan that she will soon receive will help her earn more to buy land. In this way her children could have a livelihood for their new family.

As a CEVI member, Judith now enjoys the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI gives all its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of farm inputs

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en:
Shamsi has owned a nursery in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 9 years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $650. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more school items (chalk, books, and clothes) for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Shamsi is married, and has two children: ages 18 and 13. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Fransisca, Asha H. and Asha M.. Each woman also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy school items

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Джонбасова Фотима проживает в городе ТУрсун-заде. Возраст 34 года , замужем и имеет четверых детей. Уже четыре года занимается торговлей  тканями. Реализует товар  путем хождения из дома в дом по кишлакам. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот, что поможет увеличить ассортимент товара. Погасить кредит сможет  в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fotima J. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 34 years old, married, and has four children. She has been selling fabric for four years. She sells her goods door-to-door in villages. She wants to take out a loan to increase sales by improving her selection of goods. She can repay the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales

loans.name: Yanci Patricia

texts.es:
Yanci R. se dedica a la venta de frutas, desde hace 3 años que se dedica a este tipo de actividad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion y opera bajo el nombre de Frutas ROCIO, ella es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales dependen de ella, ella tambien recibe una ayuda de su exesposo ya que con el tuvieron dos de los tres hijos que ella tiene.
desde que ella se separo de su union marital, decidio independizarse y empezo con la venta de frutas y es notable que le ha ido muy bien, ella ha sabido ganarse a sus clientes por la calidad de frutas que vende y por los precios que les ofrece.
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella cubre en un 100% sus gastos familiares,
en la actualidad ella no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente apra surtir mas su negocio, razon por la cual esta solicitando dicho credito
texts.en:
Yanci R. has sold fruit for a living for 3 years now. Her business is home-based and runs under the name of Frutas ROCIO. She has 3 dependent children and receives financial help from her ex-husband as 2 of the 3 children are his. Since the end of her marriage she decided to regain her independence and began selling fruit. She has done remarkably well as she knows how to draw in customers with the quality and reasonable prices of her produce. She covers 100% of her family expenses with this income and currently lacks the funds to buy more stock for her business, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of apples, grapes, melons, watermelons, bananas, oranges, plums, mangoes and plantains

loans.name: Izzatoi

texts.ru: Иззатой Ганиева  1961 года рождения. Имеет средне специальное образование. Она разведена.  Торгует  в магазине  различными материалами и  занавесками.  На рынке торгует почти 19 лет. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2006 года. Первый кредит получила за аренду помещения. Со временем выкупив магазин, и расширила ассортимент.
texts.en:
Izzatoi G. was born in 1961. She has a secondary specialist education. She is divorced. Izzatoi sells fabric and curtains at a store. She has traded at the market for almost 19 years. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2006. She got her first loan for space rental. Over time she has purchased the store and expanded her assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand assortment

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La Sra. Olga M. es cliente antigua, participó en el Grupo solidario D. tres peronsa llamado CONFITAL en 14 secuencias, pero por razones D. traslado D. actividad D. una D. las integrantes, el grupo se disolvió, a la fecha se encuentra en su quinta secuencia individual.La Sra Olga trabaja con Emprender desD. al año 2001, ella tiene una familia integrada por el esposo, quien trabaja D. constructor, y un pequeño hijo en edad escolar, tiene otros hijos que se encuentran casados y viven en otras zonas D. la ciudad, la crianza D. cerdos es su actividad desD. muy joven, ella los cria hasta cierta edad para luego venderlos a los carniceros, segun pedido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga M. D. M. has been a client for a long time. She participated in the three person support group called Confital in 14 periods, but because one of the members changed jobs, the group fell apart and currently is in its fifth individual period. Mrs. Olga has worked with Emprender since 2001. Her family is formed by her husband who works in construction and a young son of school age. She has other children who are married and live in other parts of the city. Since she was very young, she raised pigs until they were old enough to sell to butchers on request.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of balanced food

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu J. makes a living selling brewed alcohol, and is applying for a loan to buy more of the materials and ingredients she needs to make this beverage. She is 35 years old, married and has six children, all of whom are in school. With the additional income made possible by this loan, she plans to open up a bar. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy brewing materials and ingredients

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en:
This is Lamrana S., a local entrepreneur in Waterloo small-town, twenty miles from Freetown. She sells local produce like ground-nuts and beans. She has been in this business for ten years now but her business seems to be growing at a very slow pace. However, with the recent opening of an SMT branch, in partner with Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo small-town, Lamrana S. has applied for a loan of Le 3,000,000 to help boost her business.

Lamrana is age thirty-five, married with two children, both of whom are in secondary schools. Her husband is a driver. Lamrana was born in Koya, about forty-four miles from Freetown.  With this loan, she will travel as far as neighboring Guinea to buy local produce wholesale. This will enable her make a better profit, expand her business, and consequently improve her living standard.

loans.use: Buy wholesale produce

loans.name: Sabougnouma 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma 3 est  constitué de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Djambougou  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé,  sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leurs troisièmes collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits équipements et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 14  hectares.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma 3 group is composed of 10 married women who average 28 years of age and 2 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. They mainly grow peanuts and millet. They are seeking their third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans ended without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 14 hectares. After the harvest, the production is sold at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 85) per campaign.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 14 hectares

loans.name: Thérèse Khoudia

texts.fr: Thérèse Khoudia T. est âgée de 53 ans et mère de 03 enfants à sa charge. Son activité est le commerce de manioc. Elle veut un prêt pour la renforcer. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Thérèse Khoudia T., age 53, is the mother of three children in her care. Her business involves commerce in cassava. She wants a loan to bolster her business. Her revenues allow her to help with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell yuca (cassava)

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: M. K. Hope is a 45 year old business woman.  She is a mother of three children, they are at school. She aims at educating her children and enlarging on her business.  She has been running a retail shop for ten years. She plans to use the loan to purchase more items in her shop: soap, sugar, salt, flour, sweets, biscuits, match boxes, etc especially essentials.

loans.use: To purchase more items in her shop

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa P., 50 years of age, is married to Selpio P., a motorcycle driver. They have four children, two of whom are high school students and the other two are in college. The family presently resides at Ramon Magsaysay, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rufa started her membership in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) on May 11, 2007. Her first business is a sari-sari (general store), and after that she opened a new business which is a "carinderia" (a little restaurant). The purpose of her loan is to add capital to her business. This is her third loan from PMPC. She is a member in good standing.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Happiness is the mother of four children. She is a petty trader who sells foodstuffs like garri (a granular flour made from cassava roots), rice, beans, pepper, Maggi (seasonings) and others. For the past 10 years, she has been in this business. She resides in Lagos State, Nigeria, and is 30 years old.

Happiness has been with LAPO Micro-finance for three years and is requesting the loan amount of N160,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and expand her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Micro-finance for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Amparo Libertad

texts.es:
Amparo de ocupación vivandera cuenta con una pensión en el domicilio de sus suegros ubicado en la zona Yunguyo de El Alto, donde vende pollos a la brosther y silpanchos, el esposo trabaja como costurero en un taller particular tiene un hijo en edad escolar.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de víveres por cantidad, para incrementar sus ingresos familiares y poder cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado por Amparo.

loans.use: CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES

loans.name: Hiet

texts.en: Mrs. Hiet N. lives in Trapeang Pring village in Takeo province. She is a grocer and now she wants to expand her business by purchasing more grocery goods. Her husband, Mr. Heng Chreng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a bicycle repairer. Mrs. Hiet N. is 37 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando L. de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, María de 11 años , Karla de 8 años y Stefanni de 4 años de edad. Hace quince años Fernando inicio su negocio, tras muchos años de experiencias ganados trabajando en el oficio de carpintero. Es así como ahora maneja su propia carpintería donde le apoya su esposa y una sobrina, Fernando elabora variedad de muebles en madera para luego ser lucidos a las afuera de su negocio, donde muchos clientes le visitan. El destino del crédito que solicita Fernando, es para comprar un material el cual le están vendiendo a buen precio, así obtendrá mayores ganancias de los productos que comercialice.
texts.en:
Fernando L., 53 years old, lives with his wife and their three children, María, 11; Karla, 8; and Stefanni, 4. Fifteen years ago, Fernando started his business after many years of prior experience in the field of carpentry. Today, he owns and manages his own carpentry shop with the help of his wife and a niece. Fernando makes a variety of wooden furniture, which are then displayed outside his shop where many customers visit. This loan will be used to buy materials, which are now available at a good price. This will allow better profits on the products he makes.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for carpentry shop

loans.name: Masjed Wali Asr Group

texts.en: This is the Masjed Wali Asr Group made up of four members. Gull Agha is the group leader of Masjed Wali Asr Group. He is a young boy who is a driver. other four members have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. Marzia who is the second member of Masjed Wali Asr Group is busy in weaving. The third member, Nafis Gull, is also busy in weaving and the last member, Sughra, is busy with embroidery work. All of them want to increase their stock and buy some other tools. Gull Agha is sure that they can repay the loan on time and he can control the whole group. He would like to thank everybody who helps with this loan process in Afghanistan. They all would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase stock and buy tools

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita, 50, is the mother of two children. She provides for the needs of her family through rice farming. With difficulty in life, she needs financial support for additional capital for her farm. She is grateful in joining Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because she is able to request a loan of 15,000 Php to provide for farm inputs such as fertilizer. This loan will be very helpful to finance her business at a low interest rate.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 32-year-old married woman. Though she does not have a child of her own, she cares for some of her nieces. She lives with her husband and nieces in a rented apartment in Axim, which is situated along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. In this particular region, the majority of the population is engaged in the fishing business.

To earn a living, Anita is a hair-dresser. She has some apprentices who are training under her. Her shop is conveniently located by the road side in her community. Anita has been in business for seven years, and she is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,075 to buy more working materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional materials (e.g.,artificial hair)

loans.name: Erlan

texts.es:
Erlan trabaja como albañil, es viudo y tiene tres hijos de siete, cinco y tres años de edad. Erlan vive con su madre quien le colabora con el cuidado de sus  hijos. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para compra mercadería; su difunta esposa le dejó un puesto de venta de chifleria (material de curanderos y sahumerios). Erlan reactivará la actividad mencionada, de esa forma podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos para la manutención de sus familia.
 
Es el primer crédito con Kiva, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por Erlan.
texts.en:
Erlan works as a bricklayer. He is a widower, and he has three children. They are seven, five, and three years old. Erlan lives with his mother, and she helps him take care of the children. He lives in his parents’ house, which is located in the Villa Esperanza area of the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy merchandise. His deceased wife left him a stand selling medicinal herbs (material used by folk healers and in traditional ceremonies). Erlan will restart this business. That way he will be able to improve his income to support his family. This is his first loan with Kiva. The completed evaluation grants Erlan access to the loan he has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy natural curative products to reactivate the business his wife had

loans.name: Corazon Salvaje Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Corazón Salvaje” esta representado por la señora Carmen Alicia y conformada por 12 miembros que se caracterizan por ser padres y madres de familia, que trabajan constantemente, para  poder sacar adelante a su familia y sus negocios, para así poder cumplir con sus obligaciones y mejorar los ingresos para el sustento de sus hogares. Entre las actividades que realizan para generar sus ingresos esta la venta de venta de comida, venta de ropas, servicio domestico y promotoras de cosméticos por catálogo, los  varones se dedican  a  la   actividad del trasporte, albañilería y el empleo en empresas. La  competencia  en respeto  a sus negocios es fuerte, ya que las señoras y caballeros trabajan duro y requiere un esfuerzo y sacrificio adicional para poder generar sus ingresos, además tienen que competir con negocios fuertes y ya establecidos en áreas comerciales como ser restaurantes, boutiques,  pero nada de eso los desanimen a seguir adelante, mas a lo contrario la competencia  les obliga a trabajar mejor para poder llegar a tener éxito por ende progreso económico.  El crédito será utilizado en agrandar sus negocios para poder brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes por lo que tendrán que incrementar su mercadería y mejorar sus herramientas de trabajo. Los socios tiene buena experiencia ya que la gran mayoría de las personas han trabajado en grupos similares, por lo que saben como manejar los fondos para que estos puedan generar una mejora en sus negocios y así mejorar sus ingresos para el sustento de sus familias.
texts.en:
The community bank “Corazón Salvaje” (Wild Heart) is respresented by Mrs. Carmen Alicia and made up of 12 members who are mothers and fathers who work non-stop in order to improve their families’ lives and their businesses, so they can complete their responsibilities and increase their earnings to sustain their families. Among the jobs that the members hold are selling food, selling clothing, housecleaning, and cosmetics sales. The men work in transportation, brick-laying and as employees for different companies. There is a lot of job competition so they must work hard and make additional sacrifices in order to generate income. They also have to compete against strong, established businesses like restaurants and boutiques, but this does no discourage them. The competition only makes them work better in order to have economic success.
